Title: Overall happy, complaints too minor to affect buying decision
ReviewText: I am so far happy with it. Small design changes wish Lenovo would address in future versions. I thik I keep hitting the ctrl key in the lower left but am hitting the function key. they should switch places. Also the function key has an indicator light ... why? it never goes off. It would make more sense for the capslock key to have an indicator light. I can never tell when I'm typing passwords if I accidentally hit caps lock or not because there is no notice whether it is activated or not. And last thing is understanding some new gestures. Both when I use the touchscreen and the touchpad, sometimes when I'm swiping left right to scroll the screen over, it actually switched apps, then I can't get the window/app back that I wanted.

Title: and thus far I absolutely love it. The SSD is quiet and I don't ...
ReviewText: I've had my laptop for 2 months, and thus far I absolutely love it. The SSD is quiet and I don't have to worry about it breaking anytime soon. It's easy to setup and use, and the screen quality is excellent. I also love the backlight on the keyboard. It's a minor detail but makes a major difference when using the computer at night.

Title: Very good computer build, easy to upgrade.
ReviewText: Good basic build, SIMPLE to upgrade. This particular model is a nice build, with removable battery, and easy access to hard drive and memory for upgrading to higher GB SSD, and more memory.. Backlight keyboard is nice feature, I would not get a computer without backlight keyboard. It is a thin, lightweight computer case, and if this same exact model came in a 17 inch, I would buy it in a second. I upgraded the SSD in this one to 500GB and upgraded the memory to 16GB, and it runs lightening fast. Good price. I looked a newer models, and noted that cracking the case to upgrade is a pain. Wish Dell would keep that in mind, but I guess that's too much to hope for. This model came with Windows 10 Home and I upgraded to Windows Pro, as it allows you to turn off some annoying settings forced on you by Windows 10. They have a long way to go on that operating system, believe me. But I recommend the computer, itself.

Title: Lenovo can't support this dock
ReviewText: I purchased this dock for use with a very high end P71 workstation for CAD and 3D modeling work. Title: Great sound, great mic for $50!

Title: I'm deaf but it's all good.
ReviewText: As the headline will describe, they cancel out sound when you have sound coming through. Let me start with the overall design. The cord itself is pretty durable and haven't had any ripping or tearing from having it dangle from a USB port most of the time. It has a volume dial on its cord to turn the volume up and down. So turn the sound on your PC all the way up like you would and use this thing to be more helpful. On this dial there is a couple of buttons: One to turn the "vibration" from the Bass off, and one to turn the microphone off. The headphones themselves have what I can only describe, at the moment of this writing, a "cup" design that covers the entire ear. This can sometimes irritate the sides of your ears and could be due to the "vibration" from the Bass mimicking, what I can describe as, having subwoofer style bass from a car. This is quite nice but some might not like it so the aforementioned button on the volume dial can turn this off. While on the topic of the speakers, the sides of these speakers emit light in the form of the logo for MSI that comes out in a bright red color--which compliment my laptops color as well. The headphones have a stretch design that will fit any size and can even wrap around your head while wearing a hat, snapback, etc. (So, for the streamers.) That's all for the headphones themselves but included with them is software to make them really standout because without it the PC will treat them as regular headphones and the sound will be terrible. If you have a laptop with no CD drive like me, you can hop onto their website and download the utility program from there, comes with the driver. One last thing to mention is the microphone. It's pretty good and does a good job of only capturing your voice with other sounds in the room (like a fan in the summer). Definitely, really good for a headset mmicrophone and my friends online can hear me beautifully but I still wouldn't compare it to any real high quality microphone. In short, the headset is well made and I would recommend it to anyone looking for better than average headphones.

Title: Do Not Buy!  Broken Hinge Problems on Y50 Touch
ReviewText: Within two weeks of owning this laptop, it literally began falling apart. When opening the laptop, the left hinge began popping out of place causing the plastic around the monitor to also come loose to the point that glass screen is now separated from the monitor and now the laptop can't even be opened without fear of breaking the screen. The laptop was never dropped or handled inappropriately in any way. Once the hinge began creaking and popping every time I opened it the problem became worse. After searching Lenovo repair message forums, it became clear the broken hinge problem is a manufacturer's defect that is known to affect the Y50 touch model. I called both the Lenovo support line and a local computer repair center to see what my options for repair were and both were familiar with the problem I had with this computer. To repair, the entire monitor needs to be replaced either by returning to Lenovo or an authorized repair center, with no guarantee it won't happen again. Worse, Lenovo would not guarantee that the problem was under warranty or that I wouldn't be charged for the repair. Beyond disappointed, spent $1200 for this laptop that is not as well made as a $200 chromebook. Beware of buying. I've returned this item to Amazon for a refund and will never buy Lenovo again.

Title: Great Laptop At A Great Price
ReviewText: This laptop is worth the money. I have only had it for a few days and it is running smoothly. All the games I have played on it I can run at the highest graphic settings with no loss of FPS. The 240Hz screen is amazing but I can really only notice the difference when using a web browser and not when gaming. Maybe people who have used these types of screens before could easily pick up the differences when gaming but a average consumer probably would not. The computer boots up fast as well as opens and closes programs fast, unlike my previous laptop. To top it off the computer has a really good cooling system as when playing Marvel Avengers on very high graphic settings the temperature stays somewhere between the high 70s to low 80s. All in all if you want to save some money but still get a high end gaming laptop then this is the choice for you.

Title: Look up Killer components and software before buying
ReviewText: So this comes with some Killer components for the Wifi. I wont write pages upon pages here you can look up the issues. All I can say is I have spent 20+ hours trying to fix this and I cannot. Windows updater keeps updating and auto installing this software which trashes your internet connection and even when I follow Killers official instruction on their website it doesn't stop it. Microsoft has an option in windows to disable auto updating drivers and apps and its still happening. The weirdest part is it does not show up in programs to uninstall, but when I search for it the program is there and I can go to it. But I cannot uninstall it even with the killer official uninstaller. Ive blown so much time on this issue I am frustrated beyond belief and I believe the end result is that I will have to return this computer and make sure the next one I buy has no killer components. Its just so shady beyond belief. An auto installed program you can't stop or uninstall that does not detect as a program with anything not even third party uninstallers.

Title: Used a cheap excuse to avoid warranty coverage
ReviewText: I had recently imported an MSI GE66 laptop from the US to UAE. Had just used it for a few days when a bios issue came up and the computer failed to start. I contacted MSI and they told me to send it to an authorised service centre in Dubai (Jumbo electronics). Jumbo assured me that they would repair the laptop, but just needed confirmation of the warranty from MSI. However, MSI responded that I needed to have visited the states and needed me to show the flight ticket as proof. I had brought this laptop paying all the import duties and shipping taxes of about 200 dollars. This is the first time Iâ€™ve heard that an international warranty needs a proof of visitation to be valid. Am I in the wrong here, or did MSI just cheat me of an extra 230 bucks? Iâ€™m so upset and angry cause Iâ€™ve done months of research before buying this laptop, and now it feels like Iâ€™ve been scammed by them. The laptop as such is excellent but Iâ€™m very disappointed in their customer service.

Title: not worth the price

ReviewText: After spending nearly $1000.00 for this laptop, hours on the phone, and days trying to apply the pages and pages of instructional fixes sent by email from ASUS, I called Amazon Tech Support, and after spending over an hour on the phone, including 30 minutes on hold while he tried to contact ASUS Tech Support, was told that he could not help me. He told me my choices were to try again later or return the laptop. I asked him if I would still get a full refund and he assured me I would. For an original cost of $974.74, I received a refund of $794.74, The WiFi, Sound, and Camera were dissatisfactory. with other devices all maintaining WiFi connectivity, this laptop lost continuously lost connection. The sound quality was very poor, and when in a Zoom meeting, the picture displayed thru it's camera would flicker and then show only a green screen while all other zoom members' photos were stable.

Title: Stopped Working in less than 1 Month
ReviewText: Ordered this laptop in May (5/19) and received 6/4. No problems setting up. Everything worked great. Used the computer for about a week. Love everything about it. Everything was functioning well. Came back to use and it will not turn on. No lights. No response to power button. Just cold dead. Had not been moved, no damage, on a surge protector. Never had a computer act this way before. Very disappointed and having problems getting support through ASUS. I bought 2 of these - one for my son through Best Buy, and this one for myself through Amazon. His is fine. Good thing I saved the box. Hope ASUS makes good on the warranty. Hope you have better luck.

According to our testing, this laptop handles the GPU and CPU bound tasks very well, handling CAD programs like SolidWorks without issue. There are a couple of drawbacks though. The trackpad was noted as being too sensetive, often being activated by the users palm while typing, and the unit has no webcam. Ultimately, we decided to return this laptop in favor of a different model, (mostly because of the webcam) but that's mostly our fault for not checking before purchase. Otherwise, I would be happy to own this machine personally.

Title: Really Poor Display Panel Choice by Asus, and 20% Re-stocking Fee
ReviewText: I hope this review helps someone in their decision-making. I loved everything I could know about this laptop from the Amazon listing and the ASUS website. Here's what I wish I knew: The display on this laptop is HORRIBLE for showing the spectrum of colors in the color spaces. Now, I know this is primarily a gaming laptop, but with the CPU and the Video Card, this machine processes data for photo and video editing very well - EXCEPT, you can't really tell what color the final product will be. I've attached pictures to show why. I didn't know any of this before I bought the laptop, I just am finally buying my first new laptop since 2005, and had one "hand me down" in between, so I was really excited to do some photo editing especially on this machine. Sadly, the choice that ASUS made of a display panel is horrible when it comes to colors - so if you need any depth or accuracy of colors, here's a quick flyover of what I've learned. The attached images show the spec sheets of two display panels - one is the stock display that comes on the A17, the other is a display panel from the same manufacturer, using the same size, interface connection (40 pin, .5mm eDP connection), but with HUGE differences in the color space - probably for only a little bit more in production cost. Note, I'm not an expert, and I'd love to hear from the Asus team why they made this choice, but the difference in color space is astounding. The stock display only shows 47% of the Adobe RGB color space, while the other one that I listed shows 75% of the Adobe RGB color space - that's a huge difference (see other images for explanations of color spaces and what colors this will affect on your screen - mostly reds and greens - and I found that reds are way off - look more orange because the display just can't physically display much of the red spectrum). So, for the trolls who might say, "It's a gaming laptop, not a creator laptop," that is true - and it is advertised as such. But cost increase on those creator laptops is significant, so that's why I really had hoped this would work well for these applications. Now that I have this knowledge, I could have made a better decision perhaps. But I didn't have this information. It is VERY difficult to find these color space ratings (or even the stock manufacturer model of the display) to make the choice. I even e-mailed one manufacturer about the specifics of the color space on their laptop, and the rep didn't know... so this is the primary problem - finding the information. I wish that Amazon, or at least manufacturers, would make the listing of the NTSC or Adobe RGB or even the sRGB ratings a part of their listing - like stand-alone monitor manufacturers often do. So, why don't I return it? Well, I actually filled out the Amazon return and was ready to do just that, until I read the form that you get for return when you complete the process. There's a 20% re-stocking fee by this distributor... so I guess I'll have to live with this laptop. It's too bad, because it's like buying a brand-new corvette with a cracked and hazed over windshield that you can't replace - it drives great, you just can't really see where you are going... and that's the Asus TUF A17 for you when it comes to the display. If you do buy it, there is a cool setting in the Radeon software that controls the "Import Snap Settings" - so I can adjust the color settings for contrast, brightness, and hue, and then save that as a snap setting, which I can then import. So, I tweaked and made a few profiles for high contrast for office apps, best I could do for photos, and a few others. That helps take away the pain a little bit. SO, I hope this review helps someone make an informed decision. Meanwhile, Asus, if you're listening, please do better! My last laptop was an ASUS and I was thrilled with it. This one, not so much. That little 50 to 100 dollar corner you cut on the screen, and the failure to at least list this compromised color space on your specs, has seriously affected my view of your brand. Again, I hope this helps somebody. Have a great day!

Title: Great Laptop
ReviewText: I have yet to see a review for the 120hz, 17.3" screen, so i figured i would provide one. It comes as advertised with a few extras. I have only had this laptop for about 24 hours now, so take this review as you will. Out of the box, i decided to add another M.2 drive i had. The advertised pop-open screw did help, but it was still a pain to get a tool in the space to pop open the rest. After checking the box, i found it also came with a 2.5in SSD adapter with the motherboard flat cable (not sure what its called). It also came with 4 mounting screws. While it appears you can attach a 2.5" to the motherboard, i could not find space for it to mount and have the bottom sealed again (perhaps a bit more research). The Ryzen 7 4800H processor is blazing fast comparative to my previous i7. The AC wifi has been consistent and pulling/pushing incredible speeds. I was able to dowload and install about a 1/2 TB worth of software, simultaneously, within about 90 to 120 min. This model does come with the ROG Amoury Crate software where you can manage profiles for your games. I found the fan noise is slightly better than that of my previous generation A17 TUF Gaming laptop. I find the adaptive sync screen is actually not as bad as everyone is saying. Amoury Crate profiles help to adjust your color balance and screen brightness quite well (i have yet to test games, but will within the next 24 hours). I have also ordered a DP to USB-C adapater, so i will let you know of VR compatability as well (Oculus Rift S). The sound is a bit better than previous generations as well, though still not great. As with the 15.6" models, it also came with DTS Sound Unbound which works spectacular with my Bose QC35 headphones. Hope this was helpful to those considering this laptop. So far, i am extremely impressed and glad i waited for it. Best bang for buck as well!

Title: No support so far, hard to read documentation, can't boot from USB
ReviewText: I downloaded the manual from the ASUS website. It's not detailed enough for me and the screenshots on some of the pages are very difficult to read. I also can't find any advanced technical documentation.

Title: Great computer, one big flaw
ReviewText: This is truly a great gaming laptop, especially for the price, but the touchpad and cursor sensitivity are awful. Even with the sensitivity settings turned all the way up in the options, the cursor drags and sometimes the buttons get stuck, which is downright unacceptable. I'll have to get a mouse for it.

Title: Worth every penny!
ReviewText: I needed a new laptop for my small business because the one I owned was so slow and continued to freeze when opening programs while working with my clients. This laptop is so fast at start up and has continued to run smoothly since I've had it. It has taken so much stress out of my day to say because it works so seamlessly. It is worth every dollar.

Title: Excellent value and powerful computer
ReviewText: Good bang for the buck. Extremely fast with all the features you could ever want without the cost of some of the other brands. It will keep up with whatever you throw at it.

Title: May be a fake
ReviewText: Kept freezing from day 1. Eventually i sent it to Lenovo for warranty repair. They found "UNIT HAS A 3RD PARTY SSD THAT IS CAUSING CX ISSUE. TO RESOLVE ISSUE CX SHOULD REPLACE WITH LENOVO SSD." I dont even know if they sold me a Lenivi or some fake garbage

Title: Fantastic
ReviewText: I have had this laptop for 3 weeks now and itâ€™s been great. It starts up quickly and runs all the programs efficiently. Iâ€™m very pleased with all it has done so far.

Title: Great PC!
ReviewText: It arrived quickly and with all of its components -- beautiful, sleek and fast machine!

Title: Amazing - Exactly as represented
ReviewText: The Z2 is an amazing platform - I needed them (2) for multi-displays. Bought 3 less powerful PCs that I returned, and decided to try 2 of these. What a difference! Amazing power and speed. Lots of ports. Up to date technology. Highly recommended.

Title: Fast and stable
ReviewText: Installed xubuntu on this beast, didn't have a single issue getting CUDA drivers working, and it's running machine learning research like a dream. I've been maxing out the CPU and GPU since it came in, and no stability out heat issues.

Title: Future Proof Build
ReviewText: This is a great build that should be future proof for a couple years. I have it for 2 months now and have not had any issues. Works great and is really fast for my causal gaming of Warzone. Definitely would recommend.

Title: Powerful it awful sound
ReviewText: The GP65 Leopard is a powerful laptop, able to run any game I threw at it on high settings. Additionally the keyboard is enjoyable to use, as the keys had a nice cushion to them and per key RGB. The screen was also well designed, sturdy and crisp.

Title: Great screen and highend parts but failed after a few weeks.
ReviewText: Works well and great monitor very colorful without any calibration only downside is hdmi port its a 1.4 and dp is 1.2 so only good for 1080 output and display port is only limited too but works well no overheating keyboard is good and responsive only negative that i see is that it only had 2 harddrive ports the stock harddrive and a 2.5 it has markings on the board for a nvme gen 4 but doesnt have the bracket it came with 2 extra screws so unsure what they are for but overall works great and should last battery lasts longer if you close msi dragoncenter and set the settings in windows power i got around 4 - 4 1/2 hours on battery saver with cpu now days they are fast enough to use when you turn down settings to save power and still get enough speed for casual use cant see why many would game on the battery capacity anyways since it wouldnt last long enough to use plus would kill batter faster maybe there will be a 3rd party battery company later for increased capacity since this model is new still mine was made a month before i ordered it so should last atleast a year before needing to upgrade again unlike desktops cant upgrade longer

Title: FPS
ReviewText: Msi did a good job putting this machine together it has a beautiful display and design. The RBG looks cool. But the best part of this machine is the hardware. High end cpu and gpu. I can play Pubg at over 100+fps on ultra settings with no problems. I have also played fortnite at over 130+fps on epic settings. The fans can get some what loud at times but nothing crazy its a gaming laptop. Also this thing is fast. I would suggest adding more space and ram down the road for even better experience. High end pc for midrange price. Its a steal.

Title: As a video editor this gaming beast has been a definitive homerun! Tip to improve thermals include.
ReviewText: Tip: setting my minimum and maximum processor state to less than 100% (I set mine to 95%) in the power options helps cool down the CPU by a considerable amount and keeps the fan from going crazy at random.

Title: Top notch machine!
ReviewText: Absolutely love this laptop! It kills everything I throw at it! Got it mainly for VR and I can play Half-Life: Alyx on ultra settings with zero lag! Definitely worth the price tag, Donâ€™t hesitate to buy! Sellers shipped super fast and package was packed well.

Title: So Far So Good
ReviewText: I have had this laptop a little over a month and thus far its been stellar. Game loading is super quick, the webcam has amazing HD quality. Booting it up is super fast as is shutting down the laptop.

Title: Good purchase. Iâ€™d give it 4.99 stars (why in the description)
ReviewText: Read full description for explanations.

Title: Loud but unbeatable value
ReviewText: Out of the box its beautiful. Much more slim and sleek than previous versions and overall just a lot more streamlined. The display is just absolutely spectacular. The value for what you get it great. For 1k its kind of unbeatable. But that doesn't come without problems, (cons below)

Title: Good all around computer
ReviewText: Good gaming laptop for the money. I recieved it early and in 5 mins of turning it on everything was up and running and all updates installed. Playing mechwarrior5 demo it ran the game on high cool boost kicked in but I expected it as it is a graphic hog. The ssd is pretty fast the only issue is low storage space thus the 4 star. The video card is a bit dated but seams to hold up pretty well in msi afterburner stress test. So a solid gamer puter for travel or if you have a boring job.

Title: Great hardware value, however the touchpad could improve.
ReviewText: The internal hardware is great. You won't find a better value for a 6-core i7-9750H and 1660Ti.

Title: Magnificient beast!!
ReviewText: Extremely fast and responsive laptop. Very happy with the purchase. Specs of the device received is exactly what was advertised. I have been using this for a few weeks now for over 10 hours a day for work and streaming - no issues whatsoever. You will have to update the firmware and Windows 10 once you boot up the first time but it is automatically done, just have to be patient and let it complete - takes a couple of hours. If you are on the fence due to the high price tag, don't wait. You get what you pay for and this magnificient beast of a laptop is so worth the price. Go for it!!

Title: Great Professional Laptop, Worth the money
ReviewText: Amazing computer. Works perfectly, the user is very happy. Hard to find great laptops for business during this time and this for the bill great. Price seemed fair as well for the specs and fast shipping time.

Title: Good resolution
ReviewText: Lightweight - good resolution - good battery life

Title: Es una sÃºper mÃ¡quina de trabajo
ReviewText: Para trabajo es sÃºper buena

Title: Great compact computer.
ReviewText: We used this to replace an old Windows Seven machine that was hosting our building access control database. We wanted a small form factor compact computer and this worked perfectly.

Title: Small and Snappy
ReviewText: Great product snappy quick parts for it are usually cheap. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for small but snappy computer

Title: What a great powerful computer
ReviewText: Iâ€™m running my music studio on this PC with O% issues.

Title: Good value for the money
ReviewText: The one I received would crash every so often. Sent back without a problem.

Title: Fast and stable
ReviewText: Installed xubuntu on this beast, didn't have a single issue getting CUDA drivers working, and it's running machine learning research like a dream. I've been maxing out the CPU and GPU since it came in, and no stability out heat issues.

Title: Future Proof Build
ReviewText: This is a great build that should be future proof for a couple years. I have it for 2 months now and have not had any issues. Works great and is really fast for my causal gaming of Warzone. Definitely would recommend.

Title: A solid single board small form factor PC
ReviewText: I've had my i3 NUC in service for a few weeks now acting as an always on docker server. I have it outfitted with 16GB of Crucial RAM and a 256GB Sabrent NVME drive (also purchased on Amazon, it doesn't come with RAM or an SSD by design!). Performance and stability has been perfect and its inaudible 99% of the time in a normal home environment, however I am not fully pushing it to its limit so far.

Title: Tiny PC that can go.
ReviewText: For the very reason I bought it, and that's to serve as my kids room PC, it performs superbly. It's fast enough. Will even play Xbox PC games without a nary of complaint. It does warm up and the fans run when it's being stressed (even using the silent profile).

Title: Great Value Computer
ReviewText: Amazing little computer! Being used as a web server and is only drawing 15 watts. Case is also cool with no detectable heat.

Title: Good small machine for home theater setup
ReviewText: I used to have an nuc5 i3 version to connect with my TV. I'm not looking for powerful machine, just some laptop to help me download some movie and streaming YouTube with browser. This one works prefect for me. You need to know what you are looking for. The only complaint is the cable is chunky compare to the little machine. If they could make it like Mac. it will be perfect

Title: good unit easy setup but issue with video hdmi driver
ReviewText: this nuc is easy to setup and install drive and memory in couple of minutes. performance was very good using 8GB ram and ssd drive. Only issue was flickering with 4k monitor that you can only correct by unplugging and replugging hdmi cable. it occurs on windows 10 when it changes graphic modes at boot. Also does not go into sleep correctly which also is most likely due to video driver issue. All windows drivers were installed from clean install of most current windows 10 and corresponded to the drivers intel has posted on their download site for these units. Apart from that these units work really well.

Title: Decent performance couldnâ€™t use for intended purpose
ReviewText: This is a nice little nuc it performed well with windows however if you want to use it for Sophos firewall I could not after trying multiple ways get it to boot or install Sophos firewall software so I ended up having to return it.

Title: Easy setup, works as advertised
ReviewText: Easy to assemble (you need to buy your own RAM and SSD). Works flawlessly for its purpose.

Title: Exactly what I needed
ReviewText: Using it for a Ubuntu server, its quiet, speedy for its size, takes up little room in my basement.

Title: Great laptop
ReviewText: I got this as a replacement for an ancient laptop, and it's been fantastic. No problems at all. Very quick to boot, not loaded with too much bloatware out of the box. Doesn't overheat too easily, and very good battery life even under heavy usage. Highly recommended.

Title: Great laptop
ReviewText: I got this as a replacement for an ancient laptop, and it's been fantastic. No problems at all. Very quick to boot, not loaded with too much bloatware out of the box. Doesn't overheat too easily, and very good battery life even under heavy usage. Highly recommended.

Title: if i could give 4.5
ReviewText: this computer is fast easy to setup with minimal bloatware, its got 2 lenovo products on it one of which is for driver updates, and an overall great deal for the money. I use this computer both for recreational and business use. Recreationally i play games from steam like portal and the borderland series both on high detail with minor if any lag or issue. Business wise i do audio and visual recording and editing and have not run into any issues. The only thing that i would take 1/2 a point off for is that the fan does get quite loud when running a lot at once, though i will say the fan definitely works as i have yet to find it getting any warmer than any other laptop. overall this is a great laptop for a great price.

Title: Great simple laptop !!
ReviewText: Great laptop, fast, not cluttered with bloatware, built sturdy, super light, perfectly happy with it for a $500 laptop. A few cons...bad speakers, lots of bass and don't get loud, and the batter does not last long. But for what I paid...Perfectly happy with it !!!

Title: Quick laptop at a bargain price.
ReviewText: I first went to buy this laptop at Microcenter for$550 but they couldn't find the last one the system said they had. I then found it here on Amazon for only $50 more. The laptop is thin, light, sturdy and quick. Sound is good and the dedicated graphics card with its own memory is a big plus for this price point. I ordered this computer 2 days ago and it was delivered today. Quick shipping is always good. Definitely a good deal.

Title: Inability to wake up moves rating from 5 to 3.5
ReviewText: Aesthetically this laptop is great. The speed is sufficient for my needs and generally I am satisfied with the performance. However, there is one irritant. When it goes to sleep, it often does not wake up regardless of how many keys are depressed. I then have to turn it off and back on. This is not good and so instead of a 5, I'd give a 3.5

Title: Great value
ReviewText: Great value laptop. Does everything I need and looks nice.

Title: Overall decent computer and does the job
ReviewText: This computer has a really nice picture resolution and it's extremely lightweight, which I appreciate because I hate lugging around a heavy computer. It's also fast. I took two stars off because sometimes it will just refuse to wake when I open it and will not respond to any keyboard buttons. When it does this I have to use the power button to shut it down completely and then turn it back on again. This has happened numerous times already and it's only 2 months old. Also this computer gets super super hot. I'm afraid it's going to melt the plastic jack on my headphones. I can't touch certain areas of the keyboard and I use a pillow under it so it doesn't touch my legs because it's like a stove top. However this computer will do what you need it to do.

Title: Future Proof Build
ReviewText: This is a great build that should be future proof for a couple years. I have it for 2 months now and have not had any issues. Works great and is really fast for my causal gaming of Warzone. Definitely would recommend.

Title: Incorrect Description and graphic card not fount
ReviewText: The CPU on the web showing 2.1 GHz and I got 1.8 GHz. The second issue is the graphic card â€œNVIDIAâ€ is not working. When turned on my laptop I got this message error â€œNVIDIA NOT FOUNDâ€.

Title: Great pc!
ReviewText: Great pc.

Title: LOVE IT!
ReviewText: Love this laptop! Thin, sleek and a power house!

Title: Beware: may come packaged with a budget SSD
ReviewText: I bought a NUC 10 with the goal of starting a simple home lab, this machine will be running VMs. Other users in the answers indicated they received a NUC with an NVMe SSD which would be ideal for a simple virtualization server.

Title: Poor, poor, quality ram and SSD.
ReviewText: Disappointed with the sellers equipment selection. Of course the series 10i7 chip is top notch, but found the two 8gB memories to be of the cheapest, slowest quality and mismatched by brand and speed. While it included a 500GB SSD, it did not make clear if it was sata or NVMe. What shipped was a low quality no-name SATA only available on eBay. As a result I will be replacing both the SATA and RAM with better quality items. Very miffed they would sell a top quality NUC and processor with junk components. I didn't expect the best ram and SSD, but these fall so far below as to be worthless.

Title: Everything great except for the worst imaginable SSD
ReviewText: The Intel NUC computer was shipped quickly and setup easily. While testing the computer I noticed that every component performed well except for the Solid State Drive (SSD). The benchmark software gave it a rating of 3925 which was equivalent to the worst SSD performance Iâ€™ve seen in a decade. I checked the drive for errors and found none. The drive is just UNBELIEVABLY SLOW. It makes the computer perform poorly for many tasks (including booting).

Title: Sold on these NUC systems. My third one.
ReviewText: My first NUC was an i5 with 8GB memory and 256GB SSD. My daughter has that one now (not sure how old).

Title: Initial impression
ReviewText: This little box screams power especially coming from a 9 year old Toshiba laptop. Even though I upgraded it to a SSD and doubled the RAM, it is just not able to keep up, but this NUC 10, is like getting warp drive. I bought the 16gig of Ram and 512gig drive model and it turns on in seconds. Love it so far!

Title: Great little Windows HTPC, modest gamer
ReviewText: I've always had a PC connected to TV as an HTPC, browser, and occasional gamer. And along the way, I've had a lot of NUCs. The NUCs have something of a history in my house, sometimes being too noisy, too slow, too hot, or not good enough video. This one seems to have really nailed it, and for this price you get a solid system with Win10 Pro and some expansion room. I'm running everything 30' away with bluetooth keyboard+mouse. it is driving a 4k TV with no problem using a long-reach HDMI-over-fiber cable and an AV receiver in the middle.

Title: The product is defective
ReviewText: This is the second Intel Nuc Mini Pc that I purchased and had to be returned because both were defective. I won't purchase this brand again.

Title: New NUC Computer Support
ReviewText: purchased a new NUC 10th gen and I manage to mess up the hard drive. These guys gave me their number told me to call them and they were able to restore the hard drive for me. Extremely helpful! And the new computer is extremely kick ass! Thanks so much! - Cesar

Title: Boots up fast!
ReviewText: Excellent program response time, launches multiple apps without freezing (Adobe CS). Low-profile keyboard (great for fast typists), very accurate screen colors. The only thing I don't like is that the keyboard light is very dim.

Title: Fraud
ReviewText: The product is not the same as sold, it didn't came with the number keyboard, don't buy it!

Title: Fantastic Nugget
ReviewText: I like it more than any computer that I've bought in the past of couple of years. Should have been spending my $$$ on this instead of those other crappy ones (Lookin' at you Ryzen 1700, 3700).

Title: Skip it
ReviewText: Audio drivers do not work, much louder than I expected.

Title: Overheats and keeps crashing
ReviewText: This is a very nice system if only it would stop over heating and crashing. Despite ensuring it is clear of all obstructions it still crashes at least once a week. I have my TV as the monitor but I am not able to get the full message when it overheats. If any one has a suggestion please help. UPDATE: Now the LAN stopped working and only WiFi is running. Sent in for repair and they switched out the drives then returned it, but some how UNREGISTERED all my software.

Title: Extremely slow.  Won't work with Razer and Sonnet eGPU enclosures
ReviewText: Totally disappointed in this product. Has 10th gen i7 intel chip and 64gb RAM, but still very slow. Extremely slow. Won't work with Razer and Sonnet eGPU enclosures with Vega 64 or 5700 XT graphic cards. I regret the purchase. If I had to do it all over again, I should have just put the money into a MacBook Pro 13 or 16.

Title: Nice system for a home lab
ReviewText: Picked this up to build a new ESXi server for my home lab. Very quick system and I'm able to run about 10-12 virtual machines. Seller was super prompt and it arrive a day early.

Title: HP Envy17-T
ReviewText: Great laptop, really fast. It had everything I wanted in a 10th generation laptop. I had an issue with the laptop not powering on, but I contacted the seller and they assisted me in getting the issue resolved. Overall extremely satisfied with the laptop and support from the seller.

Title: This computer is awesome
ReviewText: What a difference in speed. This is just what I wanted. Very fast. Love it!

Title: I'm very happy with my new computer, just taking a few days to get it hooked up to my work network.
ReviewText: It works smoothly and beautifully, although it will take a bit to get used to something this fast! My old one had really slowed down. I just noticed today that there was a screw loose--when it snagged on my sleeve. Examination shows that the corresponding screw on the other side of the computer (both on the bottom) is missing. I'm fortunate that I have a set of computer tools and had a screwdriver that fit so I could put the protruding one back in...but have no idea where to get another one to replace the missing one.

Title: Nice Machine
ReviewText: I write short stories so needed a great (hopefully) keyboard. HP delivered. I have used Macs for years but wanted a PC to take with me on jaunts that would also work as good as a Macbook Pro. This does, so far. Being as the price is half of a Macbook I am happier with this than can be adequately expressed. The keyboard was almost instantaneous to get used to and I actually like it better than the Mac keyboards.

Title: Great work laptop!
ReviewText: I love my new laptop! It's perfect for my Accounting business. Easy to travel and plenty of power to get the job done. As for the fingerprint sensor it only works about half the time despite multiple angles and different fingers. It's probably just me, but I gave up on it and went back to the PIN.

Title: No audio driver installed on day 1 send it back
ReviewText: Donâ€™t buy Hp envy from amazon. This is the second one Iâ€™ve had to send back. First one was for me this second one was for my dad on Fatherâ€™s Day. It didnâ€™t come with the proper drivers installed and Iâ€™ve been on support for 4 hours. That was the only reason I gave it a star. The product is not reliable software. Now they are asking me to extend the warranty for free shipping. I literally just got it yesterday.

Title: Great transaction and product
ReviewText: Super fast shipping, even amidst all the Covid-19 situation. Easy set up and running great!

Title: Responsive
ReviewText: Responsive machine, just got it so I havenâ€™t used it a ton. When I am using it I can seamlessly go about my work, meaning it keeps up with me, I do not have to wait for it for the next prompt. The fingerprint reader it touchy, wonderful when it does work but is sensitive. Many times I have to enter the PIN anyways.

Title: Decent laptop
ReviewText: So far so good.

Title: Works as expected
ReviewText: I use it for home office and it performs as required.

Title: Amazing if you're a CG/3D Artist
ReviewText: I've had this model for about 2 weeks now and I have to say I am very impressed. My render times drastically dropped. Up till now I've had no lag while creating when having multiple instances of Maya open and Substance Painter. I personally only use it for 3d applications and will recommend it for this purpose. Obviously it's not the best for gaming, (Not designed for gaming) but it still runs anything you throw at it. I will update this review if something comes up, but at the moment I doubt I will ever have any complaints.

Title: nice computer
ReviewText: super fast, wish HDMI & power ports were on back. Also wish had a dedicated ethernet port.

Title: WARNING! DO NOT USE SPECIAL CHARACTERS TO LOCK YOUR BIOS!
ReviewText: Do not use special characters i.e. !@#$%^&* in your password when/if you lock your bios, you will no longer be able to access the bios since those characters aren't accepted as valid inputs when you go to unlock the computer. I have gone through the process of returning the item and ordering a replacement. I will update this review and star rating once I am able to fully test the machine for more than one day.

Title: Blue Screen of Death
ReviewText: Iâ€™ve had this laptop for less than two weeks and it has had to restart itself twice already (read blue screen of death). One error was page_fault_in_nonpaged_area and the other I did not record. I am so far very unsatisfied with the quality of this $4000 laptop. My ten year old MacBook Pro has only had three errors in its lifetime. How can I trust your product to serve my rendering needs for the next few years if it canâ€™t make it less than two weeks?

Title: Perfect all in one laptop for a power user or engineer
ReviewText: Ok so bank for the buck its perfect you get everything and some that you will need. The display even though it's not 4k can upscale easy to it for a monitor or TV, I do both. I absolutely love this, and I've used for just about every under the sun, video editing, cad work, school work of all kinds, gaming, movies and music player. I checks all of my shot of having a 4k screen. Also isnt terrible to travel with as I've do alot

Title: Great Laptop
ReviewText: Great products for use!

Title: Very good computer!!!
ReviewText: I was truly impressed on unboxing of this machine. I am impressed with Asus products.

Title: Portable monster!
ReviewText: Slim and powerful!

Title: Very very powerful Intel 10th gen Core i7 machine
ReviewText: Very very powerful Intel 10th Gen Core i7 machine. Great value for the money on a 2020 computer which started production only around June 2020. I wanted a desktop replacement which is somewhat portable and this was it. I upgraded the memory to 16 GB. There's only one slot, so took out the 8 GB and put in 16 GB. Highly recommend the memory upgrade, there are YouTube videos on how but I recommend using a nearby tech professional since laptops these days are highly integrated. My only concern before buying was the display but it turned out to be pretty good. Attached a picture of my ThinkPad on the left and MacBook on the right for display comparison. I run video editing software, CAD software, coding software, everything runs very smooth and quiet. When you place this laptop on a flat surface you'll see that the back is very slightly (1 mm) elevated, this is by design to allow for air flow cooling. All in all, love this Thinkpad, highly recommend.

Title: Glad I got it
ReviewText: I was really skeptical about this laptop because you get a lot of performance at a lower price than similar machines. This model sells for 1049.00 on other sites. It was exactly as listed and though it took 3 days instead of 2 to deliver, it was in perfect new condition.

Title: Happy so Far
ReviewText: We have just set up this computer. We are happy so far.

Title: GOOD DEAL ON A GREAT LAPTOP...BRAND NEW IN FACTORY SEALED BOX!
ReviewText: After reading many negative reviews from disappointed buyers of laptop computers, I was worried about getting a machine that was previously purchased, used, returned and then sold to me in an open box. I checked many sources and took my chances with this seller. I'm pleased to report that I couldn't be more pleased with my purchase. I got a current model year HP Pavillion Model #15-cs3065ci laptop computer brand new in an unopened and sealed box that I registered for the HP warranty without any surprises!

Title: HP 15.6 Excelente!

Title: This computer has fingerprint to open the computer
ReviewText: The motherboard on my old computer died and I was I. The market for a new one. After much consultation and thought and one wrong choice I chose this one because it had everything I wanted including 2 TB and windows 10 professional
Great laptop!

Title: Quality and Value
ReviewText: This little computer is a workhorse. For work I am calculating massive spreadsheets and database calculations and this thing handles it all. I got the 1 TB SSD and 64 MB of Ram and couldn't be happier. Compared to a new comparable model among competitors I paid about $1,000 less.

Title: Compact size
ReviewText: Full size power in a compact size computer. Everything works great. Super fast CPU, RAM and SSD. Make sure to get at least 16GB of memory.

Title: Big upgrade from my tandy 1000 hx

Title: Good Choice

Title: Horrible, horrible product. Broke after 1 month and 5 days.
ReviewText: The computer started making loud/abnormal sounds right after one month and five days, the seller wouldnâ€™t take responsibility and Amazon says itâ€™s our fault that it broke after the return time. My wife is a teacher and need her computer at this time, weâ€™re basically cheated out about $700 dollars. Guess we shouldâ€™ve never trust to buy expensive items online. Please read the reviews before you buy anything expensive because someone apparently had this problem as well.

Title: Excellent laptop
ReviewText: For the price point a fantastic buy. So many of the laptops today simply donâ€™t have the feel of something well built. The backlit keyboard and typing experience is excellent! Title: Good but some minor issues.
ReviewText: The laptop works great and does its job perfectly. I can play WOW and other games without any issues. I can add another 8Gbs of Ram and it will run flawlessly. I gave it 3 stars because the alpha decal started peeling after 2 days and I keep this bundled up like a newborn when I'm not using it. I messaged the seller a week after receiving the product and asked for a new decal to install myself and got no reply. After a few months and getting tired of being stabbed everytime I removed the laptop from the case I decided to just take the decal off. If you look at the picture you can see some of the edges are bent up from where the decal was peeling up at. Due to the lack of customer service and the cosmetic inconvenience I'm giving it three stars. If im going to spend nearly a thousand dollars on a product I expect all of it to be top quality.

Title: Well made and a pleasure to use.
ReviewText: This is my third Think Pad in the last 10 years, and I have purchased two others for work. They are consistently a reliable, high-end product. They have balanced the need for durability and weight nicely. The screen is sharp and it was easy to calibrate the colors to make them accurate for design work. I do not game on mine, but I do use several specialized design programs for architecture and quilting and they are a dream to use on this laptop -- enough screen , great color, and good speed. When I wear this one out in three years, I expect to get another and expect it to be even better.

I feel like I'm back in 1997 on AOL dial-up even though I have super high speed internet.

Title: Garbage .
ReviewText: It downloaded updates for 7 hours . Then stuff that was there before was gone . No Microsoft store anymore. Among a few things missing. Then it also would not download and install my Norton antivirus. Said I had to go through Microsoft store to get it. But couldn't bring it up. So I saw nothing but trouble with it so I returned it . Thank God they took it right back no trouble and got my money back. Shame because it was to replace my 6 year old Lenovo laptop which I never had trouble with . Title: Inaccurate, deceptive listing.
ReviewText: Item received was not the item listed. Description did not match laptop sent. No model number listed. Beware of this listing, you will probably not get what you think you are buying. Returned immediately for a refund. Would have been a good deal if item in the listing had been shipped.

Title: Good inexpensive laptop
ReviewText: Great price on a laptop with a lower-end CPU, nice sized SSD and lots of RAM. Pros: Excellent screen and sound. Good keyboard for a laptop. Small power brick. Quiet while in operation. Reasonably good available ports. Has a DVD burner. Cons: Loses one star for software issues, including that Windows comes in â€œS Modeâ€ which should be named â€œnothing works modeâ€, and terrible trackpad software that doesnâ€™t allow fixing the scroll direction without a registry edit. Would lose another star for all of the terrible changes in Windows 10 that Microsoft has inflicted upon us since it came out (like not being able to set a PC up without a Microsoft Account, and all of the various and sundry ways it spies upon you) but thatâ€™s not Lenovoâ€™s fault. Loses another star for the wretched trackpad hardware â€” way too sensitive and hard to use, and I use a trackpad on my work laptop every day. The rest of the hardware build seems very good so far.

Title: I wouldn't order from

Title: Great for work and play.
ReviewText: Got this for my kids school and of course, they want to play games as well. They said it plays games good if you step the resolution down to 1080p. The 4K screen is great for reading text, Editing photos, etc. but games can be laggy running at native resolution. Some programs do not support 4K resolution, so the text and graphics in their window looks blurry compared to the crystal clear text and graphics at 4K. 3rd party memory and upgraded SSD Hard drive work flawlessly. Windows 10 install doesnâ€™t have any bloatware, and all the drivers are preinstalled. Overall great computer at a good value.

The following day a friend found the serial number quickly and worked for over an hour correcting things, until finally, he was unable to complete the work because the regular keyboard would not work. Later called the manufacturer and told her the problem and asked her to e-mail me with directions how to make the keyboard work, but she never did.

Title: Device is great ... but wish I hadn't got a chrome book now Google has changed gmail
ReviewText: I spent some time researching Chromebooks in my price range and was nervous about getting a renewed one but I have been very pleased with the HP device and have had no problems with it (I have owned it for 8 months now). I would give the actual device a five star review. However, Google has changed things so that whereas I could always sign out of gmail and leave my website browser open - for other members of the family to look at and use, now you cannot sign out of gmail without signing out of the whole browser. As a parent who uses their laptop as access to the web for the whole family this does not work for me - everyone can see my gmail - or use my gmail! The only option I can see is to get a yahoo or other email account which would mean changing my whole email address (a pain in the neck) or getting a new laptop which was not Chromebook (waste of money!). Of course, in an ideal world everyone signs in and signs out of chromebook on their google account but in a family that doesn't happen and anyway that doesn't work with sharing website information I want my family to see on my browser (do they like these shoes/have they seen this youtube video/have they read the school homework website, etc.). At the moment I am getting around it by using the chromebook in guest mode only but then one might as well not have a chromebook (apart from the anti virus feature that is a strong selling point). I have no idea why Google changed this function recently - but as an unsophisticated computer purchaser (!) I thought I would share this problem with others who might use this laptop in the same way our family do, as it would never have occurred to me the problems this would cause when I decided to buy a Chromebook.

Title: Love this Chromebook!
ReviewText: Daughter needed a Chromebook for school. After MUCH review, I decided to jump on this one. And man, I gotta tell you, SO very impressed. To the point where I think I'm going to get the same one. It is snappy, looks great, and battery life is very impressive. Even my daughter mentioned how much nice this is than the school-issued ones. We've only had it one month and I will update my review should we become disappointed with it. But at this time, we are simply impressed with this guy, especially at this price!

Title: Great chromebook
ReviewText: I originally bought refurbished. It worked for 2 weeks and started crashing. However I am giving a 5 star review because it was perfect. Keyboard extremely comfortable. Backlight goes on as the slightest touch. Screen is gorgeous. Movies look fantastic. No lag in use. I have now ordered a brand new one instead, and, can't wait to get it.

Title: great chromebook
ReviewText: what a great upgrade this was !!i I used to own an asus chromebook flip c302 which back in the days was a marvelous piece of kit, best seller on Amazon in 2017. But now was outdated since it started to show its age with a core m 6th generation chip and 4gb of ram. The hp chromebook x360 was a fresh restart for me since its built quality, its i3 8th generation chip and 8 gb ram make this laptob a beast. It breezes through all the tasks . Ok you can still hear the fun every now and then but you should not pay too much attention. Many reviews reported that it has low brightness but you really don't face any problems indoors. The display is overall good and the touchscreen adds to its productivity ability. The keyboard is backlit and very good, did't face anny issues what so ever. I recommend this laptod at this value, its a great bargain !!

Title: Replaced my IPad Pro 12.9" with this Chromebook, really!
ReviewText: After suffering through yet another year of aggravation with my Ipad, between the awful keypad that wouldn't work 80% of the time to the wifi that would have to be turned off 3-5x/hour because it would just drop the signal I figured it was time to move on & look for something more reliable & much less expensive & that led me to Chromebook. I liked this particular model but didn't want to spend $600 for it & that led me to this refurb model. I was hesitant to buy a refurb but between the return guarantee & the $56 for the 2 year warranty I felt it was worth a shot since the total cost, including tax, was still over $100 less than the brand new price before tax or warranty.

Title: Works great, less filling!
ReviewText: I'm a home user who does 90% web surfing and office apps, so I chose this NUC based on its specs fitting my needs (plus a bit more), and as expected, it works great for me. My NUC has the i5 8259U processor, 16 GB RAM, and 475 GB SSD. It's about 30" away from me on my desktop, and the fan is pretty quiet. I don't mind it at all, but if it ever bothers me, I could put it underneath my desktop, and it would be pretty much silent. Windows 10 Pro boots up very quickly, compared to my previous Windows 10 laptop. NUC's small footprint is great. My only beef is niggling and cosmetic, and is obvious from the pictures; it has two USB ports and an audio port on the front, so those corresponding cables are more visible on my desk. The back is filled up with other ports, so they had to go in front. But I knew that going in. I got exactly what I thought I would get, and it works as well or better than I had expected it to. I did buy a small, $19 USB hub to add capacity for my several wired and wireless peripherals, and I have a couple of extra USB ports on my monitor, so now I have plenty for my printer, scanner, hard drive, Blu-Ray player, keyboard, mouse, charging cables, etc.

Title: Fantastic!
ReviewText: Was quoted 7-day delivery time and received the shipment within 3-days! I still canâ€™t believe how small computers are now. I remember my first PC (many years ago) was rather large and it came with only 4MB of RAM (LOL). This computer is so quiet and itâ€™s fast. Very pleased with my purchase!

Title: More than double the regular power transformer cord set is required--not practical for travel.
ReviewText: Requires two large power transformers that must connect to one large pigtail "Y" connector port with it's own stiff, large power cord that terminates in a rather small, flat plug which is inserted into the side of the laptop. The excessive power transformer plus additional bulky, stiff cord with connector Port adds unacceptable weight and need for much extra table space to the left of the laptop and wherever the additional transformer may be placed. MSI claims that they did not have a supplier for a practical power supply in one cord set, so to achieve the wattage, they claim they did what is currently the problem I'm describing. It is not practical to carry so much hardware when traveling.

Title: "Luggable"
ReviewText: Yes, it's big, yes, it's heavy, yes it takes two power transformers, but it's top-end desktop hardware in a laptop. If you're looking for something you're going to want to move a lot, try one of their 15" models with 1080. If you're looking for a top of the line 4K desktop machine in a laptop package, this is the machine for you. I'm planning to use it for VR demos, and I have a feeling the hardware is going to have no problem with that.

Title: Beware Junk Sellers!!!
ReviewText: I bought this computer 4 months ago. The hard drive failed in the first month so I sent it back to them for repair. They claimed they fixed the hard drive by blocking out bad sectors but didn't replace it. The hard drive now has completely died and I can't get the seller to return my emailed inquiry to them. Having given up on the seller, I sent the computer back to HP who rejected the manufacture's warranty. I called HP and was told the seller put "junk parts in there in place of the high quality one's HP uses therefore there is no warranty".

Title: The dock that could...
ReviewText: So many docks claimed to give dual displays with Macbooks....so many failed. Then along came WAVLink to drop this goodness on my lap. Could it truly allow two Display Port monitors from one connector from my MacBook? Yes. Could it truly allow my USB peripherals work with my Mac via this Dock? YES. Could it even provide power to my notebook from its own power source through the same thunderbolt cable that signaled hese other devices? YeEeSs. Do I like Tacos? HECK YES.

Title: Works Somewhat on Linux
ReviewText: I purchased the WAVLINK because it has the Intel Titan Ridge controller which is compatible on Linux without needing any drivers. However on this Dock it only allows me to display on one monitor at a time. the other monitor doesn't display anything. It seems that the display controller in this unit isn't compatible with Linux for both displays. I have looked endlessly online to see if there are display drivers I can add or other configurations I can mess with but I have yet to find any thing

Title: Best thunderbolt 3 dock at the best price
ReviewText: I got this to connect my 13" macbook pro 2017 to a 34 ultrawide and a 4k monitor. It only shows one extended display monitor when both monitors were connected through the displayports. If I only connect the 4k monitor it works just fine. But, when I try to plug in the other monitor, that other monitor show a no signal blank screen. The same results occurred in any order I plugged in the monitors.

Title: Finally a solution that works. 144Hz with external NVMe @ 10Gbps
ReviewText: Bottom line: This is the most robust dock I have seen at this price. Highly recommend if you are looking for 2 specific things: Running an external NVMe drive @ 10Gbps AND a 144hz monitor.

ReviewText: The WIFI continually cuts out on this device which requires the adapter to be reset before it can be used again. After months with this issue, I sent it in for a RMA where they "Tightened the WIFI cable" an updated the BIOS which did absolutely nothing to address my issue. So far, I'm out $50 for the box and shipping and have absolutely nothing to show for it. I asked for support via email and its been two weeks and all they have asked is what is my wifi driver version and Windows 10 version. It's 3-4 days in-between generic email responses that ask questions I have already answered multiple times.This is the absolute worst customer service I have experienced with a laptop company and will never recommend anyone to buy ASUS products now or in the future.

Title: Painfully slow
ReviewText: We bought this laptop for my niece who is 13-years old. We thought it was an excellent deal at less than $250, but once we began the setup process, the laptop was "laggy" and painfully slow. Not sure if it's because Windows 10 was running in S mode, or because the specifications at this price point are just slow and underwhelming. We ended up returning the laptop within a day, and purchased an Amazon "renewed" Dell Latitude which was much zippier and faster. I don't think the speed issue had to do with the Lenovo hardware; it was probably Windows 10 and the bloatware installed by Lenovo. It's too bad because, although it was all plastic, the laptop looked relatively sturdy.

The boot time and speed of operation is much slower than anticipated with a computer of these parameters. Therefore, I went back to my old 2016 computer which is not a Lenovo and on the whole works better.

Its not really a problem for me because i wont be traveling much with it anyway. I know its refurbished and this can be a concern. It is backed by 30 money back guarantee and 90 day manufacture warranty. In a addition, there's an option to buy accidental insurance through Assurion before your first 30 days with the product is up. All in all it was a great purchase for a top of the line lap top.

Title: Really worth it!
ReviewText: I was soooo skeptical about buying a used/refurbished laptop online. The screen looks perfect! There are like 3 or 4 very, VERY small dings around the edges. I only found them because I thoroughly inspected the laptop when it arrived and I was specifically looking for them. The computer is so fast and runs like new. The specs in this laptop are really high end and very much worth it. The whole laptop itself just looks and feels high end. the keyboard feels awesome and the facial recognition and fingerprint reader are very accurate and super fast. The battery lasts forever in this thing too. Hopefully that doesn't change any time soon. I've had the laptop for about a month now and I am incredibly happy with this purchase.

Title: DEAD OUT OF BOX FAILURE WOULDN'T TURN ON
ReviewText: Was so excited opening the box of a much needed new laptop. Loved the sleek design and the keyboard features it had only to be quickly frustrated that it would not turn on. Contacted Amazon and they patched me through to Lenovo immediately who did their troubleshooting steps (ones I had already performed) to confirm that it was a hardware failure and covered under warranty. Before they could go into my warranty options I nicely explained that I paid for a brand new working laptop and did not want to send this one back for "repair" and get a refurbished unit back. If I had wanted a refurbished unit I would have bought one at a discount but since I paid full price and it never even turned on once that I would return it to the seller on Amazon and get a new replacement and let them deal with the refurbished unit issue. Waiting on Amazon to fulfill my replacement order and for UPS to pick up the defective unit. In this instance I wish I had bought local because then it would have been exchanged and I would be up and running and not still waiting a week later to get this resolved. Not the sellers fault, not Amazon's fault but still disappointed in this product thus far. Hopefully I am happy with the replacement and all goes well.

Title: Bang for the buck!
ReviewText: The specifications of this laptop are off the charts for the price. I really wanted a fast laptop for work, with gaming capabilities as a bonus. It was hard to find a modern processor such as a 9th generation core i7 matched with a minimum of 8 GB ram and a competent graphics card. This laptop was the one I could find for a really affordable price. Most laptops that I found that were matched with fast working processors and competent graphics card had bad thermal issues, but this laptopâ€™s cooling capabilities are insane. It also has a really strong screen hinge, although it seems unlike it. Its brushed aluminum feel and robust touch pad are also attractive. Its only cons would be the lack of sd card reader and thunderbolt 3 ports, and of course, a webcam. But honestly, most laptops have terrible webcam quality. I find it more prudent to purchase a quality webcam separately.

ReviewText: While I am writing this after having it out of the box for just a few short hours with a brand new Lenovo T590, I am having significant problems:

Title: Worked fine with 1 monitor but not 2
ReviewText: It will not drive 2 monitors at 60hz via the Lenovo T490s. After reading several support foams it seems that the laptop can not support 2 monitors at 60hz via the USM-C connection. The T490s may be able to support 2 monitors both running ar 60hz if you use a docking station that connects via the Thunderbolt connection.

Title: Flawless
ReviewText: Just works, using with Thinkpad X390, easy fuss free setup. Laptop is stored in a drawer with the lid closed, ONE USB-C cable going from the back of the dock to the laptop charges the laptop and runs TWO HP 24 inch monitors running 1920x1080 plugged into the DisplayPort connectors, as well as a Logitech USB receiver for keyboard and mouse, perfect. Works every time, laptop wakes up when I click the mouse or touch a few keys on the keyboard. Also have ipad pro plugged into USB-C in front and charges it just perfectly. I like having the headphone, USB and USB-C connectors in the front of the docking station. Every once in a while you do have to hit the power button on the top of the dock, but usually the keyboard and mouse will wake the laptop up.

Title: Good Docking Station for a Lenovo Thinkpad X1 Carbon, Gen 7
ReviewText: I have become spoiled using 2 external monitors with another laptop I used for several years. Current laptops' commuting abilities make them usable for me for all my needs whether in the office, traveling, or in class. However, the small single laptop screen is not as easy to view with my eyes as it was 10 years ago. I bought a Lenovo Thinkpad X1 Carbon, Gen 7 based on previous good performance of an earlier Thinkpad. This docking station works well, but like most new laptops it connects via the super/lightening/all in one USB C connection. I would prefer the older style connector, but this most be the way PC makers want to go. The setup was fairly quick and worked almost like plug and play with my two existing monitors. I had to invest a few minutes to set up the monitor displays as I wanted, but this probably the case with any docking station. I looked at the cheaper knockoff docking stations, but was not impressed with their reviews. Some also do not charge the laptop which makes them almost worthless. This Lenovo branded dock was certainly not cheap and I probably paid a premium for the name. So far it is working as advertised to charge my laptop and seamlessly switch to the external monitors when I plug it into my laptop.

Title: I think they just made me an Apple guy
ReviewText: I got this because I have a personal and a work Lenovo. I have multiple monitors and wireless devices and wanted to be able to get away with swapping one cord out to go from one to another. Well the device didn't work in one of the laptops so I went to Lenovo support and after waiting half an hour I got a lot of bad advice that didn't make sense- for example "your laptop can't extend monitors on the USB C only the HDMI." but I have a cheap Targus that I currently use to connect both monitors into my laptop on the USB C. They they said I was in the wrong tech support to sent me a different link. That person then told me they weren't the right ones the first ones were so instead they sent me to the warranty department and they didn't want to do anything until I gave them my address. In the end they said they couldn't do anything either and suggested I call sales. I'm so frustrated I'll be send this unit back and taking my laptop back to Costco

Title: What's not to like?
ReviewText: This machine is really excellent. I ordered it with a 6-day delivery promise and it came in two. I purchased the 512GB SSD with 16GB Ram option. It is really fast - about 30 seconds from power on to internet. Amazing! The screen is nice and large and the picture quality is really good. About the only thing I regret is that it keeps coming down in price - it started at $609, went to $595 (that's when I went for it), and now, a few days later it's $585. Oh well, it is what it is. Let me address some of the issues others have mentioned.

Title: excellent little machine so far BUT!!!!
ReviewText: Very nice full sized laptop / speedy and functional/ I use a usb mouse wireless mouse though, I donâ€™t like the internal mouse pad / screen is big and the graphics are beautiful- keyboard is very smooth- good purchase for not a lot of money - still hate windows 10 though, no matter what box itâ€™s wrapped in. BUT had to return it because the fan was faulty! Multiple crashes and error messages regarding faulty fan!!

Title: Setup Is A Headache
ReviewText: I bought this laptop because it was a good price for the specifications. Got a SSD and 16 GB RAM for much less than other models. I know why it costs less. First hassle on the list is the fact that this computer comes with Windows 10 installed with "S" Mode enabled. This isn't a total deal breaker as it can be turned off if you can get connected to Microsoft without experiencing an error message that says, "it appears you aren't connected to the internet" even after having a connection to Wi-Fi. Once you install updates, and then reset windows store by typing into the search WSRESET and selecting WSRESET.EXE that fixes that issue. Now to hassle number 2, the internet connection was noticeably slower on this machine because it had a horrible WiFi network adapter installed on it. It doesn't recognize 5G networks, and is incredibly slow compared to other devices I have running on my network. To remedy this, it involves buying another adapter and installing it into the machine. It isn't too expensive, but this is 2020 and this computer was manufactured in 2019, so this is no excuse for HP to put such a terrible WiFi adapter in this thing. Other than those hassles, everything else seems to work fine. The machine boots up fast, runs and executes apps and programs quickly. You would be better off skipping this one for another budget laptop if you want hassle free setup. I purchased a Lenovo earlier in the year and didn't experience any of these issues. Title: Great choice for work horse.  Gaming is decent yet hot!

The thing at the time was awesome at playing games but would overheat always. This is before I would check temps and control the pc with programs and such. I had a desk cooler and all that too.

Title: Screen issue
ReviewText: Well, I use this laptop about 2 weeks and just now realized that the left corner of screen came off somehow. Now i just hope that i will manage to push it back on place. Whatever!!! it's annoying me during the watching movie due to it shows foggy white color on the left corner. Photos attached. Hopefully i will not get any other surprises!!! Paid 3600 usd and screen came off!
