Title: Great Gaming Laptop Value
ReviewText: I've been testing this laptop out for a few days now, and overall it's been great. My usage for this is 70% regular computer work (business, light Photoshop, web browsing, etc.) and 30% gaming when I travel as I have a full size gaming rig at home.

Title: Terrific gaming laptop with horrible battery life
ReviewText: I purchased the model with the Ryzen 7 3750H CPU and GTX 1660Ti graphics card. The laptop overall is very fast. The NVME OS drive was able to transfer at over 950 MB/s. Not as great as a Samsung NVME, but still better than a SATA SSD. The secondary D: drive was 1tb, and it's performance was abysmal. It would only write to the drive at 40 MB/s. The dual fans werent overwhelmingly loud when gaming, however they are still running at over 2500 rpm even when the system is idling. Farcry 5 was able to run at over 60 fps on max settings.

Title: 1660ti Beast
ReviewText: I bought the metallic 1660ti version and ive had it for a week so far, here is my thoughts:

Title: Great until it's not
ReviewText: This laptop worked fine for the first 6 months. Now when I try to turn it on I get a black screen. I can't get Aorus support to help me.

Title: Cripsy display, crunchy keys and clear sound. Im sold.
ReviewText: First month review:

Title: Great but then awful
ReviewText: Love it! I love how light it is and it has a great picture on overwatch. Still setting up updates as I just got it today but so far itâ€™s really good! ** update, after just a week, the computer got an entire line of dead cells. When asked to replace Amazon said no they could only do a return. Bad service for what could have been a great product. We never even got a chance to test what the laptop could handle because it broke so soon.

Title: Solid, thin and hard working
ReviewText: While owning this for a solid 3 weeks and so far, it is a treating me well!

Title: Awesome laptop!
ReviewText: Very powerful laptop with a lot of cool features at a very good price! Also very light and easy to travel with. If there was one con to find with it, i would have to say the speakers are not as loud and bassy like some of the other gaming laptops. I recommend buying the *SUPVIN Portable Mini Computer Clip-On Speaker* for it, which could be found here on amazon.

Title: Not working!!!!!!!! Please don't buy it
ReviewText: After plenty of research and reading the reviews, I decided to buy this laptop. A few hours after turning it on, I got the blue screen of death. Can't believe how fast it failed and required reinstalling the OS. I put it aside, and have not gotten a chance to use it again as I'm busy with work. Hopefully its not dead.

Title: Dont buy from gigabyte
ReviewText: Broke after 3 months, very light use (for college), screen doesnt turn on, covered under manufactures warranty, but the serial numbers are on stickers so keep the box and dont rub the sticker or else they could void the warranty..... never heard of a company creating a serial number for a product on a sticker that is prone to easily being scratched off....

Title: Hmm... for how expensive this computer is
ReviewText: So.... Lets start by it did arrive quick and amazon killed it on that. The box packaging etc is nice and thick.

Title: ASUS ZEPHYRUS S GX701 Gaming Powerhouse Review
ReviewText: Hello world,

Title: Avoid this seller. Literally missing the graphics card.
ReviewText: You want to know what's hilarious? Spending $2499 on a gaming laptop that's missing the graphics card that makes it gaming capable in the first place.

Title: Outstanding system for the price
ReviewText: Met my needs for a new gaming laptop perfectly. Pros:

Title: Looks like a fantastic budget gaming laptop, but it has major problems
ReviewText: I was excited to finally have a decent laptop with fantastic features and life like screen, but beneath the features this Asus FX-505DT laptop has major issues....despite long talks with Asus techs, and hours at home, this laptop fails to measure up. All i wanted to do is use a USB device to run/install some programs and install a dual boot operating system, despite hours to get the BIOS to respond, this laptop refuses to recognize ANY USB device, any USB device, thumb drive, external dvd player, any USB device. Even with a purge of the BIOS, and complete reset of Windows 10, this machine refuses to recognize any USB device... A necessary feature in the bios , CSM fails to appear...unable to disable UEFI...and there's .more, which i wont bore you with. I spoke to Asus techs who told me the USB devices should be recognized if windows 10 was installed and active. This made no difference...enough. To say the least, i am disappointed. I have great respect for Asus brand products for desktop computers, but for this laptop, my first Asus laptop, two thumbs down.

Title: Burnt out within a month of using it??? Other than that it's a decent laptop
ReviewText: Purchasing this product was one of my most regretful decisions of my life. For almost a 1k laptop, it lasted for only for 1 month. Keep in mind that my total gaming hours for each day was less than 3 hours. That's not even the worst part... Within a week of using it for less than 3 hours of gaming a day this product kept on crashing every time I closed out on Overwatch,CS:GO, and League of Legends. These games can be ran on a 6 year computer with a 610 graphics card. I'm not sure if this whole product is a defect or just mine. Either way I wouldn't risk 1k ever again on Asus gaming Laptops. Other than the fact that mine died within a month, which I'm upset about because it's 1k and it didn't even last 2 years? A desktop would've been a better choice! The laptop quality was decent,the graphics were decent, and the brightness was decent. The only cons excluding the crashes and burning out within a month, is the battery life. It has at max 3 hours of gaming unplugged.(but it's a gaming laptop so idk why you would want to unplug it)

Title: Great so far
ReviewText: I was very impressed by the item description and read a couple of reviews and quickly purchased the ASUS TUF (2019) Gaming Laptop, 15.6â€ 120Hz Full HD IPS-Type, AMD Ryzen 7 3750H, GeForce GTX 1650, 8GB DDR4, 512GB PCIe SSD version. While waiting for UPS to deliver the laptop, as it needed a signature, I started reading all the reviews. I quickly became very concerned with the reviews detailing the BSOD's and black screens. I then googled video reviews, and found that almost all reviewers by professional techs recommended this laptop as a beginner's gaming machine.

Title: Gorgeous Laptop with Monster Hardware
ReviewText: The product I purchased and reviewing below is the MSI P65 Creator 9SF - 15.6" UHD (3840x2160) i9 9880H with an RTX 2070.

Title: Almost perfect, some issues
ReviewText: Let's get some mundane details out of the way first: Build quality is great, screen is very nice, touchpad is great, keyboard is decent (more details below), Thunderbolt 3 support is meh, cooling is meh, noise is meh, ethernet port is... odd.

Title: It's the future
ReviewText: The laptops of laptops. I can't believe how incredible this machine is. I actually gave up my desktop and laptop to get this as my primary machine. I'm a gamer and a video editor. Been working in AE, PPro, and Resolve long enough to know what's needed and this is by far more than I could ever ask for. I edit my Braw footage with ease and do my motion graphics with no problem. I freaking love it. My complaint? The power cord is massive and it uses standard DC plug. I would've liked to see it use magnetic charging like the Surface Book has (what I gave up to get this)

Title: Great Laptop, Runs Hot.
ReviewText: Experienced some throttling out of the box, but some minor undervolting seems to have alleviated those issues. I swapped out, and added two additional SSDs (for a total of three). It was much easier than on my old GS63. If you need to access the RAM, or want to re-paste the CPU, you'll be looking at having to remove the motherboard.

Title: Slick fast but the battery is lacking
ReviewText: I had never owned a brand new laptop before I bought this beast and I have to say that I am impressed. Sleek, fast and I love that it has a micro SD card slot without the need for the adapter. My only beef is the battery life. Even though it does have battery saving options it should still come with a better battery for the price you pay

ReviewText: Despite its chassis is of plastic, the quality feels. I specially like the trackpad buttons. They have a smooth click.

Title: Well this is a mess.
ReviewText: I wanted to give it a couple of weeks till I made my review. First of all I am not a gamer. I use it for trading. But it is lightening fast. Keys are very soft and easy to use. I am upping the ram to 32 just because of the load my programs take. I donâ€™t necessarily need it though. Best laptop Iâ€™ve ever had. Boots up at 6 sec. on average.

ReviewText: So i basically just got mine in a few hours ago and have been tinkering on it and enjoying myself. THat said there are a few hiccups with the setup of the laptop itself that bug me, and could potentially bug you too.

Title: Great laptop with lots of power
ReviewText: Purchased this item after doing a lot of research online. The laptop is a beast. Games run very smooth. The 9th gen Intel processor and RTX2070 Max-P is absolutely killer.

Title: Great laptop for gaming
ReviewText: I was going to build a PC, but after seeing some videos and review from other websites, it completely exceeded my expectations given the size of the Strix. I've been playing Final Fantasy 15 Windows Edition on this machine and it runs it on a solid 70 fps, allowing me to experience its vast open world with a solid framerate.

Title: Great Laptop Hampered by Subpar Quality Control
ReviewText: Overall this is a powerful laptop that can handle just about anything you throw at it, a pretty good bang for your buck. I do, however, have a couple grievances already in my 1 day of ownership so far.

Title: Great Design,speed,with battery life as stated

Title: Great performance just a bit hot
ReviewText: The laptop worked fine for the most part alot needed to be updated and some of the bloatware needed to be removed. When I was gaming I had a concern about the temperature. The GPU was fine it got up to maybe 72Â°C max but the CPU wow I was hitting 99Â°C constantly it was very worrisome. The cooling looked sufficient and the fans definitely blew alot of air but I couldn't get it out of the 90Â°+ range. Again maybe I got a lemon I've bought another one I'll update my review once I receive the laptop and test it. If it over heats again I may try redoing the thermal paste and if that doesn't work then all hope is lost.

Title: Great at $550
ReviewText: I was hesitant to buy this laptop originally because Amazon's product page is rather vague when it comes to a lot of the reasons people might be looking at this laptop. Before I purchased it I wanted to know more about the panel in particular. Now that I have it, all I have learned is that it is a 60hz panel. Another thing I wanted to know before purchasing was the exact RAM specifications so that I could purchase another 8gb stick of RAM and install it right away. The RAM in mine was Samsung M471A1K43CB1-CTD. It is an 8gb 2666MHz CL19 stick of memory. It can be purchased on Amazon for $35-40.

Title: Amazing Laptop Is recommend to anyone looking to get into pc gaming.
ReviewText: I mainly use this computer at my desk after I get off work so this laptop is perfect for me. I love the RGB keyboard! Iâ€™m no keyboard expert or anything but just typing on the keyboard feels great. When it comes down to gaming this thing is a beast it can run pretty much anything at 1080p ultra to high settings and get 60+FPS most of the games Doom 2016 actually hits 200fps some times. This laptop would be perfect if it werenâ€™t for the battery life which lasts around 2- 2 1/2 hours which isnâ€™t the greatest but isnâ€™t the worst either. But I work 10 hour days at work so I donâ€™t get out much so 99% of the time the laptop is plugged in anyways so I donâ€™t really have to worry about battery life. The speakers are decent but they arenâ€™t the best I have heard but for a laptop I think they are more than acceptable. Overall I think your getting a lot of bang for your buck here with this laptop.

Title: Bargain Gaming Laptop
ReviewText: Honestly for 550 dollars (deal of the day) I couldn't ask for much more. Super quiet, keyboard is nice, screen is good. It can play most anything I want. Only complaints are that it comes with 8GB of Ram and half of that is eaten by Windows and the HD is an SSD (very fast) but only 256GB so a little small. The only thing I really don't like is the touchpad, feels kind of cheap and the mouse buttons are not the best.

Title: Great value
ReviewText: Great value for what you get didn't want to spend the extra for the i7 but not playing super taxing games either.

Title: Worth the money you pay
ReviewText: Decent build quality for the price. Keyboard is fantastic. Battery life phenomenal. Performance very commendable.

Title: Crap cooling
ReviewText: Has a crap CPU cooler, it'll overheat with almost every game unless you turn down the settings. Kinda sucks cause I bought this for video editing also and when rendering it gets up to 95 celcuis and throttles

Title: excellent choice if you can adjust to the mouse pad
ReviewText: this laptop has a 17 inch screen in a 15 inch screen's form factor. it's very fast and powerful for a laptop. It handles normal everyday things pretty quietly. hasn't gotten hot enough to burn me while surfing the web or watching videos. The only thing that keeps it from getting 5 stars from me are a few design options. the enlarged mouse pad is awkward and takes some getting used to. and the speakers are on the bottom front of the laptop firing downwards. not an ideal setup. 512gb of memory isn't enough, and the factory partitions it very weirdly. It's a lot easier to add storage to this laptop than to add RAM though so I've already added a 1tb SSD to the 2nd of 3 slots and undid their weird partitioning. otherwise I don't have anything to complain about. key travel is nice, screen is bright, RGB keyboard can be customized by key, and a lot of other features.

Title: Good performance, light weight with compromises to keep price and weight down.
ReviewText: For the amount of power this machine packs its quite light. The case is stlyish and feels sturdy under the hand. The oversized mouse pad can be a little awkward. My wrist lays just against the edge of the pad and sometimes causes the mouse to go nuts. I did wish I had gotten at least a TB drive. I can watch the 512GB filling rapidly. The battery life drains quickly especially in performance mode which is to be expected. The capacity is small to keep the weight down.

Title: Awesome
ReviewText: The only complains i have is that the chassis a little too bendy, and the fans get fast and loud here and there but slow down in a shirt while typically

Title: Blazing Machine
ReviewText: Super fast load times. I added another 500gb NVme Samsung 970 evo. I donâ€™t use it for gaming but video conversion & it handles the job no problem. Super pleased with the purchase.

Title: Great laptop
ReviewText: Love it

Title: Seems good, but information at Amazon is misleading.

Apparently it has a one year Lenovo warranty and you must pay to get an extended warranty. It's misleading to list a three year warranty as a feature and not disclose the fact that you must pay if over one year.

Title: ITS OVER 9000!
ReviewText: This laptop does everything I need it to do. Fallout 4 on highest settings, skyrim on ultimate settings.. the only 2 games im really playing at the moment. It starts up lightning quick. I wish It came with more storage room but thats an easy thing to upgrade. I was able to get this on the amazon 5 payments no interest plan and it has made affording this laptop very easy. I would recommend and would buy again.

Title: Itâ€™s a BEAST, but only weighs as much as a kitten.
ReviewText: Very impressed by this laptop. Iâ€™m a DJ and needed a high power machine for gigs. The screen is absolutely beautiful, the keyboard lights up nice and looks amazing and boy oh boy does this thing live up to itâ€™s specs!

Title: Good performance, but sharp edges on bottom make it unsuitable for actual "lap" use
ReviewText: Performs great. Most people wouldn't game with this on their laps, yes, but when I want to sit on the couch and casually use it, it has sharp points and edges that jut out of the bottom that stick into my legs and any other non-solid surface you might put it on (a leather sofa, for example). A minor annoyance, other than that I am pleased with it.

Title: 3 Thinks I Don't Like About this Laptop
ReviewText: There's lot's to like about this laptop, so I'll tell you what I don't like. The delete key on the keyboard should be where the insert key is! I constantly hit the insert key and the delete key is a button I use daily. I never us the insert key. The red keyboard should have the option to be blue. The red make my eyes blurry. And last, if you like to slightly move the tilt of the screen for better viewing, the screen lifts the whole laptop! Poor design in my opinion.

Title: Great for gaming and web design
ReviewText: Great laptop for gaming or web design. I mainly use it for web design with a little gaming here and there. I have this hooked up to a 32in HP monitor and it pushes that screen perfectly.

Title: It's mostly on me but I definitely picked the wrong machine
ReviewText: I made some bad assumptions as regards what constituted a gaming laptop and was disappointed, a bit, in what I received. I didn't even know they made laptops without cameras anymore, firstly, so I didn't think to check that. And the quality of the sound left a lot to be desired (do folks just assume they're going to hook up the laptop to external speakers?)

Title: Gaming Plus!
ReviewText: Excellent machine! This is second one purchased and it performs flawlessly.the SSD drive is more than adequate if you save your work on the Cloud.. thin and compact yet powerful. Still runs a little hot on extreme gaming usage but much i,proved

Title: A great improvement for an outdated computer, smooth as butter.
ReviewText: This laptop was purchased for my girlfriend. She loves it. It is much better than her previous laptop, it is so much more smooth. She usually has 30+ tabs open on an internet browser. Her previous computer was a potato. It couldn't even have 2 tabs open without bogging down to a snails pace. Such a good computer, it looks good and runs great. Battery life is as stated, keys are red like advertised. There doesn't seem to be a cooling issue, but it's not running games (yet, I haven't tried) .

Title: This thing exceeded all expectations!
ReviewText: I just received this MSI laptop a day ago and so far is highly impressed. I'm primarily a gamer and wanted something that could push through games and not kill my ears with fan noise. So far the fans have been the quietest of any laptop I've tried, and trust me, I've tried alot. The GPU temps and CPU temps are very good. I'm an OCD type person, so if this laptop makes the smallest noise or has any minimal issue, I freak out.As of now, I have not one issue with this laptop except one, The Mouse track pad. When I type, I end up resting my hand on it and moves the pointer or I click the button and messes stuff up on the screen. But, that is not a deal breaker, I just have to be alittle more carefully where I rest my palms when I type. As for gaming, this 1660 ti is handling all my games beyond expectations. My FPS hangs around 100 to 120 on high or ultra settings in all my games. The screen is sharp and the response time is awesome. I do wish it was made of metal, but it's all plastic. Feels alittle cheap, but again, not a deal breaker. It does have plenty of storage. 2- M.2 drives and a 2.5 drive. I highly recommend this laptop.

Title: I adore this machine
ReviewText: Absolutely wicked machine, the graphics are absurdly good, the screen is wonderful with an incredibly rich picture. The fans are surprisingly quiet for the rpm they can reach, and the speakers.... they honestly get loud enough that an entire room can easily hear them, to a level that if it were my wife watching tv, I'd have asked her to turn it down a little, lol

Title: love it
ReviewText: love this laptop, so fast and the graphics are amazing.

Title: Best gaming laptop at this price range
ReviewText: Â This is a solid rig for gaming and business use. Itâ€™s very important to activate the fans into â€œcooler boostâ€ under the MSI Dragon Center when gaming, otherwise laptop will get hot. It is not necessary to boost the fans for normal/internet use. I paired this with a separate Etrobot gaming keyboard I got here on amazon and itâ€™s perfect. My mouse is a razor synapse I got from Best Buy. Overall this makes for a powerful gaming PC without breaking the bank. The next upgrades for $2,000+ are way pricier and you arenâ€™t gaining that much in power.

Title: Great product, great components, and
ReviewText: As far as speed and performance goes this product is top of the line. My only complaints is when you're stressing the CPU and GPU the AC adapter gets very hot but otherwise it holds up well. Structurally it seems flimsy so I would not let it fall more than a few inches (havent done that but doesn't seem that it would hold up well. Still give this product 5 starts for the fact it runs every benchmark well, picture is beautiful, holds ultra resolution on 95% of games no problem and is very light and easily portable!

Title: Good computer
ReviewText: Good computer. Speakers are terrible.

Title: Great Screen, good heat dissipation and very good benchmarks
ReviewText: No complaints really, wish the case wasn't so plastic but I made the conscience choice to go cheaper over the Stealth models and have been happy thus far. Screen is impressive and haven't had any thermal issues even before undervolting.

Title: My son loves it
ReviewText: My son gets this laptop recently to play video games online with his friends. He loves it with how crisp the graphic is and there is no delay in responses.

Title: Very fast.. but runs hot.
ReviewText: Got it for 3D modeling, video editing and VFX work. Runs really fast. Specially tasks that benefits

Title: Any game, max settings, 60fps or higher.
ReviewText: Okay so my only true complaint is that this nearly 3k dollar laptop doesn't have a thunderbolt port. Other than that this thing is a beast. The 2080 is a workhorse, haven't found a game it can't crush. The 144hz screen is great. Mine has a little bit of light bleed along the top and bottom but not enough that I wanted to send it back. With my experience on laptops the screen is always going to have a little of that.. use an external monitor for gaming anyway since you can get a lot more out of the 2080 on a 1440p monitor.

Title: worst machine we've ever owned (and we've owned alot)
ReviewText: Â This computer has been a nightmare and a money pit. We purchased it in May 2019, after owning another MSI for a few years; we've just replaced the older MSI after ~5years of use and battery failures. However, *this* machine started with serious problems soon after purchase. Unfortunately, the teen didn't let us know, or we would have returned to Amazon/MSI in Summer 2019.

Title: Great machine
ReviewText: Have had this for over a month now and still love this machine. Having a full 2080 in it instead of Max-Q is awesome. The small bezels, small footprint and lighter weight make this a true 17 inch portable power house. I have opened it up and installed 2 - 2TB NVME drives and a 2TB 2.5" SSD and have no issues them.

Title: Great gaming computer, highly recommend
ReviewText: I bought this laptop 3 month ago and it is everything I want it to be.

Title: Powerfull laptop at the cost of battery usage.  Would buy again. .
ReviewText: Thin and powerful laptop for 3d rendering. Use it for college and course work with solid edge 2020. Great for playing the latest games to de-stressing from the pressures of college.

Title: Fast and Loud
ReviewText: I highly recommend a good set of active noise cancelling headphones for this. The fans are LOUD: at max level, "Cooler Boost", they spin to about 6000 RPM. Temps do seem reasonable if you're gaming. The Quake II RTX demo ran at a steady 58 to 62 FPS in a brief test. Putting a full CPU load on the system was another story. Cinebench R20 pulled a 2547 with Cooler Boost running and peaked at around 95 C, with 3.30 GHz on all cores. It scored 2544 with the Auto fan curve, maxing at around 90 C but with a 3.28 GHz clock on all cores. I'll try to update this a few other temp and FPS numbers from some games.

Title: Fairly good laptop.
ReviewText: Still using it so im not aware yet of and major flaws. But it plays games like GTA and ARk with over 100fps. The only game it seems to struggle with is 7 days to die. That game gets laggy and the cpu is pegged out. Also as others said. This boy get hot as hell. Its temperature stays between 84 to 88c while gaming. Makes me worry of the longevity of this machine.

Title: Works and performs greatly but CPU temperatures exceed well over 90Â°C
ReviewText: Overall, this laptop is able to handle really high demanding games in max settings. Frame rates were generally high and consistent in all games which ran on this laptop. Fan noise is not irritating and screen was nice too with the 144hz display. However, while running in maximum clock speed, CPU temperatures hit and stay on 94-95Â°C, which may lead to wearing of the CPU in long run. I did not felt comfortable staying on those temperatures, unlike GPU where the temperatures were nice and cool under 75Â°C. I heard that issue might be the poor quality of thermal paste MSI uses in their laptops which leads to high temperatures. Until I find a solution, I will disable turbo clock speed of CPU to keep it cool. Other than that, laptop did not have any issues. If CPU ran cooler than it did, I would have given 5 stars.

Title: I WISH I BOUGHT A MACBOOK INSTEAD
ReviewText: Â UPDATE 2 months later:

Title: Gaming beast!
ReviewText: Amazing screen 144hz, very powerful combination and nice design. I bought this becouse MSI = Premium build quality and performance!

Title: False advertising
ReviewText: I got my laptop, and am disappointed to know that it does NOT have R7 Graphics as advertised. There was a black sticker covering the specs label on the box to hide the fact it did not have R7 Graphics.

Title: Unaccurate Website Description
ReviewText: On the card description it says the AMD Radeon R7 is a dedicated graphics card when we all know that it is integrated. Therefore I returned this item.

Title: Fast startup. Great connectivity.
ReviewText: This computer boots up very quickly and runs well. It slows up a little when you have a few things running compared to my last computer with A8 processor. Music needs to be played at a little higher volume on this computer than on my other computers to produce the same volume output. But overall, I'm satisfied with it. Hard to find computers these days with 3 USB ports and both VGA and HDMI connectivity. And I was able to install and run every program from my other computers successfully...

Title: LCD Screen failed
ReviewText: LCD screen failed after 10 months. Screen going blank. Yes, its under warranty I suppose, but the laptop is across the border with my 88 year old mother in lock down due to Covid, so not very easy to return and re-set up. So having to get it repaired at a BestBuy near her residence.

Title: Good computer!
ReviewText: Best price for 8MB RAM and SSD. Good computer.

Title: Worst ever
ReviewText: Worst laptop I've ever owned. Loads programs VERY slowly. Takes forever to load internet pages. For me this was a complete waste of money.

Title: Battery Quit Charging After 5 Days
ReviewText: Had the laptop for 5 days and updated to Windows 1903. Hardware charge LED with charger hooked up and windows battery management could not see the battery charging. Returned.

Title: Don't do it

Title: Rockstar
ReviewText: Iâ€™ve had this for 6 months now, and I couldnâ€™t be happier. Iâ€™m rough on laptops. Itâ€™s traveling all of the time, backpack, airport, work, rinse and repeat, and sheâ€™s still going like just out of the box.

Title: Difficulty setting up
ReviewText: I got this to replace an older MSI I use for gaming. I am NOT a tech savvy person, so it's important to me to find simple solutions to problems. The quick start guide is pretty much plug and go (a good thing). But then the hoops appear. There is no printed owner's manual. There IS an owner's manual in the Dragon Center, which I found by accident. But this is a generic MSI manual, and each model has it's own quirks. My first concern was that the lighted keyboard continued to flash colors, which I could not change. This model does NOT have an LED wizard to change the keyboard lights, and nowhere in the Dragon Center is this addressed. I checked the online forms, which all refer to the LED wizard. Went to the on-line help desk for MSI, but you have to register the laptop to get any support; to register I needed to supply a copy of the invoice, which I do not have. Called the MSI helpline, to explain the issue; they got it registered and then sort of talked me through changing the back-lighting. The path he gave me was not exactly the path that is on this comp, but it worked (you have to go through the Steel Keyboard file). Now the issue is that this laptop will not allow me to add a headset (there is no "add device" in the sound section of the control panel). I'm tired of jumping through hoops.

Title: Quality laptop
ReviewText: This was well worth the money as the laptop performs with lightning speed and crystal clear resolution. Even though I did not purchase it for gaming purposes I needed something with a lot of power and I donâ€™t think I couldâ€™ve bought a better laptop.

Title: Exactly what I wanted.
ReviewText: Got a good deal on this. Very happy with it.

Title: 2 hour gaming charge
ReviewText: The fan gets noisy when things heat up, and without the plug you'll only get 2 or 3 hours of play time, depending on how low you turn your screen brightness. I think both these things are pretty standard with gaming rigs though.

Title: Great brand, great machine
ReviewText: Love this laptop! It's efficient, fast, and effective, decent graphics card, good FPS, etc. My only complaint is that there aren't quite enough USB ports for everything I'd like; there are two on either side of the laptop. I highly recommend MSI machines; they have great customer service and the machines themselves last forever!

Title: Great out of the box.
ReviewText: After expecting an hour plus for setup I was happily surprised that the computer booted up within 2 minutes and was usable within 20. Perfectly runs ANY program in upwards of 160 frames per second.

Title: Chronic Overheating While Gaming
ReviewText: Summary: I've had my GS75 for just under a year, and it is a great, super compact machine. I take it everywhere and I love the track pad, keyboard, and 17" screen. The Steelseries keyboard feels high quality, and the trackpad feels like glass. The Nvme SSD is a must for brand new laptops, so i'm happy with that hardware selection. It's also really easy to add a second Nvme SSD if desired. The chassis seems pretty well designed and does not flex terribly, despite the slim profile and large screen. All that being said.... if you intend to play modern games on this laptop, please read my review thoroughly...

Title: Big, beautiful, beast.
ReviewText: I canâ€™t comment on gaming off battery, but Iv had the MSI GT75 for a few months now and can give some insight.

Title: It ain't future proofed, but it's close
ReviewText: So, where to start....... OK, BLUF (Bottom Line Up Front): If you're looking for a portable gaming rig, this is going to be very hard to beat for the money. It's huge, heavy, it more of a desktop replacement that you can shove in a back pack. But for what it IS, it's fantastic.

Title: great replacement for my 9 year old asus
ReviewText: Overall I really like the pc. I hope it will last as long as my asus. I like buying gaming pc's to do regular work as they are overpowered and have great cooling systems. I don't game but I like my pc to run stone cold, they last longer.

Title: You ask, and this machine will deliver.
ReviewText: This laptop is ideal for both gamers and professionals. The large chassis is great for keeping the laptop cool and preventing excess heat from reaching your fingertips when typing on the luxurious mechanical keyboard. The laptop is heavy and has terrible battery life. Therefore, this device is not an ultrabook replacement. What it can do is essentially act as a desktop replacement (if you are willing to haul around the system to and from work). My recommendation is to pair this alongside a cheap laptop if you are going to conferences or presenting (such as a Lenovo Flex 11). As for travel, I recommend the the KROSER XXL 18.5" laptop bag, as it is the only one large enough (within my price range) to support the sheer size of this machine. Overall, a very well built machine that will take care of any computational task you require.

Title: You wont regret this purchase
ReviewText: Exactly as described, very well packed.

Title: Fast, reliable and heavy
ReviewText: The compute r is fast and very reliable. Although is quite heavy, not as portable as it may seem. Overall is a good machine, more of a desktop for its weight.

Title: Not a long battery life, needs to be plugged in a lot
ReviewText: I love this laptop. It's very big, only thing is that is almost constantly has to be plugged in or it dies fast and also doesnt hold a charge for very long.

Title: VR ready
ReviewText: The battery doesn't matter to me. Its a powerful VR capable laptop that I can take with me when I travel.

Title: Nothing but bugs....
ReviewText: This is the worst laptop I've ever purchased. I made a huge mistake buying it through Amazon to save a buck and should have purchased it in a store to get service. I've had it less than 3 weeks and I have numerous programs that randomly freeze and have to be closed (or the computer restarted) on a regular basis. A GPS program I use for work that I've had through 5 laptops will freeze a couple dozen times per day. The DVD player started freezing the other day and required at least a dozen restarts to get through one movie. Twice I was using the headphone jack to play through my car aux in and when I unplugged it there was no speaker volume. Nothing was muted, nothing was changed and everything said it was working correctly, but there was no volume. Problem was only fixed by restarting the computer.

Title: This Computer Ships in S Mode
ReviewText: It's a nice computer at a good price, but... I bought this computer because, unlike other inexpensive Windows computers, it was advertised as having Windows 10 Home edition. What they don't say is that is that it is in "S" mode. This mode forces you to use only Microsoft software and to associate computer users with a Microsoft account. In fact, It was necessary for me to create a Microsoft account in order to get far enough in the setup to get out of S mode. I was not happy about being forced to provide my location and birthdate in order to set up an operating system. Ultimately I think I saved money by going this route, but I spent a few extra frustrating hours getting past S mode. If you know what S mode is and don't care, or have the time to shut it down, this is a good deal. Otherwise...

Title: Crashes. A lot. Do. Noy. Buy!
ReviewText: Do NOT buy this laptop! It constantly crashes! No matter what your doing. You could just be typing an important paper. Set it down for ten minutes, and go back. BOOM computer crashed. Constantly has to be reset. I tried to fix it on my own, with absolutely no luck. It's rather heavy, and it's large. So finding a laptop lap desk for it, is a hassle. Also, it gets a wierd small box of static on the screen, when you rest it after a crash. I do NOT recommend this product!

Title: It worked for like a week!! Terrible customer support service
ReviewText: Well...I bought this and took it to a different country...it is a laptop after all, I take it with me everywhere. Couldnt pass the window pre installed system. 6 months later...the screen stoped working, all black, doesnt do anything... i tried to talk to amazon support....they couldnt do anything...refered me to a Lenovo customer support....they said they can not help me, because i took the laptop out of the US territory....WHATTTTT???!!!!! it s a laptop!!!!! I travel A LOT! They didnt even give an address for a local support center. I don't care if is the warranty is not valid any more! I would pay for the service, but even that they would give me the address. My advice: DO NOT BUY LAPTOPS IN AMAZON IF YOU ARE A TRAVELER!!!!!

Title: Awesome so far except......

Title: Exactly What I Needed

It's strong enough to run Anno 1800 and Stardew Valley no problem. Battery life is pretty good if I'm not running any games...

Title: Great Value, Easy to set up
ReviewText: I bought this for business use and to upgrade to Windows 10. Turn off Windows 10 S mode and you'll be fine. Everything installed quickly and efficiently. I am enjoying the larger screen! Good value, excellent service from vendor.

Title: Great laptop
ReviewText: I bought this laptop for my business, and I'm glad I did. So far so good..no issues and great for what I need it for..

Title: Is it worth the cost?
ReviewText: It isn't a bad computer, but could definitely use some design rework. My biggest problem is the power cable. The connector for the two power supplies is bulky and because of that the cord is continually falling out. I fear that since the cord falls out so often the pins in the connector will wear out sooner than they should. Having a locking connector would be a huge improvement.

Title: Superb graphics, realistic motion
ReviewText: So far, I like everything about this computer. It makes my PC games pop visually and the AI move fast. I know I will be able to purchase games I had wanted but would overpower my old computer. I can also use Micosoft Office and it works great, even large spreadsheets. I also have enjoyed downloading music on this wonderful machine.

Title: Very decent gaming laptop
ReviewText: The first gaming laptop I bought. I'm very pleased.

Title: It rocks!
ReviewText: I don't care about battery life. I'm not going to a beach to check my email. This system is built. I'm an old guy that has been buying gaming systems for a long time. (...My first game was "The Green Candle", on an IBM 3270...Google it!) This thing is built! When I buy a computer I get the best I can afford, so I can "upgrade" my way into a number of years. I can't begin to tell you how much I'm impressed by this machine!

Title: Not worth the price
ReviewText: So I've had roughly 6 months to use it & it doesn't seem to matter what game I play (league of legends, battlefield, overwatch) the pc always ends up freezing. I'll be playing normally & all of a sudden the game freezes in some sort of way & no matter what method I try the pc is just unable to force close it and all other programs you have open are unusable so you are forced to restart it. Having to do this often when I actually have time to play is so frustrating. When everything works it's great but for something nearly priced at $5k is simply not acceptable.

Title: Surprisingly great for the price
ReviewText: This laptop is not the most powerful thing you'll use, but for $250, it's excellent for Office applications and basic internet browsing like checking your email and watching 720p/1080p videos (1080p video stutters a little bit on some websites), and the SSD really makes a HUGE difference in performance, it boots up in a couple of seconds, and everything feels snappy even though the CPU is kinda weak and it only has 4GB of RAM.

Title: Good value, windows 10s easily changed
ReviewText: Great cheap laptop. It was sent to me with windows 10s, but with a quick Google search you can change it to regular windows 10 by going into your settings.

Title: Windows 10 S Mode
ReviewText: computers arrive with Windows 10 S Mode !! The big difference between Windows 10 S and any other version of Windows 10 is that 10 S can only run applications downloaded from the Windows Store !!

Title: Great basic laptop for the price!
ReviewText: Replaced a Dell basic laptop that was a few years old but ran windows 10. My dell died when the keyboard drank a cup of coffee: >) So I found this laptop for 250.00 on Amazon and I must say it is as good or better then the Dell. I am happy so far with the laptop it even has a DVD player which most are dropping. I don't watch DVD's but do use the player to record data to DVD's like photos and other data. I don't game online so can't say it is good for that probably not first pick for that but as a general use for people like me who mostly read emails and news online it is perfect!

Title: Best value for $250- fast

I really got it to play online games that require more intense graphics and gameplay. I am very happy with its value. I bought one with only 4Gb RAM from A local retail store for $200 but it was super slow. This Lenovo also starts right up after a reboot. Well worth the money.

Title: So Far So Good.....
ReviewText: HP 15-da1005dx - 15.6" HD Touch - i7-8565U - 12GB Memory - 256GB SSD. I've only had this PC for a couples of days. First, I chose this PC because I wanted a DVD drive, SSD memory, media card slot. This PC has all that and has HDMI capability. Price was right! So far I've been very pleased with the speed, and memory. With other PC's I've had trouble with the touch of the keyboard. Not this unit! Keyboard is very nice and it has a numeric pad.

Title: NOT 5-G compatible even after 90 minutes on a support call with HP
ReviewText: Received the laptop on time. Tried to connect to 5-G home network, not recognized by the computer. Checked drivers, the required ones to support 5-G were not installed. Checked for updates, installed updates, tried again - no 5-G. Called Amazon support after trying to contact HP myself. Amazon rep was extremely helpful and connected me to HP technical support. After 94 minutes, the HP rep was unable to locate either 5-G router in the available networks list and said I need to contact my internet service provider. Internet service provider came to the house today, changed the router to one which pushes the advertised 802.11ac signal - still no 5G. Via Facebook messenger, HP support stated that "after some research...found that the unit's wireless connectivity device is the Realtek RTL8723DE-CG which only supports 802.11bgn 2.4G single-chip. The description says 5-G compatible, it is NOT. HP can't make it so - do not waste your time or your money. I'm sending it straight back.

Title: works great so far
ReviewText: I've been using this machine for a few weeks now and it's been great. I like the feel of the keyboard, especially in comparison to the MacBook Pro I was using previously. The CPU is fast and handles everything I throw at it. The screen is bright and the graphics card provides enough acceleration to make the 3D modeling I do work smoothly. No problems so far. The internal speakers could be a bit louder. That's my only criticism.

Title: Screen flickers
ReviewText: The first laptop was little broken. I returned first laptop and received the second one. This time the screen is flickering.

Title: Love it but WiFi card is messed up
ReviewText: Love the product

Title: Great for Simulation Gaming
ReviewText: I bought the 2080Ti version and have had it for about a month now. I mostly use it for simulation gaming with an Oculus Rift S for flight sims like Digital Combat Simulator and IL-2. I am able to max all settings and still get buttery smooth frames. Also, when I'm not using Rift S I play: Arma 3 and other FPS with max settings on an overclocked 165Hz monitor and consistently get max frames of 165 or more. For a pre-built PC this a great choice over many of the competing brands. The vendor who shipped was fairly quick and it arrived nicely packaged. The RGB lighting is meh to me and happy I can turn it off and have only turned it on when I'm showing someone the inside of this beast. Will update review if anything else changes. Would I buy it again? Yes.

Title: Died < 60 days - Poor warranty terms
ReviewText: The product worked great for about a month and a half and then the graphics card failed. I just spent two hours with support and filling out RMA information. It will cost quite a bit of money to return at my expense. I find this unacceptable for the price and < 60 days use. The RMA paperwork indicates that I will be without the computer for up to 30 business days. I would never purchase this brand again.

Title: Worst Computer I Ever Purchased!
ReviewText: I have sent this POS back 2 times for repair and it STILL doesn't work!

Title: Great for gaming but super annoying...
ReviewText: I got this as a gift for my family member whos computer broke recently and need a new one, they said they wanted this one for i saw it on sale during cyber monday so i had to get on the deal. They have been loving the new device and i can see why, it performs well and fast but sitting near them using this device has been annoying because the clicks from the keyboard and mouse has been so loud its like someone shooting bullet out of a gun.... I still prefer to stick to a laptop with better performance but then again i dont game anymore so what can i say. Not knowledgable. I havent experience most of the issue that other reviewers say about it broke down and such yet, knock on wood. Will keep yall updated maybe in half a year or a year?

Title: Amazing gaming desktop.
ReviewText: I bought this for a few reasons. Iâ€™ve built desktops for a while now but didnâ€™t really see a savings in building something this high end part by part. Iâ€™d save a little but then Iâ€™d be on the hook for troubleshooting issues and dealing with warranty stuff individually too.

Title: Comprehensive Evaluationï¼š4 stars
ReviewText: Can run all the games smoothly with 2k resolution, RGB and silent chassis. If you donâ€™t know how to build your PC, it's a great choice.

Title: Great brand and this isn't an exception
ReviewText: If you have any tech savvy and know how to update drivers you won't have troubles with this computer. It's also made to modify. I've already added new memory and an 8tb hard drive. I just had to clear that up from other reviews. Also I have a background in board repair and general tech repair so that helps with troubleshooting and generally knowing my way around a computer. With all that aside, this computer is a beast. There weren't really any corners cut. Originally I couldn't find any info on the power supply. Turns out it has a Delta 850w 80 plus platinum. So one of the best. The only thing I would have to say is a little disappointing, is the samsung generic memory. It only has 3200mhz speeds which is a little less than I want in a $3000 rig, but it isn't bad. But overall I have to say I love this brand and this computer. I will definitely be buying more MSI in the future!

Title: A quality product you should be happy with for a long time.
ReviewText: I received the PC (MSI Infinite X Plus 9SF-270US) a couple weeks ago. It was packed well and I received it with no damage. All you have to do to start gaming/computing is plug in your monitor, keyboard, mouse, and power. Fired right up and went straight to Windows 10 setup. The system has the i9 9900K processor, 32 gigs of ram, RTX 2080 Ti MSI graphics card, a 500 meg M.2 system drive and 2 TB mechanical Harddrive. It comes with Windows 10 Pro, a mouse, and a keyboard; both MSI brand. The motherboard is the MSI MAG Z390M.

ReviewText: We have been so pleased with Lenovo products, in the recent past, when it came time to replace the "workhorse" station in the home office, I looked at other offerings but decided on the P330 because of features and cost. Needed a bit of room for expansion, so the Lenovo tiny machines were not considered. After getting rid of a lot of the Microsoft "bloatware", this primary workstation is sooo sweet. It runs Linux and Windows effortlessly, and I no longer have to worry about heat build-up, thanks to the Solid State Drive. I could go on and on, but in two words: Near Perfection!

Title: THIS IS THE BEST LAPTOP I HAVE EVER OWNED
ReviewText: It was about time to for me to look for a new laptop. The price and performance cannot be beat. The delivery was right on time. The set-up and configuration was exactly as I had ordered. I had not owned a touch screen before. I didn't know what I was missing. It works very well. I shopped around for some time. I am a tax guy so I was busy during tax season. I decided I had better get serious and when I saw this configuration and the price, I placed my order immediately.

Title: ideapad330 is the BEST budget laptop for business
ReviewText: I needed a simple laptop for work and the Lenovo 330 absolutely delivers. I opted for the upgraded 8GB ram and 512 SSD drive. This upgrade to the basic unit is a must. I'm running multiple Office windows, email and web browsing and it zips right thru them all. It's super quiet too. I love the design. Get the grey if you can. It has a metallic polished look with black keys. The keys aren't back lite, but I'm glad. It's super thin, but a little on the wide side. That's OK since I needed the full keypad for all that Excel work. For well under $400 with upgrades, it looks like a $1000+ laptop. Plus, it arrived 4 days earlier than craving savings vendor said it would.

Title: Its a winner!
ReviewText: The LENOVO IDEAPAD 330 is my first ever laptop computer, and I'm glad I chose this one. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was easy to set up and functions like a desk top. Having the DVD reader is a great feature. it allows loading programs from disk, and watching DVDs when my satellite internet is lagging. I went with 8MB of ram and 128GB SSD and have no issues at all. It boots up super fast and it's very quiet. I've been playing ELDER SCROLLS: OBLIVION on it, and it runs it better than my desk top did. Even if you are not a gamer, and are unfamiliar with OBLIVION, its a pretty good indication of a solid pc that this game runs well on this device. I've also been doing regular business on it as well, no complaints. The screen is plenty large, and crisp enough. I paid $300 for mine, and think that was a great value (I actually bought 2, one for the wife as well). Keyboard is nice, track pad works good, but I find a regular mouse is even better. Battery life seems to be pretty solid at 6-8 hours of continued use. I would recommend this to a friend or family member without hesitation.

Title: Fast computer with 8GB RAM & SSD
ReviewText: Personally, I think Lenovo is the best brand. This computer is so thin, light, and run fast and smoothly. The screen is anti-glare. The internet connection via wifi is stable. Its download and upload really fast. I recommend anyone who seeks to buy a laptop should choose SSD over HHD because SSD makes the laptop run fast; and also choose to buy a laptop that has 8GB RAM up. These will make the laptop run really fast! When I received my laptop, I couldn't control the screen brightness and I couldn't control the night light. It thought this computer is malfunction; but after I install new updates for my computer it solves the problems. I am so happy, and I like this laptop so much. The only problem is the website stated that this laptop has 128 gb but actually its only has 111gb. Anyway, this is enough of storage spaces to me; but I recommend to one who save a lot of data should be purchase ones with a storage spaces of 250GB or higher.

Title: Great little work laptop.
ReviewText: I bought this laptop to use at work. I'm a high school teacher and after changing schools I found it hard to switch to working on an old desktop rather than the laptop that I used at my previous school. My husband did some research (we're both techies and gamers) and picked this laptop. It's lightweight and easy to carry from home to school every day. It enables me to use tech in my work in a way that I am used to.

Title: Very good laptop at a great price
ReviewText: My first Lenovo computer and so far I am very happy with my purchase. The solid state drive allows for a speedy startup. I primarily use the laptop for email and web research and have no issues. The laptop is connected to an extensive network and works flawlessly after a few issues with the initial setup. This was more of an issue with Win 10 rather than the computer. So far I am very satisfied.

Title: Good, not great
ReviewText: The lenovo Ideapad S145 Notebook is very nice looking, thin laptop with a nice screen. The only downside that we found so far is the system locks up from time to time and or we get a microsoft message that says there was a problem and the laptop has to be shut down hard and restarted. Maybe this is a Windows 10 thing, but our desktop running the same OS (win 10 pro) doesn't have this problem.

Title: Best Laptop Value on the Market
ReviewText: I've had this now for about two weeks. I am a big fan of Lenovo products. I think they build better machines than the other competitors. This is my second Lenovo laptop. Here is what is especially nice about it. Even though I bought this on Amazon, the company that sold it buys the laptops from Lonovo, then doubles the RAM, eliminates the bloatware, updates all the drives and streamlines the machine for speed. They then repack the machine and ship it for considerably less than Lenovo sells the computer for retail without the enhancements. It saved me time and headaches setting the machine up and the increased RAM and lack of bloatware make it extremely fast. By adding a SP solid state 2TB drive that I connect to the computer, I have more storage, it is removable, and costs less than half that of a comparable computer with 1TB installed storage. This was the deal of the decade!!!

Title: Basic Laptop that works great
ReviewText: I had to purchase a laptop for the upcoming semester on short notice. Didn't have a big budget for a new device and just needed a laptop with good battery life & that would run MS Office and do web. Also, wanted a 15" screen for my eyes. Didn't know what to expect, I ordered the model with 8 GB of RAM & a 256 GB SSD. Laptop arrived with Windows 10 Pro. I installed MS Office, Chrome, & a few other applications which I'd need for school Also installed Norton Internet Security. After minimal updating/configuring, I tested the setup out. It works great. Time will tell if it lasts. Otherwise a nice little laptop for class, couldn't be happier. Screen resolution could be better, but it is not bad, it is adequate. I haven't had the chance to use the HDMI port to output to my 27 inch HD monitor yet though. I'd certainly recommend this device for anyone who needs a basic laptop for school, small business, or home use. Would be great for kids. I would definitely buy a model with 8 GB of RAM based on the RAM usage I saw in Task Manager. For a $335 laptop everything is great, can''t complain here. Great job guys. BW

Title: Amazingly fast, and Upgradable! Desktop quality CORE-I9 + RTX 2080-NOT MAXQ!
ReviewText: This is an awesome machine, everything except the battery life, but it is expected with a desktop quality Core I9 And a full desktop quality RTX 2080 - NOT MAX-Q! This thing is huge so be prepared to buy a huge backpack to carry it in! The only complaint is With ram, there is one 16GB stick of Samsung 2666mhz, = no dual channel and it is in the top 2 slots - Which means disassembling the entire computer to get to. No problem if you are a tech, but take it in to a shop if you are not! There are four slots all together and I believe a maximum of 128GB.

Title: Great Value
ReviewText: I like the different power saving modes and the ease of changing brightness & volume. It is also very fast and responsive.

Title: Best laptop I've owned in years despite thermal issues - UPDATE 05/20/2019
ReviewText: UPDATES 05/20/2019 - original review below.

Title: So far so good
ReviewText: Excellent computer. Well set up. One thing is the fans are LOUD.

Title: MacBook Pro Killer
ReviewText: Unless you've been living under a rock, you know that Windows laptops have gotten on par with Apple's MacBooks which were pretty much the reigning kings of outstanding build quality and performance on the go, and the Dell XPS 15 is without a doubt the closest you'll get to beating the MacBook Pro 15.

Title: Dead on Arrival and Dell support is nonsense
ReviewText: As many have described, this machine has a flaw and will likely fail. Mine got some flickering screen issue thats not solved without any update in driver or firmware. The problem persists even outside the OS. Before buying please note that and also search on youtube for this issue. As this machine includes only Mail in Warranty you will need to send it back for repair and wait for a week to get it back. The only solution to this would be to upgrade the warranty for an on site visit but Dell also makes that difficult and does not provide an online option for doing so.

Title: These units must be defective, slower than my 10+ year cheap computer.
ReviewText: As in prior ratings, this is awful, absolutely worthless. It took hours to download Chrome and then it could not find my personal account. It is certainly not the dell xps 15 I have used in stores prior to purchasing this. Buy this machine if you want to wait over 5 minutes to open a new tab tab and to waste good money on absolute junk. Dell needs to pull these computers before their reputation is tainted for good. Do yourself a favor and buy HP Spectre 360 15 which is cheaper or the Dell Inspiron 7000 series (much cheaper) or even the Dell Inspiron 5000 series (half the price) All have 13 and 15, and Dells have 17, all touchscreens and perform much better than this. The positives: Screen and feel of keyboard and touch pad but makes no difference if you are going to stare at a blank screen waiting to load a web page. This model computer is rated #1 for 15 inch on most sites but this product on here is not it, this is defective. It was so slow to open up my Amazon tab that I was able to plug in, start up and get to Amazon quicker on my other computer. Received this item today and it is being reset (I dread how much time that will take) and packaged up to be returned. I am also contacting Dell to make them aware of this.

Title: Wow!! Incredible, but requires work to get there.....
ReviewText: Out of the box, this laptop was not performing. Bad drivers, bloatware, etc.

Title: Great laptop, but the fingerprint reader is NOT available on this model.
ReviewText: Since I was already familiar with the HP brand and generally liked its products and support, I purchased this model with the 512 SSD and 32 GB RAM because I wanted something very fast. I've had it for about a week now, and I am not disappointed in the speed since I configured it this way, but I was disappointed to find that the fingerprint reader is NOT available on this model. I felt that the description advertising this model is misleading, thus the 4 stars instead of 5. The seller should clarify the posting for this model so that others do not think that they will be able to use the fingerprint reader.

Title: Great for Creatives (After Effects!) and Great for Gamers, But Undervolt is a Must!
ReviewText: TL;DR:

Title: BEST GAMING LAPTOP WITH A "PROFESSIONAL LOOK" HANDS DOWN!
ReviewText: I am a director of I.T. for an accounting firm. I constantly have my hands on laptops from many vendors, old and new. While this is the first laptop I have touched from Gigabyte, I must say I am SERIOUSLY impressed with Gigabyte's ability to get a RTX 2070 in a laptop this thin and light and STILL KEEP IT CLASSY LOOKING AND IN PREMIUM MATERIALS! This is an all aluminum, jet-black laptop people. I can sit in the board room with my peers and work on this machine without being embarrassed of how it looks and still play the latest AAA games at ultra settings in full HD. What more could a "Professional Nerd" want! Oh, I know - how about the largest battery possible that is still allowed in a carry on bag during business trips?! Yes please!!!! I am SOOOOO happy with this purchase! Thank you Gigabyte!!

Title: Great computer but WHY NO NVME?
ReviewText: Great computer but only received it with a Hybrid drive which is horrible. It's very slow from that. I had to change that immediately so my wife can work at the speed intended. With the hybrid drive it was horrible switched to a full NVME solution instead and now the computer boots in under 3 seconds. And the speed is much more of what is to be expected from a 2 G laptop.

Title: Amzing Quality and Specs
ReviewText: The laptop looks stunning and runs like a beast. The rgb on the keyboard along with rgb strips along the front and back of the laptop make it look amazing both at day and night. The screen is perfect and the graphics look stunning. Only downside would be the battery as I get about an estimated 4-5 hours from normal use, and much less when gamin; although this is okay because I play plugged in anyway. Overall a very nice laptop.

Title: Great 17 inch gaming laptop in a 15 inch chassis
ReviewText: I've been through 4 laptops in the last year, and this one finally is what I was looking for: something powerful but not huge, in a good looking chassis. My Alienware 17 R5 was hilariously heavy and huge, the MSI gs63 was boring looking and big for a smaller 15 inch screen, while this one is built well, fast, and very well built.

Title: Started failing shortly after receiving device
ReviewText: The laptop continuously bluescreens and reports that there is no harddrive. I fiddle with it or just set it aside and it sometimes boots back up. Last time i saved all my files off of it. now i'm just trying to figure out how to get it replaced.

Title: Do NOT buy this laptop, or Any Asus laptops! The company is ripping off consumers!
ReviewText: 3/17/2018: Update after sending my notebook to Asus under RMA. Asus has refused to repair my notebook and tried to bill me a for a new unit. A technician at Asus damaged my notebook and they are blaming it on me. I escalated to top management and was told they would provide me a 20% discount to buy another one! Unbelievable, but this tells me the current Asus management is out to rip off people! do NOT buy their products!

Title: Completed hardware tests on unpacking
ReviewText: I will be updating this review as I use it, but I wanted to give my first impressions.

Title: Screen Not Ready for Primetime
ReviewText: I'd love to give this laptop a better review, but I can't, because it never got past the initial setup. The first one I received within a couple of minutes had numerous discolored vertical lines in a two inch slice of the screen, which persisted through reboots and were visible in BIOS and in a separate boot environment. The replacement I received looks to have been previously returned based on the manufacturer tape being split and covered with regular shipping tape, and it too had a screen issue. Backlight bled up from the bezel, which may not be a dealbreaker if this was a $300 laptop, but I'm not paying $1800 for a laptop with a screen with ANY defects.

Title: Good but with some annoying keyboard issues.
ReviewText: First off, I am not a gamer. I purchased a gaming laptop to edit 4k videos, to run Adobe filters, and run intense trading algorithms. That being said, I HATE the keyboard. The AWS & d keys are white, which looks so tacky. Next the font of all the letters of the keyboard is wierd and gamer like, a normal person can hardly tell what the letters are the font is so far off normal. Lately the delete key is not over the backspace key, it's over 1 key, why on earth change that, I have to go looking for it all the time and because I can hardly read the keys am always missing it. The camo design is also super cheesy the fake carbon fiber too. The computer is fast, it's as big and heavy as my 5 year old Toshiba satellite that I am replacing, I was expecting a 17" laptop to be thinner after 5 years especially now that the CD rom is gone. All in all it's a good laptop which is fully on and ready 5 seconds after opening it, I just wish whoever designed the keyboard would be fired or maybe executed idk. I also think its annoying that not even a gamer designed laptop can be free of a ton of bloatware. I mean really does Asus make that much money from annoying its customers with all the unneeded programs preinstalled. The battery life is awful too. The shortest of any laptop I think I've ever had. Ok so bottom line it's not perfect but I like the quality and speed of this laptop.... just keep it plugged in and dont look down! The end.

Title: Dongles? Where we are going we don't need dongles !
ReviewText: I like large computers with lots of ports. If you are a macbook fan, go, buy Apple's anorexic computers, you'll be happy until you discover that you need a bunch of dongles to do basic stuff.

Title: Very powerful at base settings.
ReviewText: The laptop honestly runs superb without needed to be OC just to get needed fps. Most game on typical setting people would play then with for performance instead of pure visual(which it is capable of for a huge amount of games) it easily outputs greater than 145fps. In most cases I get around 160-260fps depending on the game being played and which settings are used. The air cooling is one of the absolute best I've ever seen, rarely ever does the GPU hit 80 Celsius while gaming for long periods. The biggest and pretty much the only downfall of this laptop is the OC settings are barely there...you can't OC it much higher than it is already at as most settings are perma locked while trying to OC the GPU off the start. I would still highly recommend this this purchase for those with the cash to spend, and want the closest thing to a portable desktop.

Title: Breaks constantly, couldn't more disappointed
ReviewText: This is for MSI as a whole. People need to know about this. Will post on other products as well. Mine is the MSI GT75 Titan-055. Within 2 months of purchase, it stopped recognizing it was plugged into power, battery died, wouldn't charge, and wouldn't turn on. I called customer service and asked if mechanical problems happen a lot with these laptops, they said no (a lie). They make you pay for shipping to get repaired and repairs take a month (they don't allow you to pay more to get it expedited, even if you use it for work). Within a month of receiving the repaired laptop, it broke again in the exact same way. I emailed customer service and asked if I could extend my warranty, get a replacement, or just cut my losses and try to return it for half price bc I received a defective product. They said the warranty only covers repairs, no replacement, they don't accept returns, and you can only extend your warranty within 3 months of purchase. First of all, they make this fact very hard to discover and they never made that clear when I registered my product, I only discovered it after google searching following the second breakdown. Even then, I couldn't figure out how to do it on their website, they likely only do it if you take the initiative to find out they even offer it and then call yourself. Since they had it for an entire month repairing it the first time, a month that effectively ran out the clock on my chance to extend the warranty, I couldn't really know I would really really need that extended warranty until it broke again. I did extensive research and discovered these kinds of mechanical failures are very common. Either they use cheap parts or just don't pay much attention to build quality and/or testing. Now I'm out $3500 with a laptop that will likely keep breaking periodically, each time taking a month to repair, and then after my 12 month warranty is up, it will be up to me to shell out hundreds-thousands of dollars more to get it fixed regularly. More people need to know that there is a fairly strong chance they will get bilked out of thousands of dollars and MSI will stick dogmatically to their "policy" of not accepting returns on defective products, not replacing the product outright and instead putting bandaids on their fundamentally flawed machines, and shady practice of hiding the ability to extend your warranty until it's too late. Even if you offer to pay a lot of money to get them to bend the rules on their "policy." They know that the cost of repairs will become too much for them and they want to dump the responsibility on you as fast as possible.

Title: Easily Up-gradable. Have loaded Ubuntu 18.04 and later, Pop!_OS 18.04 and later. Fedora 29.
ReviewText: Love the face recognition when logging into Windows 10. Haven't been able to get that part working with a variety of Linux distros yet. I have successfully loaded and run with Ubuntu 18.04/18.10/19.04 with both gnome and budgie desktops. Pop!_OS 18.04 and 18.10 with gnome 3 desktop. Fedora 29 and Fedora 30 beta with gnome 3 desktop. Bought my X1 Extreme 32GB Ram and 1 TB Intel NVME m.2 2280.. Added a second 1 TB Samsung 970 EVO Plus NVME m.2 2280 drive. Currently have Intel SSD loading Fedora and 970 EVO Plus booting windows and Ubuntu 19.04. Triple booting with plenty of spare space for data. And the keyboard is excellent. I don't miss using an external keyboard and often don't.

But a 3k laptop has to be perfect made, the screen frame has a very notable gap between the screen and the screen cover, im afraid if something like food or water get into and damages the screen. ReviewText: Discharges while gaming. The unit comes with two power supplies and with both plugged in the battery still discharges while under a load gaming. I am having to return it to asus for repair. 6-8 weeks they say.

Title: Bad Unit - Real Sorry I Purchased This Laptop
ReviewText: The microphone doesn't work. Headset microphones do not work either. Did some troubleshooting with technical support. Now they want me to backup all of my data, wipe it off the machine, send the machine to the support depot, and they will return it 7-10 days later, if they have all of the parts. Yeah great. I know this is a game machine, but I purchased it to do work (machine learning), and now I am stuck without it because it was not properly tested before leaving their factory.

Title: Cooling
ReviewText: When you buy a laptop like this and it's not your first rodeo with gaming laptops your biggest concern is usually how well the laptop can keep itself cool while gaming. Two days in and let me tell you, this laptop exceeds my expectations. Very impressed. If you're like me and this is the top priority (of course besides performance which this laptop brings in spades) then this is the laptop for you. No issues, hours of gaming so far. Love it.

Title: Could be considered a desktop replacement sort of laptop!
ReviewText: Amazing computer. I have two monitors running on it and it performs quite well. I also have used my valve index with it and it stays cool, and I can run it for hours with only one charger plugged in. But without at least one charger in, the battery will drain so fast, even doing basic things. The only thing I can say is itâ€™s advertised to have 4 USB 3 ports and it has 3. There is no USB C , there is a thunderbolt. Maybe when writing the description they mistook the thunderbolt for the USB C they thought it had.

Title: FINALLY!! 1x32gb ! Flawless!!
ReviewText: This is one of the few 32gb options on Amazon and a better price than the "kits" so many sellers try to trick people into buying. 32gb of RAM in one slot and I still have room for another 32gb of RAM. Finding these can be difficult because other sellers try to pass off a 2x16gb "kit" as a single 32gb module. Rest assured, this is one 32gb module. I just installed it today and did a fresh windows 10 pro x64 install and it works flawlessly. If you're looking for 1x32gb to boost your system performance, this is the one to buy.

While this is the first laptop I have touched from Gigabyte, I must say I am SERIOUSLY impressed with Gigabyte's ability to get a RTX 2070 in a laptop this thin and light and STILL KEEP IT CLASSY LOOKING AND IN PREMIUM MATERIALS! This is an all aluminum, jet-black laptop people. I can sit in the board room with my peers and work on this machine without being embarrassed of how it looks and still play the latest AAA games at ultra settings in full HD. What more could a "Professional Nerd" want! Oh, I know - how about the largest battery possible that is still allowed in a carry on bag during business trips?! Yes please!!!! I am SOOOOO happy with this purchase! Thank you Gigabyte!!

Title: Memory and SSD are really slow. All latest drivers installed.
ReviewText: Out of the box, the first thing i do is install all the latest drivers from the manufacturers website. I then ran Novabench against it and, I'm not impressed at all.

Title: Great Gaming Laptop under $2K
ReviewText: I had been wanting a new gaming laptop for a few months. When my ASUS G50VT-X5 died after 10 years of faithful service, it was time. After a couple of months of use, I can say I am extremely happy with my purchase.

Title: RTX 2060 but runs like a 1050.....
ReviewText: First look the laptop is solid. Single color red lit back keyboard. Latop is pretty light. Screen itself is nice and sharp and does run at 120hz. Seems like a solid laptop until you start playing games on it. The FPS is extremely disappointing for what it is. BFV i would get an average FPS of 70-80 on medium settings. Apex would get average 90-100 on low settings. I do have raytracing turned off on BFV and all my settings are set to performance within the nivdia control panel and the power options. The dragon center was also set to performance. Comparing benchmarks with other rtx 2060 cards, the performance is about half of what is expected. I'm going to assume that the i5 8300h is bottlenecking the GPU. I did a clean reinstall of windows and still got the same results. The nividia drivers are up to date. TBH its a waste of money. You're buying a 2060 laptop with 1050 performance. Ending up returning this and getting the 8750h version. Also another downside is that you cannot add another internal HDD without breaking the factory warrant seal. I ended up using a external HD to make more room. What's also annoying is that the 256 gb pcie card is partitioned into 2 drives. The CPU temps average around 80 -85 C with the gpu temps averaging around 75c. The cooler boost is annoyingly loud. Now with the temps reaching that high you wont be able to feel which is a plus. Now if there's a fix that would be nice but it should not be running like this right off the bat.

Title: Great gaming laptop at price point
ReviewText: Another reviewer said he was getting 1050 performance out of this lappy, but that has not been my experience at all. We are a laptop gaming household and we have this MSI with the 2060 as described above (i5 processor), an Acer Helios 300 with the 1060 (i7), an acer aspire vx with a 1050ti (i7) and an hp with a 1050 (i5). All laptops are 15 inch. Please see the above benchmarks for the results I get. The 2060 is 3x the power of the 1050.

Title: Sensual laptop
ReviewText: I headed for my bedroom, heart racing as I knew what lay beyond the door. I could smell the scent of hot laptop. It enticed me to play anthem. It brought me close many times to visual climax, the stunning quality of the graphics. The laptop softly whispered in my ears via the sound jack at crisp quality only a laptop of this mangitutde can provide. I felt the laptop as I ran my fingers on her keyboard, never got stuck at all and the key presses were smooth. Have had many night with my laptop untill I eventually get bored and dump her for another one.

Title: Latest technology at an affordable price!
ReviewText: This is my 3rd MSI laptop I've owned and by far the most powerful. It has the latest in tech, including the latest 6-core I-5 processor, an Nvidia RTX 2060 GPU and PCI-e NVM hard drive and the price point for this laptop was a steal. While the hard drive is on the low end in terms of space, another PCI-e NVM hard drive can be added and the available memory of 16 GB should satisfy most. If not, the max memory it will hold is 32 GB. I use this laptop mostly for gaming and VR and it hasn't disappointed in the least.

Title: The best of what's around. (Updated)

Title: Well performing for the price
ReviewText: I did a lot of research into which gaming laptop I would buy, then decided to give this one a shot. I wasn't too thrilled with its built-in capacity, but it's nothing a couple of ~$100 m2 drives couldn't fix. So far it has performed admirably in both conventional gaming and VR. If I had one complaint it'd be that the keyboard layout is off. I can't quite say how, but it just feels... weird. I constantly wind up shifted one key to the side of what I'm trying to type, and I don't know why. Battery life is also very nice, with gaming I get about 3 hours on 75% charge.

Title: Gaming Laptop is No Longer a Gimmick
ReviewText: I used to be the person who thinks a gaming laptop is unpractical and waste of money. It's bulky, heavy, and it will probably run out of battery 2hr after being unplugged from the outlet. Therefore, I have always done my PC gaming on desktop only.

Title: Fast machine for productivity and gaming
ReviewText: Primarily an application/web developer I plan to use this for productivity. The size and weight of the machine are great compared to other machines I have been given to use. But for starting my own company I love the understated looks compared to the power and battery life it hold inside. The ability to hook up three 4K monitors at 60Hz with out a docking station means that productivity can happen any where there is a monitor and any of the 3 cable types. Also no docking station required if that is your choice. I will be pairing this with a thunderbolt 3 dock and the Mini Display port option on the laptop to drive my triple monitor setup. only 3 cables all on the same side will allow for a desktop experience that can travel when I need to. With a battery life that allows for 6 to 7 hours of cord free productivity it is a power house that can satisfy my urge for the occasional game. Hitting over 120 frames on ultra settings @ 1080p in the games I like to play(Starcraft II) means that I can even be bold enough to scale up to an external monitor.

Title: Defective Item awfull customer service
ReviewText: Defective item, vieo output is not working, we took too long to figure it out and then to make sure it was actually the device. We contacted the seller with no answer.

ReviewText: Great laptop for the price. We've bought several of these for our business.
