Title: Great but....
ReviewText: It's a very powerful laptop and it does everything I need it to from editing to gaming and obviously simple stuff like documents and Excel spreadsheets. There is a little backlight bleed in the screen but I don't mind it at all. Battery life when doing intensive stuff will drop but for such a powerful machine, it does well with battery life. I can get around 4 hours of intensive work and around 6 maybe more for regular day use. Software is good comes with customizable RGB lighting with steel engine and had the MSI dragon center where you can fiddle with all the specs to make it your own. Build is solid but could be better especially for the price point. Would have been nice if it had fingerprint already built in or something. But that is fixed with a simple fingerprint reader. I'm pretty satisfied with it now that I've made the purchase. I've had no problems with it at all which is good since I've only had it for two months but it's holding up well. It attracts fingerprints on it and storage is low but you can upgrade the storage with two more SSD just check that it is compatible. I might look to Razer just to see how it compares especially at this price point. ($2199 @purchase) would still recommend because it has power, little problems, solid build, good keyboard, overall really intuitive machine.

Screen is clear and bright, keyboard feels good and the lights are fairly easy to configure, and the sound is pretty solid. Nothing whatsoever to complain about so far.

Title: Just VR
ReviewText: I added this laptop to my arsenal of systems, this MSI GS65 was what I needed for my Oculus Rift. It works great and some gaming on this system. The 2070 Max Q RTX it's ok but I love my other systems, all are AMD 1st gen, 2nd and 3 gen (Ryzen 1700X- 2700X and 3700X).

Title: FPS
ReviewText: I bought it for editing videos and playing Fortnite and it worked great no problems at all Medium settings getting around 144 to 240 FPS no problem at all

Title: Powerful Gaming Computer Slim Form Factor
ReviewText: This laptop is exactly as advertised. Powerful gaming system in a slim form factor. It has subtle design features that donâ€™t scream â€œgaming laptopâ€. It comes without much bloatware. Gets fairly hot with gaming and battery life is not great, but this was expected based on reviews of last years model. Overall Iâ€™m very happy with the purchase.

Title: So far so good
ReviewText: I shopped and tried a few different laptops before settling on this one. The screen is the best I've seen so far with minimal backlight bleed. Sound is amazing with 2 speakers and 2 woofers. Sound on the strix scar 1 was crap on the 3 different units I tried (left speaker was defective). Keyboard feels really really good, with a layout better than the strix scar 2. Webcam placement is as intended. I could not get over the placement on the strix scar 2. It was basically unusable in certain situations. Screen angle extends to ~150 degrees which is more than I need. Size is about the same as the 6 year old 15 inch lappy its replacing and it fits in the same backpack without issue. Weight is fine.

Title: Solid Laptop for the Price
ReviewText: After a few months of research, I finally settled on this one with the 2060 video card instead of the 2070. Reading the reviews and comparing tests, the 2070 gave a slightly better FPS rate on some games, but not all. It didn't seem like a worth-while purchase for more money. Instead I invested it into a cooling pad and a longer warranty on this machine.

Title: Without good customer support, a simple flaw becomes an Amazon return/refund
ReviewText: MSI has a good reputation, but it sure as hell isn't for their customer support. My laptop had some issues like light bleed on the monitor, god awful battery life and an abysmal lack of external monitor hook up options but I was happy to look past that if the performance was good, which it was! Then the audio started crapping out.

Title: Great Laptop but one thing....

Title: Bad support

Title: HUGE step up from my previous Asus laptop!
ReviewText: I fell in love with Asus laptops when I got my first one (which served me for eight years), and I was already sold on Asus when I decided to semi-retire my first one and purchase a new laptop.

Title: Awesome laptop
ReviewText: Awesome laptop great design great sound quality the graphics are nice for built in graphics battery lasts around 5 to 6 hours under medium workload. battery could be a bit better for storage I recommend getting an ssd it comes with a 2 tb hdd but it is slow. upgrade it to an ssd for maximum performance. boot time is slow but thats just because of the hdd

Title: Great Laptop!
ReviewText: I bought this laptop mainly for school and to play games with my boyfriend and so far it been really great! In addition, some of my instructors just give us the scanned copies of the assignments on iLearn and the touch screen ability with the Wacom pen is really useful for taking a full screen snip and writing on it using the "whiteboard" app. I've had no problems with it so far and doubt that I'll have any anytime soon. There are only 2 usb ports which I've only found an issue with once, but I am glad that it has an hdmi port as well, SD card slot, and one for the jack. There is also another one that looks like a type c charge, but I don't know what its for and haven't needed it so its not that important for me. Most of the ports are on the right side and I'd personally prefer them on the left, but they're not that bothersome. I also love the fingerprint feature on this thing! It can also flip all the way back and be used in tablet mode, there is even a Microsoft store to install things that you would normally have on a tablet. I personally use it for doodling or playing games like gardenscapes. This thing has a bunch of storage too, I've transferred so many pictures, and there is still so much more!

Title: After 1 year, I still cannot use the memory card reader
ReviewText: I bought this laptop exactly a year ago today, but until now the memory card reader has been unusable. I inserted different memory cards but none of them were detected/read. Did research online about what could the problem be but since I am not really a techie, I could only go so far. The device manager does not show any driver for the Realtek Card Reader ( which this laptop is supposed to have, as shown in the Dell Support website), and though I tried several times to download the driver from the support site, nothing ever showed in the Device Manager. Another method I used from the online support site is to have it specifically detect the driver, but again No driver detected! Could it be that the driver was installed somewhere else inside the laptop? Possibly. But hey, as a customer, why would I be handed this headache when I paid the full amount they asked? Why ship this unit without making sure that everything was working? I suspect that this is a renewed unit and maybe when they're refurbishing this, they incorrectly attached the physical memory card port. I wish I knew the right answer to this. One more thing, the specs re the hard drive is confusing. I thought I was getting a laptop with an SSD drive along with the 1TB HDD. Checking the device manager, I realized that no SSD was included. The seller wasn't clearly up front with what were excluded compared to those new units sold from Dell itself.

Title: Arrived quickly and working flawlessly
ReviewText: I've only had the laptop for less than a week, and so far everything has been great. The laptop arrived quickly and was new and reflected everything stated in the product info. I've been very pleased with this laptop and the vendor's delivery of it. Additionally, the laptop was very easy to setup, because of the Microsoft guided setup wizard pre-installed on it.

Title: Disappointed in the customer service
ReviewText: I bought this laptop in may 2019 and now Suddenly wifi and bluetooth vanished from this. I tried everything and contacted amazon, I am very disappointed in the service i received on the issue. It is supplied by third party seller, but they are refusing to help. Amazon keeps directing me back to them. Dell is not helping either, after a 2 hour call, dell support realized that it is a software issue which is not covered in the warranty. To sum up, my laptop is still not fixed and i am doing all this from past two weeks. So beware buying electronics from amazon which is sold by third party seller.

Title: No good
ReviewText: Not what was advised, slow sluggish and a joke... stops charging periodically and the screen shuts down out of no where, takes more then 5 minutes to start up... an the seller is not willing to help or solve any problems with the device return or exchange

I have been using a MacBook Pro for the past six years and was a little antsy about returning to a PC. My entire team is on a PC so I had to join them. I don't regret the reunion with Dell.

Title: THIRD update: ASUS support lies. Second round of repairs fail.

The tech I worked with over a month ago told me that if the problem returned my machine would be replaced. I will not send this back in. The only acceptable resolution is replacement. I've lost literally months while this machine went back and forth to the ASUS repair facility and I'm still stuck with brick. I will never buy another ASUS computer. This is literally the worst computer purchase I've ever made and I've been using these things since the late 1980s.

Title: Laptop was unusable when received
ReviewText: When I received my laptop the seal on the box was cut. On initial boot-up I got an error message saying that it had been interrupted and needed to be restarted to reinstall Windows. A restart only got the same message. I started hitting the F keys on boot-up until I got into system recovery and from there reinstalled Windows. After everything was up I realized the back-lighting on the keyboard was not working. I turned the computer over to get the product code and saw the factory seal on the bottom was cut. When attempting to get a replacement I was informed it wasn't eligible for replacement. I had used my Amazon card for the special financing and the only way I can get it again is to return it and wait for the refund then reorder. I'm very disappointed in both the product received and the solution to the issue.

Title: Great for gaming. Solid build quality. Kooky old school 'gamer' aesthetic.
ReviewText: So far I love it. 3450 on Unigine Heaven Extreme preset with no OC or tweaking of any kind. Butter smooth 1440p 144 hz gaming on Apex Legends (separate monitor). Solid build quality.

Title: Great for video editing too!
ReviewText: This is my second MSI laptop. Iâ€™ve had other brands like Dell and HP. MSI is much better over all for features and speed options. My first MSI failed, not because of hardware but because of a separate software issue. I bought both to edit video and photos, not game. The led keyboard with key by key assignable color is brilliant to remind you of which key do what function. I like the ergonomics better than my other MSI. Itâ€™s smaller and lighter than my 17 inch, but doesnâ€™t feel like it. I like the curve at the palm of the mousepad so much more. The lidâ€™s led lights are a cool gimmick that I never see. Itâ€™s very fast so far! I can run Adobe CC, Vegas Pro, and DaVinci Resolve very well. One issue I have seen so far when editing video or photos is the screen calibration. There are various MSI schemes and initially I chose â€œdesignerâ€ thinking it would work best but it made some of my old pics and videos look terrible. I found the MSI True Color Panel and switched to sRGB and it looks right again. Render speeds for 1080p video were speedy. Of course, Itâ€™s only been a week so weâ€™ll see.

Title: Amazing laptop with short battery life
ReviewText: This laptop is amazing, as long as it remains plugged in. This machine can handle just about any current games with little frame rate drop. Only downside is the battery life. Only about 1.5 hours un interrupted without being plugged in.

Title: A Transportable Gaming System
ReviewText: My Zephyrus GX701 system came from Mobile Advance with a 1 TB M.2 NVMe SSD with 16 GB RAM. RTX2080 MaxQ with 144hz of sweet G-Sync. Arrived on time as stated by the 2day shipping guaranteed.

Title: the 16GB memory version runs in dual channel mode, if that matters to you
ReviewText: If you add more memory to this laptop (16GB module or higher), memory will run in single channel mode. This may impact gaming frame rates in certain titles. Overall I'm really happy with this laptop so far, the RTX 2080 MQ is the 90W version and closer to desktop performance vs other RTX 2080 MQ designs out there.

Title: The Most Powerful (And Slimmest) Laptop Around
ReviewText: The day I received this beast of a machine was probably the best of my life. This was the first steps into great graphics, speedy response times, and ultimate gaming heaven for me when dealing with laptops. Personally, I've built my own custom rigs and had full blown setups with 3 monitors having high refresh rates, latest and greatest in graphics, and all the bang for your buck. HOWEVER! I joined the military and had to get rid of it all but I was in the market for something powerful but portable. After many hours of careful consideration from credible sources and great videos (Shoutout to LTT for the best review), I came across this beauty! Now, I've had a day to get used to the machine and set it up just the way I like it and without a shadow of doubt, this thing is as close to a full blown tower setup as you'll get. The smooth monitor, best in graphics for laptops, easy gliding keyboard, and software that help enhance the over all experience when using this beauty. Anybody who is looking into buying this and is unsure, trust me when I say that it's well worth the money and will not let you down. Thank you for this great laptop!

Title: Display and G-SYNC options missing
ReviewText: Great laptop! Very fast and looks fantastic. Man, what a beast. However, it appears the Display and G-SYNC options are missing even though this supports G-SYNC. There is even an nVidia G-SYNC sticker on the lower-left corner of the screen.

Screen is clear and bright, keyboard feels good and the lights are fairly easy to configure, and the sound is pretty solid. Nothing whatsoever to complain about so far.

Title: Just VR
ReviewText: I added this laptop to my arsenal of systems, this MSI GS65 was what I needed for my Oculus Rift. It works great and some gaming on this system. The 2070 Max Q RTX it's ok but I love my other systems, all are AMD 1st gen, 2nd and 3 gen (Ryzen 1700X- 2700X and 3700X).

Title: FPS

Title: Powerful Gaming Computer Slim Form Factor
ReviewText: This laptop is exactly as advertised. Powerful gaming system in a slim form factor. It has subtle design features that donâ€™t scream â€œgaming laptopâ€. It comes without much bloatware. Gets fairly hot with gaming and battery life is not great, but this was expected based on reviews of last years model. Overall Iâ€™m very happy with the purchase.

Title: Impressive
ReviewText: Design (5/5): Mechanically, this laptop is beautiful and elegantly designed. The bottom air vent that opens when the screen lid opens which was a pleasant surprise! Something so simple, yet useful. The RGB/AURA lighting works as intended and is a nice, non-ostentatious touch. EXTREMELY thin and light for such a huge powerhouse.

Title: Powerful Yet Power Hungry
ReviewText: If you want no compromises for gaming (or really and GPU/CPU intensive) task, this one is for you.

Title: Amazing laptop! Benchmark from hashcat in photo.
ReviewText: Cons: Limited linux support at this time. Which is understandable since it's brand new hardware. I am pretty sure that I could get this working with a little effort. I am even more sure that it'll be supported fully out of the box with popular distros in a few months or less. I'd have paid a few hundred more for a thunderbolt3 port or two. The USBC ports appear to be just that, USB. All of my usability complaints are related to windows 10. I am not saying "Windows sucks", it just isn't what I am used to. It does seem to have issues with driver signing and CUDA, which is a PITA but not really the laptop's fault. I just boot w/o driver signing and it works.

Title: Unusable Brick
ReviewText: ASUS has the worst support, and Microsoft Windows 10 is terrible. I thought that updating to Windows 10 2004 would be a good idea, but that was a bad idea. Now I can not get back to the previous version, and there are a couple of games that can not run on 2004 -- resulting in a blue screen BSOD. I reinstalled Windows 10, using the "local" option, so not from the internet, but it's 2004 somehow. There are no options in the settings to roll back and MyAsus also provides no guidance. ASUS support TERRIBLE (and so is Microsoft). Crappy, spending this much money on a laptop that isn't usable.

Title: good gaming system
ReviewText: I'm not a hardcore gamer but having lived with a Dell E6410 for the last 10 years I knew I wanted to upgrade once that system could no longer even play World of Warships.. So I researched around and decided on this system from Asus. I do like Asus products to being with, they always seem well made to me. I decided to go with the RX 2080 GPU so as to get as many years out of this thing going forward as I possibly can, obviously the GPU blows away anything I'm trying to use it for now. I'm not an expert so I just plugged and played World of Warships with max'ed out settings and was getting 75 fps on average, good enough for me to be impressed. My only regret is that there wasn't a larger SSD drive configuration with either 1TB or 2TB at the time I bought the laptop, those were not options on the item at the time.

Title: Great gaming and creating laptop
ReviewText: Great gaming laptop. Absolutely love it. Only knock is the battery life but who doesn't keep their charger in while playing games for hours so I could care less about the battery

Title: slim and light laptop with good performance!
ReviewText: I used this laptop for gamin and programming. I don't like that home and end works thru fn, not convenient when programming.

Title: Arrived on time and as described.
ReviewText: Arrived in a timely manner and was packaged well. So far, everything works great and it is performing exceptionally.

Title: Do NOT buy this laptop, or Any Asus laptops! The company is ripping off consumers!
ReviewText: 3/17/2018: Update after sending my notebook to Asus under RMA. Asus has refused to repair my notebook and tried to bill me a for a new unit. A technician at Asus damaged my notebook and they are blaming it on me. I escalated to top management and was told they would provide me a 20% discount to buy another one! Unbelievable, but this tells me the current Asus management is out to rip off people! do NOT buy their products!

Title: Completed hardware tests on unpacking
ReviewText: I will be updating this review as I use it, but I wanted to give my first impressions.

Title: Screen Not Ready for Primetime
ReviewText: I'd love to give this laptop a better review, but I can't, because it never got past the initial setup. The first one I received within a couple of minutes had numerous discolored vertical lines in a two inch slice of the screen, which persisted through reboots and were visible in BIOS and in a separate boot environment. The replacement I received looks to have been previously returned based on the manufacturer tape being split and covered with regular shipping tape, and it too had a screen issue. Backlight bled up from the bezel, which may not be a dealbreaker if this was a $300 laptop, but I'm not paying $1800 for a laptop with a screen with ANY defects.

Title: Good but with some annoying keyboard issues.
ReviewText: First off, I am not a gamer. I purchased a gaming laptop to edit 4k videos, to run Adobe filters, and run intense trading algorithms. That being said, I HATE the keyboard. The AWS & d keys are white, which looks so tacky. Next the font of all the letters of the keyboard is wierd and gamer like, a normal person can hardly tell what the letters are the font is so far off normal. Lately the delete key is not over the backspace key, it's over 1 key, why on earth change that, I have to go looking for it all the time and because I can hardly read the keys am always missing it. The camo design is also super cheesy the fake carbon fiber too. The computer is fast, it's as big and heavy as my 5 year old Toshiba satellite that I am replacing, I was expecting a 17" laptop to be thinner after 5 years especially now that the CD rom is gone. All in all it's a good laptop which is fully on and ready 5 seconds after opening it, I just wish whoever designed the keyboard would be fired or maybe executed idk. I also think its annoying that not even a gamer designed laptop can be free of a ton of bloatware. I mean really does Asus make that much money from annoying its customers with all the unneeded programs preinstalled. The battery life is awful too. The shortest of any laptop I think I've ever had. Ok so bottom line it's not perfect but I like the quality and speed of this laptop.... just keep it plugged in and dont look down! The end.

ReviewText: I don't know why MichaelsElectronics2 does not have more comments. I was a little hesitant to buy from them as they had no real reviews. I am glad I did buy the HP Envy. The configuration I got was simply not available from the manufacturer and if it was probably would have cost double. If you are like me and need more space I would take a look to see what this vendor is offering. They modified this Envy and still looked brand new when I received it. Computer is lightning fast and has storage galore. Overall very impressed!

Title: Nothing High Performance about this computer
ReviewText: Quite possibly the worst performing laptop that I have ever used. If you can overlook the horrible system performance from boot up, to logging in and even launching applications then you might enjoy this laptop. The system is extremely quiet and light enough to carry comfortably in a bag or backpack . The screen is adequate for video or internet browsing. The HDMI port is a nice feature, but that is about it. There is truly nothing â€œHigh Performanceâ€ about this so-called High Performance Laptop. Buyer beware of false sales and marketing tactics.

ReviewText: The size is great. I bought it for my daughter in college. I am going to have the memory upgraded but other than that it fine.

Title: Slow

Title: Possibly Worst Laptop You Could Buy
ReviewText: I have to warn others not to buy this product. It is very slow. You cannot do the simple things that you have become accustomed to on the web. Cannot watch videos, cannot surf with any type of speed. My first smart phone from 2013 is about 10X faster than this laptop. Seriously there probably isn't a worse model on the market and there hasn't been in a very long time.

Title: Horrible laptop
ReviewText: This laptop should have never been sold by HP. They should be ashamed for making such a bad product and hyping it up with marketing buzz. My elderly father purchased this laptop (without my knowledge) thinking he was getting a good deal. After I looked at the specs, I wanted to puke. I took it for a spin and it is just painfully slow.

Title: Maybe Design Flaw.... Updated 1/23/19
ReviewText: Update.... used backpack for first time, traveling to Florida. Very disappointing that the metal reinforcement strap in carrying handle broke away from bag, and dangles loosely. Had to continue to use this way until I returned home. Returning defective item. May be design flaw.

Title: Good purchase for sure
ReviewText: Great bag for sure. Only thing that sucks is the Smaller pockets on the sides are very hard to get your hand into and I have decently small hands for a man. Other that i really like it, holds alot.

Title: Your movement companion
ReviewText: An incredible backpack, computer and security prrof bag for traveling, camping, school boarding. You name it, it's your bag..

Title: SOLID PERFORMER
ReviewText: This little PC is over $100 less than the comparable unit from Dell and is a solid performer. I've purchased over 50 of these in the past year and have not had one failure. They are not super fast but they are priced right and include all the essentials. Recommended.

Title: Issues with Igel OS
ReviewText: I am deploying Igel OS Thin Client solution. Have been buying the Intel Pentium Gold units directly from Lenovo with really good results.

Title: A good buy
ReviewText: Nice system for the price. Could be better with SSD drive.

Title: Don't waste good money
ReviewText: I don't know why I could only see the good reviews before purchasing, but after purchasing the bad reviews are first! As others have stated, this computer sucks!!! It is extremely slow. Even out the box I get a blue screen before it eventually gets to the set up stage!! A random black box will show up and disappear. The battery life says 2.5 hrs but goes into batter saving mode in 1 HR! I chose this laptop over others because it has a built-in DVD player. I should went with the other one and just bought an external player. So disappointed!!!!

Title: Terrible Decision on my part!
ReviewText: I"m very disappointed in Amazon over this laptop. While I know you 'get what you pay for' it seems like there should have been a heads up regarding how slowly this computer operates. It is so slow to perform that I had to make the hard decision to purchase ANOTHER laptop.

Title: Absolute Trash
ReviewText: Takes up to 4:37 (yes I've timed it) to pull up the text box for me to type in my password just to log in, then continues to be just as slow pulling up any apps I need to use. This pattern of extremely slow speeds also happens when opening a new tab in Chrome, or when going to basic websites like Facebook or Drive.

Title: Nice laptop for the price.
ReviewText: Good buy, replace the RAM and Drive. Easy case to open. Enjoy the dedicated video card, when I upgraded the ram to 8GB the bios updated the dedicated video ram to 512. Good enough for lite gaming.

Title: A Gift
ReviewText: I bought this as a gift for my brother, and he loves it. I don't know about the features because I didn't use them, but he did mention the items the computer comes with are performing outstandingly great.

Title: Extremely unsatisfied.
ReviewText: This computer is horrible. The speaker on the computer sound like it was blown. It sounded extremely low and extremely muffled. I couldnâ€™t hear any videos that I was watching. It sounded like static. I was suppose to use this for work I am disappointed.

Title: DO NOT PURCHASE
ReviewText: I bought this laptop for my mother because she was ordered to work from home throughout the pandemic. Not even three month into using the laptop the screen goes black/green at the most random times, the laptop dies on half a battery, AND it glitches most of the time. Now the laptop barely turns on! I do not recommend this laptop AT ALL!!! Waste of my money!

ReviewText: Laptop is great pay attention to the 11.6' its a miniature laptop would not have paid that much if i knew it was that small...never purchased one online before so didnt even realize what that number represented...

The computer wants me to enter a password but I have never set one up. I sent a message to the retailer but have not gotten any response.

Title: Utter waste of money
ReviewText: Who ships a PC with an entirely full hard drive? Performance is extremely shoddy as a result. We'll see what happens when I find out what is taking up the entire hard drive and get rid of it all.

Title: Extremely Disappointed
ReviewText: We made this purchase based on mostly positive reviews and product name brand. Unfortunately, this turned out to be one of the worst purchases we have ever made. We are very, very, very unhappy and disappointed with Lenovo and Microsoft. After using the laptop 5 times, on the sixth startup, we received the Win 10 "Auto Recovery" screen. Now the computer no longer boots up and works. It is useless.

Title: Very good business laptop for the price
ReviewText: I am very happy with the purchase of this HP Pavilion laptop with 8th generation Intel Core i5 processor.

Title: Generally Great
ReviewText: I use it basically to do school stuff, writing, run Netflix, Facebook, Skype or other random apps, it works great and fast so far. I love it specially for Skype conversations, itâ€™s a great computer. Iâ€™ve had it just for 2 days lol but love it so far.

Title: Not newest i5 Coffee Lake - But is upgraded Kaby Lake -U/Y
ReviewText: So far so good, faster than my 2nd Gen i7 laptop, and with a touchscreen to boot... I added a Samsung 860 EVO 500GB M.2 SATA SSD, it is recognized but I need to finish removing the old HDD so the SSD comes online as the boot drive (it won't allow the cloned drives to be online at the same time). Also, I am about to install a 2nd 8gb memory SODIMM because only one is in use. Once all is said and done I'll update my review, but it is definitely worth the money so far. (under $500) Plus $48 for memory, and $97 for the SSD.

Title: Horrible webcam.
ReviewText: I teach online and while I have an extremely webcam, I still need a laptop with a decent webcam for when I travel and donâ€™t want too many accessories to take along. I currently use an Acer and it has an excellent HD webcam. I expected the HP laptop to have one equally good or better. I was shocked to see the poor quality videos and pictures it was producing. Not sure if this was just defective or this is how itâ€™s supposed to be. Too bad because I liked the look at feel of the laptop. The keyboard was perfect and so was the touch screen. Rest of the specs and price suited me fine.

Title: Was a Christmas Gift
ReviewText: The receiver of this laptop said it was amazing and he loved it. He has now in Afghanistan and has it with him. Hoping he stays safe.

Title: GREAT CHEAP COMPUTER
ReviewText: This is a very good computer for what I need, which is mostly business purposes and document storage. It is fast and easy.

Title: Packed with features and lightweight.
ReviewText: Awesome laptop. Nice footprint, full of features and light weight. Love it love it love it!

Title: Don't even think about it - BUY IT!!!
ReviewText: The PC is even better than I expected. It was shipped fast and was ready to go out of the box. The upgrades that were done by the seller (SSD and memory) are what I had been looking for, for more than 6 months. I was a computer consultant in the manufacturing industry for over 40 years, so I knew what I wanted - it was just hard to find. I could not be happier with this purchase and I highly recommend both this PC and the seller.

Title: This HP rocks
ReviewText: I wanted a new AIO desktop with added bells and whistles than I could find at manufacturer sites or in stores. I ran across this HP Pavilion with beefed-up SSD and memory. It started up without issue and I'm quite pleased with it. I must say it runs fast.

Title: Powerful and boots fast.
ReviewText: Powerful, boots fast. I wasn't a big fan of the keyboard or mouse, but that wasn't a deal breaker. I also foolishly thought that SSHD equaled "solid state hard drive" when it really means "solid state hybrid drive." But for a desk top, that was okay. It boots nearly as fast as my other laptop with a SSD. Packaging was awesome. Delivery was rapid. You should note that there are two power switches. One on the left boots the computer, and the one on the right boots the monitor for other uses (TV etc.?). I like this computer and would buy it again.

Title: Super fast processing and a great picture.
ReviewText: I wanted a larger, faster computer without the separate hard drive tower, as my space is somewhat limited. This call-in-one computer has turned out to be the perfect match for what I need. I can now work on my cabinetry designs without long waiting periods for the computer to periodically save my work. This computer is so much faster I don't even notice when it's saving or doing other actions. And I can go from my design program to email to anything else without waiting long periods for the computer to load the programs and start executing. A friend had told me about the superior speed of a solid state hard drive and I am now a firm believer, so much so that I purchased new solid state hard drives for our 2 laptops and installed these and it totally rejuvenated them so they are working fast. What a great upgrade this has been.

Title: Works like expected
ReviewText: This is good for what I need for the office.

Title: Easy setup
ReviewText: Couldnâ€™t ask for an easier set up and I love how fast it is.

Title: This HP rocks
ReviewText: I wanted a new AIO desktop with added bells and whistles than I could find at manufacturer sites or in stores. I ran across this HP Pavilion with beefed-up SSD and memory. It started up without issue and I'm quite pleased with it. I must say it runs fast.

Title: Came with unlicensed OS
ReviewText: Unlike what the product description suggests, the unit I received came with an unlicensed version of Windows, which becomes very annoying. Considering also that it was lost in transit on my first attempt to order it, discovering upon its quite delayed arrival that it was using an unlicensed version of Windows was frustrating to say the least. Look elsewhere for similarly priced products that come with licensed versions of Windows, as is standard when purchasing a computer. Disappointing.

Title: Very nice laptop I got impressed.
ReviewText: I being use another brand name before, but this one is awesome. Very easy to manage really fast and secure.

Title: Touchpad navigation is TERRIBLE, and you can't disable "gestures" or tap to click. Returning.
ReviewText: Got a new laptop because my old Lenovo's touchpad was screwing up constantly. Problems: It was triple clicking when I clicked once; sending me to random place on the page when I tried to scroll using the touchpad; clicking on a random link if I hovered for the briefest second; speed scrolling me to the bottom of a page when I wasn't even touching the touchpad at all. Just a nightmare. But I've had this old Lenovo for years so I figure it's just time to replace. Imagine my surprise today when I turned on my new Lenovo AND IT HAS THE EXACT SAME TOUCHPAD PROBLEMS RIGHT OUT OF THE GATDAMB BOX! So it's not a hardware problem, it's a settings problem. But get this! The only touchpad setting you can change is "sensitivity" which does not fix the problem. I need the "tap to click" and "gestures" BS OFF. DISABLED. GONE. Not "less sensitive." I've searched Google and tried numerous help forums including Lenovo's. No device drivers are available to turn off "gestures." WHAT THE...? Hey Lenovo! I know you love your two-finger, three-finger, and four-finger gestures, but you know what? All I got for you is a ONE-finger gesture. You can have this poor excuse for a laptop back.

Title: Feels cheap, slower than expected despite the SSD drive
ReviewText: I understood that I was getting a entry-level laptop so my expectations were modest as this was intended to be a backup laptop for web browsing and little else. However, the build quality felt cheap, the touchpad required some tweaking to get passable performance, and the SSD hard drive (what sold me on it), didn't really seem to help with performance.

Title: Broken from the beginning!
ReviewText: This computer came formatted incorrectly. It was formatted so bad that just turning on the computer caused my C drive to be completely full. Therefore, I was unable to download anything to the computer, rendering it useless. It could not be fixed between Amazon tech support and the seller tech support. I would not recommend buying this computer from this seller. Very frustrating. For this amount of money, there are way better computers to buy.

Title: Great computer - especially for the price
ReviewText: This computer is perfect for that person that only uses their computer to search/buy things online, play games (especially old school, as it does have a CD drive), and other small tasks. I'm sure it is capable of doing other things, but we just use it at the house for personal matters.

Title: Battery wouldn't charge
ReviewText: This computer had all the features I was looking for but battery wouldn't charge when I received it. Note: I had also purchased the optional protection plan. I contacted the protection plan and was told that they wouldn't fix it because the problem wasn't covered. I could send it back to amazon or Lenovo. as everything else seemed to work I opted to send it back to Lenovo, bad choice. I had to pay to ship it back Fedex (I even insured it). Lenovo received it and signed for it but then lost it. Lenovo Tech support doesn't have an exact replacement. They don't respond in a timely maner and long story short it looks like I am being forced to accept a computer with fewer features and a flimser build as a substitute.

Title: fast downloads
ReviewText: love my new laptop, so fast when i'm documenting on my patients

Title: Everything in order as described in AMZN
ReviewText: I just began to use the computer. I hope this will be a great machine.

Title: lenovo 920
ReviewText: Before I purchased this laptop I was either going with the yoga 920 or a macbook pro but the slick design and the specs got me. The quality of the laptop is not what you pay for unfortunately. This laptop gave me so many issues from hardware to performance related. Lenovo tech service has no knowledge with all the issues I was having but the lenovo has a great community online and I was helped multiple times by awesome lenovo owners. Really liked this laptop and was looking forward experiencing this but I will be sticking with Apple next time for sure.

Title: So many configurations - there's one for you!
ReviewText: I bought this laptop to replace a nine-year-old desktop computer. I am thrilled that I was able to find a computer in the configuration that I wanted for a very reasonable price as my needs for the new computer or very specific in order to make it somewhat future-proof (at least for a few years). I shopped around all over the web to try to find a computer that would suit these very specific needs and was very pleased to find it on Amazon without having to sacrifice any of my particular specifications. The company that sells their computers through Amazon had many different configurations with regard to RAM, hard disk size, Windows version and more and I actually bought a machine that was better than I intended because of the price.

Title: Very good

Title: bad purchase, bad seller
ReviewText: The computers speakers sound as if they have grains inside and the sound is broken, the volume gradually decreases when a song is heard and the USB ports do not turn off the power when the computer is turned off.

Title: This item is very good. Make this choice
ReviewText: This computer is amazingly good. It's works perfectly with absolutely no fault. It's more than my expectations. I've been using this computer for about two months and I have never faced any problems. The components works well, the quality of the screen is very nice while working on it. The battery last longer than expected. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this computer. It's a very powerful machine. The customization is great. The design of this computer is very nice too

Title: Good home computer.
ReviewText: Great computer so far! Only problem is that it closes programs when it is closed and goes to sleep. Probably a setting that I need to change but havenâ€™t found it yet.

Title: Great customizable mini-PC
ReviewText: This thing packs a huge punch in a tiny package. I opted for the 1 TB SSD and 16 GB RAM model. I use a personal computer mostly for file management (music, photos, etc.) and this does that very well. Intelâ€™s driver update tool works a little wonky - there are 2 updates it consistently wants to make but cannot. Love that this thing can be easily tucked away out of sight and that itâ€™s got Wi-Fi and Bluetooth built in. Iâ€™ve got it setup with two monitors (one HDMI to HDMI and another HDMI to USB-C) and that works great. I have a Bluetooth speaker that is connected to it for audio out. Make sure youâ€™ve got some sort of audio system in mind and donâ€™t rely on the built-in mic for anything if you need a microphone for any reason. I wish the options were a little more open for better processing power and graphics, but thatâ€™s the trade-off in scaling down the size of the PC. I downloaded Microsoft Flight Simulator FSX to see how it would perform and it will hit 60 FPS on low scenery/realism settings. Overall a great little machine for what Iâ€™ll use it for.

Title: Smaller than expected
ReviewText: This is a very small computer. The power block for the plug weighs more than the unit itself.

Title: Saves a lot of room
ReviewText: Swapped out a bunch of business desktop with these mini computers. They work great. Very fast. We added USB-C adapters for a second monitor and it works perfectly, no lag. I can see a lot of uses for these little computers.

Title: Bug in SSD rules out use as an always-on server.
ReviewText: It's spunky, quiet, compact, and useful. It might make a great media server and HTPC except...

Title: Defective ready to use units.

Windows kept crashing (BSOD) and showing pretty much all errors listed on the windows.com/stopcode website. Try reinstalling Windows but it didnâ€™t fix the problem.

Title: Best computer for an office
ReviewText: These computers are very quiet, small, and powerful. I have multiple people who are suing these machines. They love that they can be placed pretty much anywhere, don't make much noise, and are just as fast, or in some cases faster then the big desktop towers they had before hand. I always recommend these for workstations as they are perfect for the office.

Title: Its Not That size!
ReviewText: Fast delivery, easy to set up, but is smaller than the 23.8 inches it said it was. It measured out to be about 21 inches and I wanted bigger. :-(

Title: Great Computer!

I will sometimes do design work and I have no issue doing so on this laptop. Worth the money!

Title: Best dollar to feature ratio of any Chromebook
ReviewText: I only had a few days to use this before I discovered a flaw I thought was just a feature of the device, was actually a hardware defect. When you close the lid, it is supposed to sleep. Suspend. Instead, mine would shut down completely, logging me out and erasing any of my unsaved work in my apps. I use this for work, I can have that.

Title: Very pleased so far
ReviewText: We just opened this today and so far I am very pleased. It was purchased for a student who has a chromebook at school so she was using it immediately and very thrilled to have it. The Amazon description doesn't have a model number but the paperwork says it is a C330. I'm thinking it's a newer version of the model since the description says it came out in November 2018 and there aren't any reviews yet. The C330 model 81HY0000US is listed as being released on Aug 2018 and I read those reviews before purchasing. I took a chance getting something without a review because it had a similar description to the C330 and it was able to arrive within 2 days. The white color is very nice, the weight is nice and it seems sturdy. There were remarks on the C330 reviews about settling for a resolution that wasn't as good as others, but I think the graphics are just fine. The keyboard has a nice touch and it has many features I was looking for - a touch screen; blue tooth; and being able to fold it to use as a tablet. Bonus: it sits in other positions for easy movie viewing; HDMI; USB slots, SD slot; camera, etc... I know you can get a more basic Chromebook for $150 - $200 but it was work paying $250 to get all of these extra features. I just can't see getting one without a touch screen. I don't know if the 32 GB instead of 64 GB is going to be an issue. We haven't tried to load any apps yet.

Title: Great...well mostly
ReviewText: I bought this for my wife as her old Chromebook had seen better days, Performance wise its great. It is a Chromebook so its all relative but for what she uses it for it performs flawlessly. The touch screen is responsive and easy to use. Screen is bright and google play apps (which is a big plus as Chromebook specific apps are limited and frankly poorly ported) appear to perform just as well as on her Pixel 2. The only complaint really is compared to her old Chromebook this thing feels like its made of lead. Not a huge deal if on a desk or on your lap, does however give your arms a work out if you are holding it in a tablet configuration. All in all though it is a great buy at $249 and more than any thing she is happy with it, which hell lets be honest is more important than anything.

Title: Empty box!
ReviewText: There was newspaper in the box a charger and q book nothing else !!!! They are not responding to me! I am so upset. This is so much money to me. I was really looking forward to this.

Title: Great Laptop!! :)
ReviewText: This is a great laptop for its price to be this low, what an out standing chromebook i like it so much its going great so far feels good, the keyboard dosent light up in the background so you can see it during the dark but its an okay good looking keyboard youll just need the light on or the screen very bright to shine the keyboard so you can see it but yea great laptop does what it needs to do and its great handy. Now for the folks that want to download itunes on these laptops...... thats gonna be the disapointment part ... chromebooks dont suppose it and i know google play music is great you can use that but for the users out there for itunes yea it sucks because im one of them i mean i like both itunes and google play music but i perfer itunes better but sadly... :( now hopefully in the future they fix that problem but yea other than that the laptop itself is great get urself one if ya think ya wanna buy this laptop is cheap and is good, best part is when opening the laptop it turns on already for you without you even turning it on isnt that great!!?! haha but yea gread laptop. XDD

Title: Something's not right.... & it's getting returned.

The other things: inability to scroll. Can't do it. You have to scroll with the arrow keys. No CAPS lock. You have to hit alt and some other key to enable caps lock. Also makes you log in every time. Using your Google account password every time. I created a PIN# in the settings (a 6 digit number code) but it won't accept it... still have to use Google password. Just needed this to stream video to a tv... can't do it.

Title: Very impressive device
ReviewText: Can absolute recommend.

Title: 2 out of 2 laptops defective on arrival
ReviewText: We purchased 2 of these laptops to use for photo editing. They are really nice laptops except that they have issues. When we first received them, one was not working at all due to it stating it needed to have an operating system installed. After clicking through some tests, it did indeed have Windows 10 installed but apparently a corrupt install. Once we got in and saw it had Windows 10, we attempted to use it but it kept restarting every 3 to 4 minutes. The 2nd laptop started up just fine. However in the past 3 weeks of having it, it too has reatarted randomly about 1 to 2 times a week which makes it extremely difficult if in the middle of a complex photo edit. Also, that one does not have the Microsoft store that should be a part of Windows or the photo app. We contacted the seller about the first laptop which was basically DOA and they sent us a Windows recovery thumb drive which did not correct the problems. They then sent us a UPS label to return the laptop for an exchange. We received another laptop but have no way of knowing if it is a replacement or the same one with Windows reinstalled. In any case, it too now randomly restarts 1 to 2 a week. We will go to a local computer store to have Windows 10 reinstalled on both laptops as we do not trust the seller. These are very expensive laptops and we should be able to expect and receive a laptop in exceptional working order which did not happen. Perhaps a run of bad luck if it was one laptop but two laptops....that is a problem as we see it. We will not recommend this seller to anyone we know. Lesson learned...we will buy local from now on regarding computer equipment.

Title: Fast laptop with touch screen, terrific price!
ReviewText: This laptop is aesthetically pleasing, fast processing (not for gaming, but for work and online), and decidedly touch screen! The internal components that would make for a fast computer combined with a touch screen interface at such a low price was exactly what I was looking for. I was a bit suspicious that perhaps some of the features weren't described correctly, but everything checks out. I am loving my new laptop!

Title: Worth the money for sure
ReviewText: I have been using this laptop for Awhile now! Itâ€™s very thin and portable! It turns on almost instantly, it is a very fast laptop and opens apps almost as soon as you click them. The touchscreen is precise. Great screen resolution and color. The sound is good for a laptop. The keys are pleasant as well. Only downside is that the keys do not light up, so they are hard to see in the dark if you have to look at the screen and back down to the keyboard. Definitely a great buy!!! Thank you!

Title: Excellent laptop
ReviewText: I only needed a new laptop because I work from home. And the last 2 laptops I bought in the 12 months have given me nothing but trouble. Know I'm constantly on this laptop. Because it does everything it is supposed to. It's really quick. I really like the touch screen! Great audio sound! The next time I need a laptop I will be getting a HP no question!

Title: had since APRIL NOTHING BUT TROUBLE
ReviewText: my settings change almost every week , no sound, can't type , printer , won't print. After many call to Amazon for tech service I'm ready to throw it out. Last they told me was to go to BEST BUY maybe they can help me. I will never buy this kind of item from Amazon again. they were no help. Every time I called it was for a different problem.

Title: Great laptop at amazing price
ReviewText: I love this new lap top. Initially had a hard time adjusting to the key pad. This is so light weight, easy to use, fast loading and beautiful graphics. I have had many types and sizes of laptops over the years, I bought a second one so that my husband would have his own (because I didn't want to share) and he absolutely deserves this wonderful machine.

Title: Good price
ReviewText: Seems fast enough â€¦Has enough ports for things . Still learning its quirks and limits .. Only had it a few days still ,transferring stuff and remembering how I set up my last one. So far really like it.

Title: Great computer!
ReviewText: This computer is awesome! I absolutely love it. It's fast, was in perfect condition, and works well for my needs. I can Bluetooth connect to our speakers at work. Great computer for a great price!

Title: Bad customer service
ReviewText: I cannot use this product without having it plugged in at all times. If you just barely bump it the battery will disconnect as if there is a short. I have attempted to contact the seller several times to no avail and now I can't even get a refund. All I wanted to do was exchange it for one that works, but their customer service is poor. There is no battery life at all due to what believe is a defect in the manufacturing.

Title: Work Horse
ReviewText: Work horse computer that I absolutely rely on every day. Six months out and no regrets. I have PC Matic to protect investment.

Title: Real power!
ReviewText: This is a real powerful laptop. running multiple processes on this machine is a breeeezz! I am so impressed. Was delivered 3 days ahead of time and that a thumbs up.

Title: Excellent service!
ReviewText: Great product and reseller has excellent service.

Title: DVD writer not visble to PC
ReviewText: I bought two PC units and the DVD writer was not hooked up in one of the PCs. Plugging the SATA and power cable did not result in the drive being recognized. Appears the DVD drive is defective. Somewhat disappointed as this should not have gotten past quality control. Since DVD drives are not used as much as they used to be, it isn't a deal killer.

Title: Good basic business machine with hi-po CPU, 3 Year warranty
ReviewText: HP still supports their products well, which is why I continue to purchase and pay a few more bucks. Would be nice of cases and power supplies were a little more standard. Good machine.

Title: Good Compact Gaming Computer
ReviewText: i use this unit for video editing, gaming with Far Cry, GTAV and World War Z. I added an 970 EVO 1tb and no problem at all with any games. a little pricey but what you get, the power and portability is worth it in my opinion.

Title: A good dock at ~half the cost of new
ReviewText: TL;DR: A decent utilitarian dock to allow for the kind of I/O that makes a laptop work like a desktop. It's clearly an RMA so don't buy this refurbished unit if you need it to be presentation-perfect or demand an OEM power supply.

Title: Absolutely no issues and works great for refurbished!
ReviewText: This product works exactly as described. Both my wife and I are issued HP laptops from our employers. The business she works for uses a different model HP laptop (Donâ€™t know the model) then what I use (I use HP EliteBook 840 G3), but they both fit perfectly and functional great! This was purchased as a refurbished products and had some minor scratches but I was a concern with that because they were covered. It works and thatâ€™s all I care about.

Title: Looks/works good, power adapter failed
ReviewText: I got this out and I was very happy. It didn't look too worn and my computer fit in it just like at work. However, I got all set up and then noticed the battery wasn't charging. I unplugged it and plugged it back in, and there was a little message in the bottom right corner of the screen that read, "The Smart AC Adapter is not functioning correctly"

Title: Doesnâ€™t display properly
ReviewText: It is so simple to connect. Unfortunately it wouldnâ€™t properly display on my DELL 24 inch monitor on DisplayPort cable. See picture. Docking my HP EliteBook 840 G2 was easily done. Update! I called tech support, the nice lady looked at the picture on this review. I turned on the patio and like magic, it worked properly today for the first time. Hopefully, it will not give me any problems from here on out.

Title: Works, great addition to my home office
ReviewText: I am using this for my work laptop, an HP Elitebook 820 G4, to help keep my desk in my home office organized during this extended Work-From-Home period. It makes it easy to use my external keyboard, mouse, and monitor with my laptop, but also pick up my laptop and work from the couch or patio without fiddling with a bunch of cords.

Title: They should clean these and update the firmware.
ReviewText: It works fine, and I knew it was a refurbished unit, but this was filthy. Dust and crud all up in the docking lever.

Title: Just as good as brand new
ReviewText: Needed a docking station the same as I use at the main office for my home office. Allows me to quickly undock my work computer and continue on at home without having to mess with external connections. Bought refurbished but was packaged like and has the appearance of a brand new device. More importantly, it works great and is making my job easier. It was packaged well, delivered quickly, and a very reasonable price. All-in-all, very satisfied with my purchase.

Title: Refurbished vs Brand New
ReviewText: After getting last one fried in an office flood, I tried this refurbished. No difference at all except nicer price.

Title: Great computer.  Blazing speed, quiet, Nice screen and keyboard
ReviewText: This is truly a great laptop. I love it and would buy it again in a second.

Title: Solid Lenovo workstation
ReviewText: I've never been disappointed with the build quality of the the business level thinkpads. Solid, quick, built to last. Coming from a w520 thinkpads that's still working great this is very much the same.n gone is the removable battery but everything is now accessible from the bottom metal panel which honestly adds more stability vs the removable battery design. I had missed the lenovos when I had gotten a surface pro 3 as the thinkpads were made for work and to work not to be cute. I've had no issues with this laptop in the last 2 months nor do I expect to (Lenovo warranty is there if it did).

Title: Mobile Workstation
ReviewText: Big heavy solidly built workstation. Used a splitter to make the home office a dual 27 inch monitor affair. Everything was plug and play. Keyboard is solid and feels nice. Lots of USB for legacy dvd drive and other accessories along with wireless mouse keyboard. I did buy a rolling cart and was glad to have it on a trip. Mobile warrior: very fast, plenty of disk space.

Title: FAST LAPTOP
ReviewText: This laptop is very fast! It is a good sturdy laptop with great display. With the SSD it is blazing fast. Quite the workhorse!

Title: Excellent upgrade
ReviewText: Nice upgrade from p72. Also has enough ports to eliminate extra expense of docking stations.

Title: Great laptop
ReviewText: Pricey but worth it. Nice big screen, very speedy, love it.

Title: Great laptop
ReviewText: Runs all the sofware that I need it to without any problem. Battery lasts for hours. Very fast.

Title: Fast boot, sharp monitor, huge storage.
ReviewText: 15 seconds to come out of hibernation. Reboot nearly as fast. Good sound. Love the touch screen and fingerprint entry. 4TB storage, half of it SSD! Love it all.

Title: Exactly what was described. All upgrades are there.
ReviewText: I am very pleased with this purchase. This computer is exactly what it was supposed to be. I was a little worried about making such an expensive purchase online but it arrived before the delivery date and was perfect. It booted right up out of the box. The first thing I did was check the specs and everything is just as it should be. My upgrades are all there and the laptop is beautiful without a blemish.

Title: these things happen.
ReviewText: sadly it didn't work. i opened the box with my daughter and there isn't much to do with a laptop, plug it in and turn it on. but all we got was a click click click, and nothing else, for several minutes. it never came on. we tried it a couple of times but frankly, for 1200 bucks, i wanted it to work right away, first time. so i returned it.

Title: Pricey but good
ReviewText: My ZBook works great, its fast and the screen is awesome. I have touch typed for 50 years and my fingers just don't land in the right place on the HP Keyboard, there is a tiny ridge on the "F" key but it just doesn't do it for me. When are manufacturers of high end laptops going to put two video output ports so I can drive both of my "seeing eye" monitors? This computer is pricey but really is worth the money.

Title: great value
ReviewText: very nice machine - only had it a few months but works great. i use it for pretty much everything as well as programming - w/ sql server and visual studio - doing programs for myself for bills and reminders etc. just simple desktop stuff. but - this is very fast - excellent graphics - even though i use a huge separate monitor.

ReviewText: Sturdy Laptop, hope it last as long as my Dell did. Plenty of storage and fast booting up.

Title: Overall good solid PC.

It is a bit heavy, but has a very solid feel! The only con to the functionality is the ethernet port. It is unreasonably difficult to remove the ethernet cord.

Title: Chromebook (Pixelbook) dual monitor with charging.
ReviewText: I was having an issue finding a dock that would display dual external monitors for a Chromebook-Pixelbook (correctly). Purchased a few different options that all had their drawbacks or issues. First, I'll cover the good items for the Wavlink dock and how it was different than other options I tried. First, I'm able to display two external monitors at 2560x1440. This includes the option of having the Pixelbook open for a third screen or closed and working only from the dual monitors. Most other docks I tried would either not display both external monitors at all times or have issues with the resolution/scaling. Second, is that it charges the Pixelbook through the same USB-C connection. This was not guaranteed due to the hardware of the Pixelbook. This is huge for me as I don't have to have a connection for power and then the connection for the dock separate. I've also used this same dock with a Dell Precision laptop and it works just as well (you'll see it under the Pixelbook in the picture). Also, I really like that it is horizontal or "flat" on my desk. Some of the other options are vertical, which doesn't really fit well with my movable dual monitors.

Title: Works with MacBook Pro
ReviewText: The instructions in the box were clear. Works well with the new MacBook Pro and OS X Mojave. The only thing that needed to be done was to download a driver from the manufacturer website.

Title: Finally, a solution
ReviewText: I've been trying to get a dock that works with both Mac and Windows, has power delivery over USB-C, and can output 3440 x 1440 to two monitors in extend mode, over HDMI. This sounds like simple criteria.. let me tell you, it's not.

Title: Quality Thunderbolt Dock for the Money!
ReviewText: I purchased the non-touch bar version of my MacBook Pro a couple of years back (not an overall fan of Apple's touch bar). However, this ultimately limited me to only 2 Thunderbolt ports and left me looking for some additional expansion. I'd tried a couple of different Thunderbolt "Hubs" on the market and (while effective), they were just unsightly with a lot of cables running out of them and even with one of the better ones, I eventually ran out of available ports that I was needing. So I decided to drop the money to get a true Dock. I did a lot of research for compatible docks and the biggest thing that kept turning me away was price. I don't do any real pro work on my machine, so was difficult for me to justify some of the $250-$350+ solutions. I came across this brand and after reviewing many of the specs, liked what it offered for the price. And I must say I am very satisfied with the purchase! It's provided me all of the ports I currently need with some excess remaining! I'm currently running a 34" LG Ultra-wide Monitor via DP, a 24" Dell HD Monitor in vertical set-up (*more on that later) via DVI to HDMI input, Audio out to an audio switch, Gigabit Ethernet in and several USB peripherals, all via one Thunderbolt port which also provides power to my MacBook Pro! That leaves me with an additional 2 USB 3.0 Ports and 2 USB-C Port on the front of the device and one open Thunderbolt port on my MacBook!

Title: Pricey but good
ReviewText: My ZBook works great, its fast and the screen is awesome. I have touch typed for 50 years and my fingers just don't land in the right place on the HP Keyboard, there is a tiny ridge on the "F" key but it just doesn't do it for me. When are manufacturers of high end laptops going to put two video output ports so I can drive both of my "seeing eye" monitors? This computer is pricey but really is worth the money.

Title: Dual Monitors with 2019 HP Probook 640 G5
ReviewText: I bought this dock specifically to have a dual monitor setup. The docking station comes with 2 DisplayPorts and 1 VGA port. My monitors only have HDMI and VGA, so i had to separately buy 2 DisplayPort to HDMI adapters, 1 for each monitor. After plugging in the adapters, the 2 monitors worked perfectly together. I can drag and drop things from 1 screen to the other screen. Very happy with purchase.

Title: Just what I needed and shipped faster than expected!

Title: Be sure to check your product these are used not "renewed".
ReviewText: Be sure to check your product immediately apon arrival. Mine came with an obviously broken left bracket that did not move when you push the lock in. they obviously dont test or check these so factor that in when your buying. I requested a return but the seller has to "approve" the return so be careful here.

Title: Does not look new as description says.
ReviewText: Not in new condition. Round lock hole cover has light grey generic cover. Cord is very used and power supply is older version. It works so far, but far from looking like new. Not sure if I'd buy a referbished again or not.

Title: After Windows update, freezing solved (updated)
ReviewText: When I update windows, the touchpad stopped working.

Title: It works beautifully, even with Linux!
ReviewText: When I first got the laptop, it was defective, so I sent it back. Got a new one and it's been working for me since. I immediately put Linux on it and it was working so well. Sadly, however, I had to move back to Windows 10 because I needed to use my game capture device on it and it won't under Linux. Either way, it's fast, beautiful, keyboard is nice and feels good under my fingers. Mouse trackpad is a bit...wonky, but get yourself a cheap Logitech wireless mouse and all that goes away. The HDMI output port is perfect when I need to hook it up to a monitor or my TV. Wifi works well and the Ethernet port is good in case I don't have access to wifi, but do have access to a physical connection. I have not been able to test out the USB-C connector, but I'm sure it's fine. USB 3 and 2 ports work as intended with no issue. SD Card slot also works beautifully. It's pretty lightweight compared to my last laptop, a nearly 10 year old Dell Inspirion. Battery life could be better, but I usually have it plugged in, so it's not too big an issue. One thing to look out for, though. No removeable battery, so if it fails up, be prepared.

Title: Good value, warhorse laptop
ReviewText: Easy setup out of the box (~15 min), decent sound for the money, bright HD display, fast smooth rendering of 3D structures (see the screen shot of YASARA Dynamics with semi-transparent surface). Not tested on games, and not going to. This unit is intended to provide relief from a smallish screen on a very slick cardboard-thin fancy laptop, and it performs well with several Word and PowerPoint windows open, + PyMol or YASARA Dynamics. Actually runs some molecular dynamics simulations (in YASARA), and other scientific soft. No touchscreen (good), no backlight on keys (OK). Not a bad-looking unit, considering the price.

Title: Great deal for students!
ReviewText: The graphics card seems to have some issues and sound gets scrambled occaisonally, but overall great purchase so far. I am very happy as a student using this for college. I do half of my classes online so I use this a lot! Itâ€™s been so reliable and easy to use. The battery life is even pretty accurate. At full charge it usually says it has about 6-7 hours of use left on balance mode. Sometimes full volume isnâ€™t loud enough for me to hear some things but most of the time itâ€™s fine.

Title: Good general-use machine, but not as powerful as hoped
ReviewText: Got this in a panic to replace my old laptop when the screen broke. This laptop is OK if you only need something for browsing but I wouldnâ€™t recommend it for games, even fairly lightweight ones. Lack of a keypad was surprising but Iâ€™ve adapted and I like that the screen resolution is higher than my old laptopâ€”though you will need to change this in settings as by default it seems like the resolution is set to a lower setting and it makes text and interface elements really blurry. Overall a good purchase and a good machine I will be using in the foreseeable future, but I will probably replace with something that has slightly more power for when I am not traveling.

Title: Excellent Laptop, it's amazing.  I receive on time.
ReviewText: Excellent seller. Highly recommended. A beautiful laptop. AAA+++

Title: Fast and lots of memory!!!
ReviewText: The laptop is bigger than I would like, but I insisted on a number pad build in. Love it though!

Title: Exactly as expected
ReviewText: Well-packaged. Arrived on time. Just what I needed.

Title: Amazing and Powerful Laptop but has quality issues.
If you are looking for speed without all of the bloat, this is your laptop
ReviewText: I needed a laptop that is blazingly fast, but not for gaming. It seemed all of the laptops that came with the good speed stuff also were bundled with expensive displays, graphics cards and other bloat that I didn't need.

Title: Really disappointing for a $1,200 ultra
ReviewText: Nano-Edge is great

Title: Great laptop! However, there is one MAJOR flaw. (Trackpad)
ReviewText: I love this laptop. It's the perfect student laptop for those in engineering or demanding fields. I run virtual machines daily, play light games, and mess around on Reddit and YouTube with this laptop. It's great.

Title: Installed Asus Firmware Fix For Jumpy Trackpad, and Now It's PERFECT
ReviewText: I took a big risk buying this machine, based on the critical Amazon reviews regarding the trackpad, but I had a feeling there would be a fix from the manufacturer. My bet paid off! Went to Asus.com to seek solutions, and with a simple firmware update, the jumpiness of the trackpad was gone, and I was left with an otherwise excellent laptop.

Title: Faulty - having a nightmare getting customer service to fix this
ReviewText: After not even 1 day of usage, the laptop crashed and did not reboot.

Title: Good specifications and overall performance but needs build improvements
ReviewText: Pros:

Title: Fast impressive sleek little laptop
ReviewText: We really like this laptop. It boots extremely quickly with the SSD. I did however have to get a 256gb slim USB since the included SSD was only 256gb which is pretty small. The aluminum design is rugged and comparable to our old MacBook Pro. The screen is really impressive with its HDR capabilities. Overall great laptop so far. Loving it!

Title: Everything you need in a computer
ReviewText: Perfect for our small business needs

Title: It's easier to use than a Apple
ReviewText: Great product - fast - easy to setup and use

Title: Great price point for small business
ReviewText: Combination of RAM, PCIe SSD and processor make this laptop fairly fast for a mid-range laptop. At $1600, it performs like a $2200 laptop.

Title: Solid platform for business
ReviewText: Solid laptop. We utilize for business. Glad HP keeps the docking platform uniform. Great performance so far.

Title: Motherboard does not support smart card reader
ReviewText: I wanted a laptop with a smart card reader. This has the slot but the motherboard does not support it. Cant return it. Very Disappointed.

Title: Easy set up and fast
ReviewText: So far I have 0 issues and it works great. I like the keyboard and speed of the computer.

Title: My view on this laptop
ReviewText: I needed a laptop capable of having multiple editing softwares open simultaneously without crashing. This laptop is a beefy Desktop in disguise. Not only does it keep all my editing programs open at the same time, but also has crazy speed to top it off. Itâ€™s so snappy and smooth, Iâ€™ve only had it for a week and a half, but I can safely say itâ€™s worth it. I love it and will take great care of it for years to come.

Title: Fast and Handles Hefty Software
ReviewText: We purchased this computer to use in our Land Surveying Firm. It handles AutoCAD and other weighty applications that we need to run simultaneously and still runs smoothly. We have had this for 8 months now and we have been quite pleased with it.

Title: Great laptop
ReviewText: The laptop was shipped on time, came as described, and worked great out of the box.

Title: Very fast and sleek
ReviewText: Bought this computer for business. I usually have a ton of tabs open on my browser along with big excel files and itâ€™s still very fast.

Title: Very powerful laptop for school
ReviewText: Very powerful for the price. It has retained its speed after a year of use and does not look like its slowing down. It could use more storage but with an external hard drive it works great.

Title: Really stupid ergonomics
ReviewText: My employer bought a fleet of these for my employees, and mine irritates me so much that I'm going to the trouble of writing a review on Amazon. I use an external monitor and a mouse. The attached photo shows where the designers chose to put the external monitor cable - EXACTLY where I would normally use the mouse. It's a constant hassle to move my hand up and back between the keyboard and the second-rate location where I have to place the mouse. Really stupid. I'm not happy with the palm rests, either. More like wrist rests, they're so large. I wear a watch with a metal band and it is constantly catching the front edge of the computer, or scratching the plastic of the palm rest. Who wants to remove their watch or bracelet each time they sit down at the computer. I've used several laptops in the past and this wasn't an issue with any of the previou ones. Again, stupid. The machine is a good performer, but when i makes you annoyed virtually every minute, you overlook all the good stuff. You will regret buying this thing.

Title: Lenovo IdeaPad 330 15.6" HD Anti-Glare Laptop
ReviewText: This laptop met most of my expectations. It was easy to set up and I was productive within a few minutes. Screen quality is good and it has all the ports and memory I need. I don't like to use the trackpad on laptops so I bought a wireless mouse where I can have better control. Battery life is somewhat shorter than I expected and that is probably the only negative thing I would say about this computer.

Title: Didn't last 6 months!
ReviewText: This computer wasn't top of the line and I knew that when I bought it, however, 6 months is ridiculous. This was a gift for my daughter who is in college. I was hoping that it would get her through a couple of years at least. At first the battery took forever to recharge and then it stopped charging all together. When she called Amazon, they only had a 30 day warranty so she called the manufacturer - they only had a 120 day warranty. According to the customer service rep she spoke with, if the battery cell gets below a certain level and is plugged up to charge, it will blow the "main board". All they said was "sorry". That will be the last Lenovo I purchase!

Title: Unusable
ReviewText: Bought this computer for my boyfriend as a Christmas present thinking it would be a good compromise between affordable and a good working computer. The computer is unbelievably slow, the mousepad doesn't work half the time, and there are constant antivirus pop-ups that I can't close because the mousepad isn't registering. Using this computer is beyond frustrating and a big disappointment, so much so that it is unusable. Even with perfect internet, this computer can't get through a YouTube video without buffering several times. Even with the low price point, this computer is completely not worth the hassle.

Title: It's a little less than "ok".
ReviewText: Really thought I was getting the laptop I really wanted but this isn't the case. It's fairly slow, battery life is just awful and it can't run too many things at the same time. I envision this laptop likely lasting me no more than a couple years. I'd do more homework and look in another direction if I could do it again.

Title: Easy to set up and not the sharpest cookie with technology!
ReviewText: I am recently retired and have had a department that did any computer updates and installation for me. While I was slow with installation, it was really hard. This also is my first laptop (always had desktop). I am totally happy with the purchase!

Title: Don't count on this for photo editing.
ReviewText: Knot for heavy use. After loading a couple of photo editing programs it walk down and was so slow it was barely usable.

Title: Best value for price point
ReviewText: This laptop is the bestâ€¼ï¸I like how the keys are firm. I use this for remote work at home. Works like a charm.
