Title: Wrong driver for network card.
ReviewText: Love the machine and everything was great until I tried to connect the computer using ethernet cabling. When I plugged in the cable I couldn't connect to the Internet. I tried many different settings for the adapter, tried IP4 and IP6, tried DHCP, tried setting the IP address manually. Tried different cables, reran the cable and a new punch down. On the second day, I gave up and decided to return the machine. Climbed up in the attic to get the box down and thought the only thing I haven't tried was the network card driver. I thought to myself that can't be it, surely they wouldn't send a new computer with a bad driver. Guess what, they did. Updated the driver and it worked instantly! It only took two days and the cat is now afraid of me because of all the bad language.

Title: Eficiencia
ReviewText: Excelente producto

Title: It's beautiful!
ReviewText: I just got my license to fly drones. My old computer wouldn't hack the 4K video footage, neither playing nor rendering it. So I had to upgrade. I went all out to buy this thing. It was intimidating so when I registered it, I named it the Beast.

Title: Awesome computer
ReviewText: This is a great computer. I work from home, so having a reliable and fast computer is essential. I love that it is wireless. I recently had surgery and I needed to work from a non-seated position. This computer came with me, and I never lost a day working!! It takes up very little room on my desk, and is easy to use. I love having an all in one for that very reason. The computer was easy to set up, and as I do not have a high technology IQ, this was perfect. If you need a fast, easy, small footprint, and just all around great computer, THIS IS THE ONE!!

Title: excellent computer and fast
ReviewText: I like this computer a lot better than the one in all pavilion except for the size. the hp envy 27 is a lot shorter screen and has no way to adjust up a little. you can adjust back but not make it a little higher. the pavilion does not adjust either yet a 1x bigger and higher screen. screen sizes are both 27 but the pavilion stands up a lot higher. outside of that it is a GREAT computer hp envy 27. if you dont care about height of the screen go with hp envy 27 but if you do need height go with hp pavilion one in one.

Title: It's beautiful!
ReviewText: I just got my license to fly drones. My old computer wouldn't hack the 4K video footage, neither playing nor rendering it. So I had to upgrade. I went all out to buy this thing. It was intimidating so when I registered it, I named it the Beast.

Title: What's not to love about this computer?
ReviewText: This machine has exceeded my expectations. Sleek and fast. Practically noiseless. Great video quality. Decent audio quality. That said, I'm not a gamer, so I can't really speak to the quality of the gaming experience. This machine works fantastic for all of my uses.

Title: INCREDIBLE!!!
ReviewText: This beautiful and ingenious computer saved my life and my pocketbook. I was going to purchase an Apple iMac of some type, and when I found this, I realized that I could purchase this model PC! I am using my new HP Envy 27 QHD computer for my Recording Studio and have found that this will even beat the Apple stuff and save A LOT of money on the hardware, software, peripherals and research materials. If it's Apple, it's expensive. Not the case here!

Title: Audio fails after HP bios updates
ReviewText: Worked great for a few months. However, there appear to be issues with automatic HP bios updates (not sure yet how to turn them off) and hardware performance. After last bios update audio no longer works. HP tools on box did not resolve issue and finally recommended reinstalling windows and losing all my installed apps. Makes one wonder what else the bios update might have broken.

Title: AMAZING MONITORS
ReviewText: WOW, bought 2 and the office set-up is PERFECT. These monitors work great and have several options. We like the Blue-light reduction feature.

Title: Good product for the price point.
ReviewText: Good product for home office and photo processing. The only that's difficult to are the USB ports at the rear of the base.

Title: Well-tuned budget laptop
ReviewText: I have model # 14-DF0023CL, the variant sold at C*stco.

Title: Great little machine!
ReviewText: I downloaded a program that is almost too much for this machine....but it handles it just fine, even with crappy rural internet. It's so lightweight too, but doesn't feel cheap or like it's going to break. It's quick on startup due to ssd and is very responsive. Very happy with my purchase.

Title: Solid workhorse, great for school!
ReviewText: This thing runs for days! It's fast and good enough for the majority of my day to day functions. I upgraded RAM (very easy to do!) and can easily run MS office, VMWare, and others with little latency. Only thing I have found to dislike is that there are only two USB ports (excluding USB-C), but even that hasn't been an issue.

Title: Nice little laptop
ReviewText: We bought this laptop for my wife and she has been very happy with it. The screen quality is excellent, and the computer itself is thin and light.

Title: Itâ€™s ok...
ReviewText: I just received this about a week ago. I gave it 3 stars cause itâ€™s just ok. It feels a bit flimsy but lightweight. It doesnâ€™t respond very quick and freezes a lil. It doesnâ€™t have backlit keyboard as advertised. Not to bad to be disappointed. I use it only for internet, checking email and typing. Itâ€™s ok for that. If youâ€™re looking for a high end pc donâ€™t buy this. If your just doing everyday basic stuff ok. You get what you pay for.

Title: Full HD 1080p/HW HEVC decoding (Intel Pentium Silver N5000)
ReviewText: I bought this laptop basically for its Full HD IPS panel at a cheap price! HP 14-df0010nr (Intel Pentium Silver N5000 Processor,UHD Graphics 605, 4 GB 2400MHz SDRAM, 128 GB SATA SSD). Windows 10 Home in S Mode (WIN 10 Home OEM key in BIOS). Fan-less cooling (Totally silent!)

ReviewText: Great computer. We could purchase again

Title: Very clean laptop
ReviewText: Absolutely no bloatware, I was shocked. Yes, it's set to a windows 10 'safe' addition, which might scare you but you can just disable it and it's a full version. Memory is very very low for win 10 but with a $23 sodimm upgrade it's a great travel laptop.

Title: It appears to have a video card reset issue/overheat causing the screen to go black and reset
ReviewText: Although it's a sleek and powerful design, the video cards, built in intel and separate graphics card, appear to have an issue or overheat problem causing a black out and reset periodically. I would not recommend buying this computer. It's possible it's a driver issue, but more likely, it's heat management which is an HP design issue. HP doesn't have or didn't take the time to fully check their designs for issues like this one.

Title: Great Computer
ReviewText: The computer arrived ahead of schedule which scored some points, it was well packaged and in new condition. What I really appreciate about this unit is that it is ready to use as soon as you hit enter after your password and I mean ready to use , no waiting to boot. Hopefully I will still like it in 6 months, I'll keep you posted.

Title: Very user friendly
ReviewText: So happy with this computer. We've had it a while now and have never had an issue. We use it often with CAD programs, for school, and 3D printing.

Title: Touch screen broken, causes twitches
ReviewText: Highly recommend not buying refurbished computers from this seller. Soon after the (short) warranty period, the screen started twitching constantly. We do not use the touch screen, but the twitching seems to be related to the touch screen functionality. I disable the touch screen, but then on next restart it automatically enables again. Laptop was almost unusable within 6 months of purchase.

Title: work great
ReviewText: i love it.

Title: No operating system installed
ReviewText: No operating system was installed. You can surmise from there how much testing was done on the machine prior to shipment.

Title: Returning ASAP.
ReviewText: Too much damage , even for something certified referbished . I didnâ€™t even bother to turn it on.

Title: Won't work with EliteBook 840 g5
ReviewText: I purchased this to work with a new HP EliteBook 840 g5 laptop. It did not work for this computer, because the g5 version has no DisplayPort connector - only HDMI. The UltraSlim Docking Station has no HDMI connector - only DisplayPort.

Title: Works well AFTER critical issue resolved
ReviewText: I bought this docking station and two DisplayPort monitors. I put it all together and ran into a critical issue - the monitors would go on for a few seconds, then off for a few. It kept repeating that forever. After a couple of hours of researching and trying a few things, the resolution was to upgrade to version 2.33 of the HP docking station firmware. (Mine was at 2.27 and version 2.30 did not resolve the issue). If I had not been able to resolve that bug, it would have made the two monitors I bought to use with it expensive doorstops, but now all seems to be working well.

Title: It functions, mostly!
ReviewText: I am an IT support tech and have been working with these for a few years. In my opinion, it is a bad design and cheap. I had a broken one at work and got so frustrated with changing these docks out, I was able to break it easily over my knee. HP needs to reconsider there docking stations. I bought this for the lockdown, for my wife; who's work model needs this dock so she can work better at home. Just the other day, the slider on the side that connects the laptop became loose and all monitors attached stopped working. Thinking was the monitor, began trying several troubleshooting attempts. I finally reseated he docking station and it worked. If you have an HP laptop you're stuck with it.

Title: Useless!!
ReviewText: It isn't charging my laptop while connected to it and the plug is covered while connected so I can't even use the laptop power cord while connected to it. Useless!!

Title: Just like my work docking station
ReviewText: Bought this to set up a home office because I work too much. Works great, exactly like the one I got from IT at work.

Title: Includes 65 Watt Power Supply
ReviewText: Needed a replacement HP dock in a hurry, and this was cheaper than new. Works perfectly right out of the box, and it does include the AC adapter.

Title: Docking Station Does the Job.
ReviewText: My wife and I both use HP laptops for work, so I have two of these docking stations in two locations in the house. They're good for keeping the laptop charged and connecting to keyboard, mouse and monitors and don't take much space. My only complaint is that it has one VGA connector and two DisplayPort connectors. It would have been much more useful to swap one out for HDMI. I work around this with an additional HDMI to DisplayPort adapter on one docking station and a DVI to DisplayPort adapter on the other. You just need to be careful to buy the right adapters if connecting multiple monitors.

Title: Canâ€™t get the display ports to work
ReviewText: Iâ€™ve tried everything to get the display ports to work, including troubleshooting online, downloading drivers and firm ware. All other ports work fine. Seems to be a common problem. Glad I got the extended warranty- I will be using it!

Title: Super reliable / quiet and powerful
ReviewText: Perfect little computer with enough power to run as a modest server. I purchased this to replace an aging workstation/server that one of my clients was using.

Title: I tried to be happy with it...
ReviewText: It is advertised as a gaming laptop but overheats while playing Witcher 3. It gets incredibly hot to the touch! I don't hear a fan at all...not sure what's up with that. I had to return the laptop for repair with less than 10 hrs of use and now this overheating issue. The laptop is fine for casual browsing.

Title: Speed monster
ReviewText: Love the processing speed on this Acer. I have had over 30 internet tabs open at once & this monster handles it like nothing! Acer is the only laptop I have felt comfortable since at least 10 years ago.

Title: Love the form factor
ReviewText: Iâ€™m very happy with my purchase... impressive functionality in a small form factor. Very quiet running.

Title: Do NOT buy this laptop, or Any Asus laptops! The company is ripping off consumers!
ReviewText: 3/17/2018: Update after sending my notebook to Asus under RMA. Asus has refused to repair my notebook and tried to bill me a for a new unit. A technician at Asus damaged my notebook and they are blaming it on me. I escalated to top management and was told they would provide me a 20% discount to buy another one! Unbelievable, but this tells me the current Asus management is out to rip off people! do NOT buy their products!

Title: Completed hardware tests on unpacking
ReviewText: I will be updating this review as I use it, but I wanted to give my first impressions.

Title: Screen Not Ready for Primetime
ReviewText: I'd love to give this laptop a better review, but I can't, because it never got past the initial setup. The first one I received within a couple of minutes had numerous discolored vertical lines in a two inch slice of the screen, which persisted through reboots and were visible in BIOS and in a separate boot environment. The replacement I received looks to have been previously returned based on the manufacturer tape being split and covered with regular shipping tape, and it too had a screen issue. Backlight bled up from the bezel, which may not be a dealbreaker if this was a $300 laptop, but I'm not paying $1800 for a laptop with a screen with ANY defects.

Title: Good but with some annoying keyboard issues.
ReviewText: First off, I am not a gamer. I purchased a gaming laptop to edit 4k videos, to run Adobe filters, and run intense trading algorithms. That being said, I HATE the keyboard. The AWS & d keys are white, which looks so tacky. Next the font of all the letters of the keyboard is wierd and gamer like, a normal person can hardly tell what the letters are the font is so far off normal. Lately the delete key is not over the backspace key, it's over 1 key, why on earth change that, I have to go looking for it all the time and because I can hardly read the keys am always missing it. The camo design is also super cheesy the fake carbon fiber too. The computer is fast, it's as big and heavy as my 5 year old Toshiba satellite that I am replacing, I was expecting a 17" laptop to be thinner after 5 years especially now that the CD rom is gone. All in all it's a good laptop which is fully on and ready 5 seconds after opening it, I just wish whoever designed the keyboard would be fired or maybe executed idk. I also think its annoying that not even a gamer designed laptop can be free of a ton of bloatware. I mean really does Asus make that much money from annoying its customers with all the unneeded programs preinstalled. The battery life is awful too. The shortest of any laptop I think I've ever had. Ok so bottom line it's not perfect but I like the quality and speed of this laptop.... just keep it plugged in and dont look down! The end.

Title: Zippy little machine with a couple drawbacks
ReviewText: So far pretty good. This is a pretty zippy little machine - I'm fairly impressed with it's quick boot time, and generally it hasn't lagged with any task thus far. Keyboard is satisfying (and thankfully is backlit), thin bezel is a nice touch, machine is very light, slim and trim. My complaints are the same as what is found in some review articles: 1) The battery life is absolutely dismal - I can literally watch the battery life slip away as I'm working, and while I haven't tried running it down yet, I don't think it can last more than 4 hours - which sort of defeats the purpose of a very portable machine. 2) The display resolution is awful- 1366 x 768 - that Lenovo made this machine without FHD is kind of mind-boggling - and it's pretty darn noticeable. Strangely though, while my eyes are usually very sensitive to low-res, it isn't bothering me _that_ much. I bought this computer in a bit of a rush, and had I noticed the battery and screen specs before purchase, I would not have purchased, and I imagine these specs would be a deal-killer for many other folks. Nonetheless, I'm pretty happy with the laptop overall.

Title: Put this in laptop in Hospice Care from the day you buy it.
ReviewText: The Lenovo sounded like a great deal - great processor, Ram, Memory etc - and all for the price? Too good to be true. And thats exactly the case. Though the battery life is low (only holds for about 3 hours) and the graphics are terrible, you can get past that given the specs of this laptop.

Title: Short battery lasting time and occasional outage
ReviewText: The only problem with this laptop is the battery. Normally it can only last for around 3-4 hours depending on how you use it. This is not lond enough. However, sometimes the battery lasting time will suddenly drop from around 50% to 5% and turn off automatically then. I think The battery and its sensor is not good enough.

Title: System stopped working
ReviewText: The system worked for several weeks but unfortunately the system failed and now it does not turn on. I also came to find out that this particular machine is from 08/2018, and when I bought it [refurbished], it had 7 days left on the manufacturer's warranty. My disappointment is that nowhere in amazon said that it was a 2018 model with no or very little warranty left. Even though it was refurbished, I assumed it was a much newer model. I will update this if I can get either amazon or lenovo to resolve this.

Title: Good machine.
ReviewText: Solid little laptop. Battery life is decent for the weight of the laptop. I added an extra 8GB for a total of 12GB and it's performing very well. I will swap the HD to a SSD and I think this will make a great "sofa laptop".

Title: Meh
ReviewText: This is an "OK" older laptop, and is fairly priced at $550. Caution- some sellers are over-pricing this at $100 more. For that price, you can get a better laptop with the most current tech.

I was very excited to see the reviews on this computer. I just got it in the mail today. It took me 5 tries to get it to fully turn on, each time it said the computer hadn't been turned off correctly, I got it all set up, and as soon as everything was done it crashed. I turned it back on, it was all normal, then I clicked on the internet tab and the screen went grey and wouldnt load. I had to force shut it down, and now its taken another 15 minutes to turn back on. I doubt I'll be able to use this sadly..

Title: Nice computer
ReviewText: The screen resolution isn't the best, but it doesn't bother me. Otherwise this is a great machine. I'm a teacher and it works perfectly for my needs.

Title: Great laptop - wireless card issues, poor battery life. Would still buy again though.
ReviewText: Power house of laptop and runs light room very well. Battery life is pretty bad, but that's bc the laptop has a pretty powerful cpu and gpu. My biggest complaint, is that the wifi connection drops all the time. Apparently it's a known issue with this model. New drivers do not solve the issue. I had to buy a new wireless card for $11: "Intel Wireless-Ac 9260, 2230, 2X2 Ac+Bt, Gigabit, No Vpro", removed the bottom panel of the laptop (easy to do), and remove the stock wifi card and replace it with this one. It is very easy to do, but annoying that Lenovo continues to use this bad wireless card on models after this one even. The new wireless card solved the issue, and from my research is the only solution.

Title: Excellent Laptop  for the money
ReviewText: Fast added 32 GB of memory and another SSD

Title: Long Lasting PC
ReviewText: PC or Mac? That's the first hard question. Macs are known to outlast PCs, but PCs (in my opinion) have better functionality for business. I decided to purchase this Lenovo because of the PCs, it is the best, longest lasting one out there based on my research.

Title: does not work in Linux
ReviewText: Has major firmware bugs that prevent linux installs without doing grub hacks. also power management is bugged in linux.

Title: Great Price and Good Quality
ReviewText: I love Lenovo Thinkpad products and this was cheaper than buying from their own website.

Title: Great laptop, but a feature is missing it seems..
ReviewText: This is the second laptop I bought from Amazon (I destroyed the first one by accident!) So far I really am liking it. My concern is that this was supposed to be a touch screen laptop when in tablet mode. But nothing moves or changes when I touch the screen. As a matter of fact, when I put it in tablet mode, I could not get back to my desktop at all. I had to switch back to regular mode and restart. Now it's not all that important to me to have a touchscreen, but it was listed as one of the features I paid for. Now I could be doing something wrong, not afraid to admit that. All in all great laptop for a great price. Just have to do some searching to make sure I have everything that was listed.

Title: Seller kind of shady
ReviewText: The computer is pretty solid for its price, works fine looks good. However, its rated as having a backlit keyboard and mine came without the feature. In fact, the button to control that feature is just blank. This is kinda annoying and made me question the validity of the other specs listed. I tried to contact seller but no reply. Seller is a bit of a dunce for this. Also, the other review on here talking about a touch screen... There is no spec listed for that on this computer so im not sure what shes on about. Overall, solid computer though.

Title: Does not have backlit keys.
ReviewText: I'm returning this for just that reason. If it had backlit keys like a similar HP laptop, the function of the F4 key would control it. Instead of backlight control you get a lame screen resizer on that button which I'm sure none of us needs.

Title: Ram
ReviewText: Beware does not have the ram it says it does only 4 ram not 20.seller did refund some money back but the description still the same.

Title: Fast bootup!  But not capable
ReviewText: I boot up in 5-7 seconds, YEAH!!!!! However, when trying to do more than one thing at a time - computer bogs down to a crawl. I was running one program and tried to use the internet at the same time. The internet took 15 to 25 seconds to respond???

Title: Faulty Product/ cheated by Amazon
ReviewText: I had to get the first one replaced because its backlit keyboard feature didn't work, and in exchange received another one with the same defect and a fan that is always on. The battery life shows as '10 hours remaining' when full and unplugged, only to show as '3 hours remaining' within half an hour.

Title: I got a bad one.
ReviewText: I got a 'lemon' after 2 days it slowed down, froze up, went onto self repair mode, and gave me several errors and a blue screen. I had to return it, currently waiting on an order for another HP of a little bit better quality, I hope it is a good one.

Title: My new HP laptop is half the weight of my old machine.
ReviewText: Windows 10 was an upgrade on my old HP laptop and sometimes had issues with freeze-ups. Windows 10 is much smoother on the new version.

Title: Not a good device
ReviewText: Thereâ€™s a few issues with this device.... typing is beyond maddening, the cursor moves and youâ€™ll begin typing in random locations. It also will click and open things off the desktop, I think the keypad is broken. Also, the face recognition doesnâ€™t work. Iâ€™ve tried to â€œimprove recognitionâ€ by using different looks and hair styles and it still wonâ€™t recognize me. I have to type my password every time. It refuses to connect to my phone and cloud. It deleted my saved assignment for school, I had typed (after a TON of effort because the cursor issue) saved it, and it was gone. I am SURE I saved it properly, and it was gone. I have to completely re-do it.

Title: Product not as advertised
ReviewText: This laptop was sold as having 512 gb hard drive. It doesn't. C drive is 28 gb; D drive is about 460 gb. Close, and the internal structure could use up the difference. The problem is that C drive is only large enough for Windows and Office and a few other files, but it took a week for me to fill it to the point that no more data could be placed there. Trying to move files and data from C to D didn't work, either by using a USB drive or by cut/copy/paste. Amazon had no problem authorizing a return, but the 3d party provider wants me to pay for the return, plus a 20% restocking fee, or more if the package is open or used. Of course it had to be opened and used to discover the problem. The laptop was sold to me by Electroinc; now the same item and unchanged listing is sold by another company. Locating the companies in Canada was not difficult, but the phone numbers are no good, so tech service is non-existent, Beware.

Title: Computer arrived damaged
ReviewText: After turning it on for the first time and setting it up, it did not work again, it took me a week to talk to the people of DELL and they told me to send it to repair to Texas, this is a disaster, the computer is urgent and I want me to replace it with a new one, I do not have time to wait. What's wrong with DELL? Before I had better service.

Title: Cheaper alternative to the MacBook
ReviewText: The laptop arrived in great condition and as described. The tablet mode is useful and distinguishes this laptop from Apple's MacBooks. Apple does not incorporate the tablet feature into its products likely to avoid stealing market share from iPads. If you want a powerful laptop designed for business/office applications that's faster than the more expensive MacBook, this appears to be a good choice.

Title: Computer is AWESOME! BUT No Pen Input.
ReviewText: Disappointed that a Full Touch & 2-in-1 convertible device would not be compatible with active styluses. Otherwise the computer is running great. For a SSD computer, the fan does run quite often and is warmer than other SSD devices I have used. Have had NO issues with processing or streaming or using multiple programs.

Title: Sure be nice if it would make a sound
ReviewText: Cute system - but doesn't have speakers. Will not utter a word. Probably other issues as it won't run DAW software. Perhaps the two are related. Tired of the cheapness.

Title: No hard drive
ReviewText: Ordered Dell Inspiron 5579 laptop and received item without hard drive. Returned and received a second laptop again without a hard drive.

Title: Got what I wanted, and had immediate support when something temporarily went wrong
ReviewText: I ordered computer with 500 GB of SSD and 32 GB of RAM; I got exactly that. Wow, this computer is fast for everything I do!

Title: Excelente Producto

Title: I highly recommend to avoid HP Envy Desktop computers
ReviewText: I purchased a "Premium" HP Envy desktop computer 8 months ago. When I first received the system I was very pleased. Within 3 months, the problems started. I have had keyboard/mouse latency issues and sound card latency issues that have caused up to 10 second delays in functionality. I have probably had at least 10 service sessions with HP and the problems have never been resolved. The HP service techs have remoted into my computer at least 8 times. I have performed 2 factor resets, requiring reinstallation of all of my software. I am a very seasoned user and this is extremely frustrating. Do not be fooled by HP marketing. These machines are junk!

Title: Great computer for a cheaper price.
ReviewText: This computer is twice as fast as my old one. It turns out without isses or glitches. Its operating smoothly. The touch screen works ok and the speakers while they arent the top of the line quality are adaquet for my job. The battery life is great on this too. I can unplugg it and it maintains a charge for hours.

Title: Nice. Has a few problems.
ReviewText: Has great storage and nice resolution. But the screen sometimes goes haywire turning green and pink. I tried updating the display adapter's driver and it didn't help. And the fan sounds like a jet engine. Multiple time the computer freezes up and becomes unresponsive. I have to manually shut it down with the power button then restart. It's a pain.

Title: Screen not working
ReviewText: Bought this for my husband, and it suddenly stopped working. We've only had it for ten months and he's very careful with it. I'm hoping to get a replacement from the seller, but I doubt it'll happen. He had his last computer for 6 years with no issue.

Title: Super great laptop!

Title: Excelente

Title: How it performs
ReviewText: I am a avid computer user and have a lol experience fixing computer issues! For the most part this machine works well, but it is not compatible with a some of MS products. For the most part it performs fairly well and I haven't found an issue I could not fix yet-If your very familiar with computers, this machine is good-but it does have it's bugs like most computers. The biggest problems with this machine is with win 10 updates-it sometimes corrupts certain programs and you have to uninstall the program and re-install the program-very time consuming. I have a lot security on my machine and know how to get rid of most malware, including ransomeware. So far I have not had any viruses, trojans or malware.

Title: Cheap SSD Drive died after only 3 months
ReviewText: Called tech support and they wanted me to ship PC back to them! I've worked on PC's since the 80's so I said I'll replace the SSD if they would ship me a new SSD. They told me that it would take a week to get the replacement! Poor service at best. Not happy. I pay my bills with Quicken and being without that PC for 7 days is real problem for me!!!!

Title: Windows 10 64bit version 1803 is a pain in the ass.
ReviewText: The machine is fast, the ram is good, video driver excellent. Minimum number of ports unless you do everything by usb.

Title: Very Satisfied Customer
ReviewText: Product is fast, easy to use, no problems with install and exactly as I anticipated it would be. No calls to tech support, so can't address that, and the only issue I had is with the delivery company, not knocking loud enough or providing an opportunity to answer the door before leaving the "pick me up later" message. Overall a good purchase for me.

ReviewText: The blue tooth does not work correctly. It has severe latency that makes it unusable!!

ReviewText: 3 of 3.0 usb in the back eventually didn't work later on, When my phone is connected, it shows it's connected, however when I click the folder from desktop, the folder disappears. Not just the cellphone, the portable storage has same problem too. the hardware is not build in solid.

Title: Not truly usb-type C compliant
ReviewText: everything is great about the case minus their marketing bends the truth. The case does have a type-c connection BUT it only uses a normal usb 3.0 header connection so you are limited to 5gb speeds instead of the default 10gb true speed that Type-C can handle. If they had provided the correct cable header connector this would not be a problem. Motherboards now have a specific connection for USB 3.1 type-c gen 2

Title: Stay far away from it.
ReviewText: This product is good looking once you get it put together. But thatâ€™s about it. The fan controlller included is worthless and made poorly and again Thermaltake used a special connector to hook the fans up. These fans are nice but fan speed canâ€™t be controlled. My fan controller fried and now the fans are worthless cannot even control with other Thermaltake controllers. This is a joke. He cable management is poor and if you have to add other controller or fan hubs. Good luck. I have built dozen of PCs. This is up there with worst I have experienced. I was so excited to get this case. Now I am stuck with a case that is worthless and 3 fans that I canâ€™t hook up. Thermaltake made so many bad decisions. They usually make a great product. But this is not one of them.

Title: Awkward shape defeats the point of going micro or itx
ReviewText: I got the 20VT, micro atx model. I chose it because it seems the most easily stackable model, the versatile top choices, and the price was right... And it's one of the most attractive cars in its size class that won't break the bank. I loved the idea of this case. It's beautiful and smartly designed. But, I really wish it came as an ITX size or SFF. I was hoping that since it's micro atx, it'd be smaller than a tower, but the squat, fat shape breaks it for me. Instead of being long and thin like a full tower, it's short and squat. About the same space taken up, but in a different way. The case is, without a doubt, huge in person in a way you can't really perceive in your head when it crunches the size numbers. It's like your single aunt fey's pug. It's cute until you realize how massively over fed it is, lol. Unfortunately I'll be sending it back, but it really is a beautiful case if you have the space. The tempered glass survived shipping with hardly any protection and it really looks just like the picture.

Title: 20VT doesn't have the RGB lighted front case fan and controller
ReviewText: Why does NewEgg show a photo in the description of this 20VT case with the lighted colorful case fan? Apparently that isn't included in this case and must be purchased separately. FOR $20 MORE YOU CAN BUY THE SAME CASE WITH THE LIGHTED FAN, or you can buy this case and spend $100 additional to get the missing lighted case fan and the missing RGB controller!! I hate deception!!

Title: Almost wanted to shed a tear when I was finished.
ReviewText: This is a great case I absolutely love it. Here are some pros and cons that I saw.

Title: Simply beautiful with some minor flaws
ReviewText: I purchased the level 20 MT and im still happy with it. **For anyone wondering, the fans provided are the Thermaltake ARGB Pure Pro fans.** At first glance, this was the perfect case. I did over a months worth of research to find a case that fit my needs and wants and this was the one. I'll start with the positives:

Title: Nice mobo...
ReviewText: I got this to install in an Inwin Chopin case. I outfitted it with a Ryzen 5 2400G APU, Noctua NH-L9a cooler, 16GB of Team Dark Pro 3200 C14 (TDPGD416G3200HC14ADC01), and a 1TB Western Digital Blue M.2 SATA drive. The BIOS is fully featured and has all the settings I would expect to find. I haven't had any problems with it so far and am happy.

Title: How To: Adjust VRAM (For APU's) using this MOBO!
ReviewText: I bought this motherboard from NewEgg awhile back and everything about it was & still is perfect, except for adjusting the VRAM part for my 2400G APU. This motherboard is an absolute pain on adjusting VRAM, so I've decided to write a review explaining how to successfully do it.

Title: It's an unreliable and broken board
ReviewText: I must be extremely unlucky because my experience with this board has been very different than that of the other reviewers. I have gone through 3 of these boards (RMAd the first, then bought a new one) and they have all had major breaking issues that have caused so much frustration.

Title: Do NOT buy for Zen 2!
ReviewText: This board will NOT work with a Zen 2 cpu. On cold boots it will sit there and just reboot itself over and over until it eventually resets the bios THEN boot. Despite bios updates it won't work, I got 2 of these boards, both had the same issue.

Title: Should have listened to negative reviews
ReviewText: When I first got the board, I had yet for the case and PSU to arrive, so I could not test it right away. However, I was worried when I opened the box and found two capacitors already bent while still in the anti-static bag, and it looked like the bag itself was scuffed from shuffling in the box or something, as the bottom of it had drag marks from the metal on the bottom of the board. I decided to hope for the best and see if it would work once I assembled everything. Sadly today, after 4 hours of installing it, testing it, taking it back out, testing it without anything but bare essentials in, attempting to reset CMOS, etc., it refused to boot to POST. The BIOS would never boot up and no matter what I tried, the mobo was stuck in an infinite boot loop. I even tried booting it off the case, if it might have just been shorting the board somehow, but no luck there either. As other reviews have said, ASRock's quality control seems to leave a lot to be desired. While I would like to give them the benefit of the doubt that I simply got a bad board, which happens all the time with motherboards, multiple reviews seem to indicate that this is a problem with this board, or potentially ASRock in general.

Title: Full Featured Mobo
ReviewText: I bought this based off youtuber ETA Prime's ITX Build using the red Goodisory A01 computer case. Unfortunately for me, the case was unavailable when I went to put this PC together, but with some adjustments, the build went without a hitch.

Title: SSD Failed after 4 months
ReviewText: This is terrible. I can see lots of people having the same issue. This computer's SSD failed after 4 months. Terrible product and the company who has sold this PC to us. I would not recommend this product to anyone.

Title: Would be great if it ever worked
ReviewText: Within 4 months I got stuck in a boot loop. Spent about $600 repairing it and I am now stuck in a boot loop again.

Title: HP getting Flimsy?
ReviewText: My 4th HP Desktop. Works as advertised but seems flimsy by comparison to previous HP Desktop boxes.

Title: How it performs
ReviewText: I am a avid computer user and have a lol experience fixing computer issues! For the most part this machine works well, but it is not compatible with a some of MS products. For the most part it performs fairly well and I haven't found an issue I could not fix yet-If your very familiar with computers, this machine is good-but it does have it's bugs like most computers. The biggest problems with this machine is with win 10 updates-it sometimes corrupts certain programs and you have to uninstall the program and re-install the program-very time consuming. I have a lot security on my machine and know how to get rid of most malware, including ransomeware. So far I have not had any viruses, trojans or malware.

Title: Cheap SSD Drive died after only 3 months
ReviewText: Called tech support and they wanted me to ship PC back to them! I've worked on PC's since the 80's so I said I'll replace the SSD if they would ship me a new SSD. They told me that it would take a week to get the replacement! Poor service at best. Not happy. I pay my bills with Quicken and being without that PC for 7 days is real problem for me!!!!

Title: Windows 10 64bit version 1803 is a pain in the ass.
ReviewText: The machine is fast, the ram is good, video driver excellent. Minimum number of ports unless you do everything by usb.

Title: Very Satisfied Customer
ReviewText: Product is fast, easy to use, no problems with install and exactly as I anticipated it would be. No calls to tech support, so can't address that, and the only issue I had is with the delivery company, not knocking loud enough or providing an opportunity to answer the door before leaving the "pick me up later" message. Overall a good purchase for me.

ReviewText: The blue tooth does not work correctly. It has severe latency that makes it unusable!!

Title: You cannot do external monitors both at 2560x ... One has to be 1080
ReviewText: Nice laptop, but if you are planning on running two external monitors at 2560, you cannot.. The stupid minidisplay port cannot provide this... i wish this had two hdmi ports instead... for real external monitor PC use, this is not a good choice.

Title: Great price
ReviewText: Fast fast fast

Title: Don't buy this Laptop
ReviewText: Spent over $1,400 for it and Realtek PCI wireless adapter just kept crashing. I Downloaded latest driver from Realtek still didn't work. I'm sure it's just a software compatibility issue that will probably get fixed with an update sometime in the future, but basic the computer didn't hook up to network or internet. Don't produce a machine that does function fully. I ended up spending more $$$ on USB Wi-Fi adapter. Also Low battery life.

Title: C: Drive needs more space.
ReviewText: I needed a PC for my Mother. Something basic, nothing crazy since I'm sure she wont be hardcore gaming or doing mass production on it all night. She hates the tower look that comes with most PC's, so she asked me to get her something like this. Did some research and figured this would be her best option only because I trust MSI way more than HP PC's (No offense to HP users. I've just always had problems with them)

Title: Tiny C: drive will cause problems
ReviewText: The C: drive is so small that it can barely fit Windows. If the programs you are going to add need to be installed on the C: drive it is likely they won't fit. The D: drive (where the bulk of the memory lies) is not an SSD. All the info is there in the product description, but I didn't process that most of the storage is on a second drive. So, one star for me for not catching that, and two stars for them for selling a setup that won't work for most users. At the price, it might be worth considering swapping out the C: drive. Otherwise, it all works as expected. Unfortunately for me, I threw out all the packing materials already.

Title: Not happy
ReviewText: Received this was excited till I plugged it in turned it on had a green line from top to bottom on screen and it was easier to send it back order another than having this fixed quicker too so sent it back and order another but from Acer

Title: Beauty and brains, with a hard flaw.
ReviewText: Unusual to call a mouse "beautiful" but the description fits. The design is fantastic. Battery life is excellent. Pairing is not difficult. A consistent physical flaw is that the diamond-shaped middle control button for "hyper scroll" pops off or falls out nearly immediately, and it can get lost. I have purchased two of these, one directly from HP and the other from Amazon, and both demonstrated this issue. I added a tiny bit of special adhesive glue, and it did not interfere with operation. The diamond remains on one, and a diamond-shaped hole without the button significantly diminishes the appearance of the other, which finally disappeared during travel. It's unfortunate, because the product is otherwise beautiful and works well.

Title: Left-click is almost half-pressed... and you can't click the scrolling-wheel
ReviewText: This was a terrible purchase unfortunately.

Title: Not satisfied with this product.
ReviewText: This mouse is very hard to control in different forms even for a man with big hands. The metal scrolling deal is very hard to use easily when working with an Excel spreadsheet. This mouse is not very ergonomic---feels like a big potato in your hand. I purchased this item too way in advance from receiving my new laptop coming from China during this pandemic and ran out of time to return it before I got the laptop. I bought this item because it was recommended by the laptop manufacture, HP and it matched the Spectre 360 laptop. Don't recommend it or buy it again. I have a cheaper "Microsoft" wireless mouse with my old HP laptop and that one works ten time better than this new metal one.

Title: Smooth, Stylish & Sophisticated
ReviewText: I love the performance of this mouse, and that it perfectly matches my Spectre x360 laptop. I would prefer it to be a bit more flat for portability, and that I didn't have to take up a USB port to use it, but I do enjoy it.

Title: Excellent
ReviewText: Smooth, cool to the touch, convenient, adaptable. My son explains that the roller in the middle has two scrolling modes. It goes from smooth/quick or detailed/rough. He is happy overall with the product and he highly recommends it.

Title: It has a magnetic cover
ReviewText: I love this mouse. It has a very good feel to it. It is very well made. It has a neat magnetic cover, you push down on it and it opens up, this is where you store the pairing receiver. This mouse is chargeable a first for me and I like it.

Title: Looks good!! Won't connect!

Title: My Product was Rebuilt
ReviewText: Defective out of the box. Crashes laptop on connection. Went to HP site for support and discovered the warranty had been started 9 months ago and there was no more connection support available on the product. It must be hard for Amazon to keep up with these kinds of sellers. Yep, double checked and its advertised as new.

Title: Excellent Thunderbolt option and USB C - but UPDATE THE FIRMWARE!
ReviewText: Using this with a Microsoft Surface Book 2 and a Microsoft Surface Laptop 3 as well as a Dell XPS 13 2-in-1 7390. I had trouble at first with the Surface Book 2 locking up and going to a black screen when I would bring it back from sleep, but I found the latest HP firmware on the HP support site, I actually installed it from the Surface Book 2 and the dock updated appropriately.

Title: Doesn't Charge
ReviewText: HP pre-sales and post sales promised this would charge a specific HP laptop. It does not. Also, sometimes, it gets confused which screen is primary, or it resets one screen to 1024x768. It does not properly handle 3 screens. It does not pass the boot-screen either.

Title: Works with Spectre 360
ReviewText: This works great to charge and add extra displays to my Spectre 360 laptop. No complaints.

Title: Nice physical design but too many issues
ReviewText: I'm using the docking station with a new HP Spectre 15". When plugged into the station the computer will regularly wake up from sleep on it's own. I had to enable hibernate in Windows and start using that instead of sleep as a workaround. When the computer wakes up from either hibernate or sleep there are intermittent BSODs and the docking station will often start glitching (the mouse will start lagging and the audio out of the station's headphone jack will have static). The workaround I have found for that is to unplug the laptop from the docking station before bringing it out of hibernate/sleep and then plugging it back in once the computer is active. When I bought this thing I thought I'd be able to just tap the top of the dock to kick everything on but no such luck because of these issues. HP support said the G2 wasn't designed for Spectre laptops and suggested the HP Y0K80AA docking station. That one would charge way more slowly though as it is only 65W.

Title: Does not work with HP Omen
ReviewText: Did not work with the HP Omen like HP customer support said.

Title: Crashed my HP Zbook
ReviewText: I plugged it all in then went to HP site for latest drivers, downloaded, installed it, and after reboot my system never came back up. BSODðŸ˜«.

Title: Great controller if a temp is needed (Aug 25 Update) Stay away from this junk
ReviewText: Â So $40 for a wireless gamepad, it works amazing, the battery is surprisingly good,

Title: Surprised by so many 5 stars reviews
ReviewText: The gamepad has some pros:

Title: MSI Wireless Controller
ReviewText: If you're interested in this product, chances are you enjoy MSI products. My desktop PC is built primarily of MSI products, and knowing what a great track record the company has with gaming hardware I wanted to try out this wireless controller for my bedroom Steam Link.

Title: 5 star controller for a few reasons
ReviewText: Wow ! This controller is truely Epic but a few reasons make it stand out from the rest.

Title: Really wanted to love this controller...
ReviewText: As someone who adores the xbox 360 controller over the xbox one alternatives this particular controller was really appealing and since I'm a big fan of MSI when it comes to graphics cards it was an easy buy. Sadly after very little use (a few weeks at most) the left analog stick is now diverting towards the right and it's bad enough that many games are detecting it as movement and it doesn't return to a centered position after calibrating rendering my controller unusable.

Title: The Theranos of Docking Stations
ReviewText: For starters simply finding the correct dock for my new HP laptop turned out to be a bad science project. NO description of any kind on HP websites to specifically define to customers WHICH port replicator goes with WHICH laptop. In fact the HP website is nothing short of a labyrinth of opaque worthless instructions and endless do-loops sending you to more and more useless pages with NO opportunity to ever figure out how to speak to a human being. This after paying over $300 for a docking station.

Title: Do not buy from this seller! BEWARE
ReviewText: I bought this item despite the negative reviews and should have known better. The video ports did not work at all, the would detect a monitor but never output anything to them. I tried several different monitors and ports but all with the same results. The power and USB ports worked, but I wanted it for the monitor outputs.

Title: USB Ports do not work. Should have listened to warnings of other bad reviews.
ReviewText: I knew the reviews for this docking station were poor, but I had liked HP products in the past so I decided to give it a chance. However, the product does not work. The USB ports on the docking station do not work with my brand new Windows 10 HP ZBook G4. I wasted several hours updating drivers, changing BIOS settings, running HP SupportAssist, following online tutorials. Nothing resolved the issue. The monitor ports do work.

Title: A perfect dock for HP ZBook
ReviewText: It comes with a dual power/USB3 connector that's magnetically connected, so you can insert them both simultaneously with one motion. Makes for very fast connection. I have three of these docks at three offices and go between them quickly. The speed and internet connection is wonderful. I drive multiple screens. The only issue is that it took me a while to figure out the top cover which is a button that turns on the computer. If it's lit, hitting the button turns your computer off, so don't hit it again. And at first, I kept hitting it accidentally plugging things in.

Title: Price is ridiculous, but HP has you cornered.  Cheaper hubs overheat.
ReviewText: After spending 2.1K on a HP zbook, it was irritating to have to spend another $260 on a doc station in order to connect two monitors, speakers, two external drives, printer, film scanner, and miscellaneous USB devices -- yes, I work from home and have a lot of computer accessories. Tack onto the doc cost two DisplayPort cables as that is the only (usable) monitor input on the doc. I used to work for HP and still have stock -- honestly, with this fleecing of America, you'd think their stock would actually get off the ground!! If you buy a Surface Slow, you can get a Microsoft doc station for under $100. Obviously, we all decide what is most important to us. The good news is, I love the 4TB, 64GB RAM zbook which can handle SQL Server. with grace.

Title: MAKE SURE YOUR LAPTOP IS COMPATIBLE BEFORE PURCHASE
ReviewText: MAKE SURE YOUR LAPTOP IS COMPATIBLE BEFORE PURCHASE. I talked to HP tech support on a docking station for my New OMEN laptop. The person recommended this unit. It is not compatible with my OMEN laptop. If this would had worked with my laptop it would have been great. Very disappointed in HP tech rep telling to purchase this unit.

Title: "w/ Combo Cable" doesn't mean what you think it does
ReviewText: Short version - Dock is great, but doesn't come with a "combo cable" which I think would include both power and connections, only the connections (via USB C) NO POWER. Finding that power cable is a royal PITA.

Title: G2 cable wont make you pull your hair out.
ReviewText: Whoever designed the cable for the HP TB3 dock G1 should be whipped by it. The G2 cable addresses all those issues and the modular design allows you to add a conferencing speaker/mic.

Title: Major Quality Control Issues
ReviewText: We purchased two of the Lenovo Thinkpad's on the same order as well as a third on a previous order. When we activated the first computer, it worked flawlessly for a few days and then began having problems that required hard reset or Windows updates. After a few days of issues and much lost productivity, we got the feared "Blue Screen of death" and had to call in for IT support. After over $500 in technician time and no resolution to the issues, we called Lenovo and the technician determined right away that it was a bad CPU or motherboard.

Title: Second time is a charm
ReviewText: Although my first laptop was a lemon, tech support was very helpful and shipped out a new thinkpad as soon as mine was returned. Second one works like a charm.

Title: It's a workhorse
ReviewText: While admittedly I feel it's a bit early for a review, Amazon's bugging me for one, so here's my initial impression: this machine is pretty beastly. While it admittedly isn't a game-changing gamer rig, it does what needs doing quickly and reliably. The fingerprint reader in particular has proven solid for logging in, and while it's less than a month old, I haven't had any immediate issues yet, so I'll keep my fingers crossed. As far as packaging, it arrived well-packaged with all the expected parts and came out of the box ready to play. Installation of all of my needs for it (not insubstantial) was a fair bit quicker than I expected, and rather than leaving it overnight to manage all its updates, I found myself feeling like I might have forgotten something because it ran through all the paces so quickly. It makes the grade for me so far, now give me that gift card, Amazon.

Title: save your money
ReviewText: This is an absolute joke. Bought this computer a little over a year ago. Six months in, the internal battery died. One year in, the computer became completely nonfunctional. Constant freezing and crashing, serious challenges updating the OS, battery failure, constant screen blackouts, entire days when the computer refused to turn on, the computer was struggling to run basic programs--literally struggling with internet browsers and Microsoft Word, let alone any actual heavy duty programs. Have taken the laptop to my university's tech department four times, only for them to inform me that parts of this laptop appear to have been replaced with older parts. Tech department was continuously surprised when I mentioned how new the laptop was. I was sold a defective device, and no party has accepted any real responsibility. This was already a serious financial stretch for a piece of equipment I need every single day for university. Completely unacceptable, has caused me a ton of stress and frustration. Do yourself a favor and avoid buying from this seller, it'll probably be cheaper in the long run to buy directly from the computer manufacturer.

Title: Powerful little laptop
ReviewText: So far, I haven't had any issues running all my Adobe graphics programs all at once. My last few PCs couldn't open more than 2 at once and it was really slowing me down. One issues, I can't match my larger monitor color profile for some reason even when I select it, so I don't like it when I'm traveling and can't connect to a larger monitor and see the color hues I'm used to. Greens and blues look slightly different, even with the right palette chosen, so the graphics card is just too different. If you're not a graphics person, you won't even notice this, and it's very quick to boot up and launch programs too. I like the fingerprint security option.

ReviewText: I was never a fan of lenovo until I had to use one for work, I do computer software programming. Ended up falling in love with how simple and straight to the point the lenovo brand is. The top of the laptop screen is a bit of a finger print magnet but it is really not that bad. This laptop has now become my personal development laptop and I am very happy with the choice to run this laptop as such.

I bought this one (my 3rd) to replace my 8-year old Thinkpad which is now slow running today's Microsoft Window. New one blazes.

After over $500 in technician time and no resolution to the issues, we called Lenovo and the technician determined right away that it was a bad CPU or motherboard.

Title: Second time is a charm
ReviewText: Although my first laptop was a lemon, tech support was very helpful and shipped out a new thinkpad as soon as mine was returned. Second one works like a charm.

Title: It's a workhorse
ReviewText: While admittedly I feel it's a bit early for a review, Amazon's bugging me for one, so here's my initial impression: this machine is pretty beastly. While it admittedly isn't a game-changing gamer rig, it does what needs doing quickly and reliably. The fingerprint reader in particular has proven solid for logging in, and while it's less than a month old, I haven't had any immediate issues yet, so I'll keep my fingers crossed. As far as packaging, it arrived well-packaged with all the expected parts and came out of the box ready to play. Installation of all of my needs for it (not insubstantial) was a fair bit quicker than I expected, and rather than leaving it overnight to manage all its updates, I found myself feeling like I might have forgotten something because it ran through all the paces so quickly. It makes the grade for me so far, now give me that gift card, Amazon.

Title: save your money
ReviewText: This is an absolute joke. Bought this computer a little over a year ago. Six months in, the internal battery died. One year in, the computer became completely nonfunctional. Constant freezing and crashing, serious challenges updating the OS, battery failure, constant screen blackouts, entire days when the computer refused to turn on, the computer was struggling to run basic programs--literally struggling with internet browsers and Microsoft Word, let alone any actual heavy duty programs. Have taken the laptop to my university's tech department four times, only for them to inform me that parts of this laptop appear to have been replaced with older parts. Tech department was continuously surprised when I mentioned how new the laptop was. I was sold a defective device, and no party has accepted any real responsibility. This was already a serious financial stretch for a piece of equipment I need every single day for university. Completely unacceptable, has caused me a ton of stress and frustration. Do yourself a favor and avoid buying from this seller, it'll probably be cheaper in the long run to buy directly from the computer manufacturer.

Itâ€™s been in the repair shop for almost the past month and I still donâ€™t have it back yet.

ReviewText: We purchased two of the Lenovo Thinkpad's on the same order as well as a third on a previous order. When we activated the first computer, it worked flawlessly for a few days and then began having problems that required hard reset or Windows updates. After a few days of issues and much lost productivity, we got the feared "Blue Screen of death" and had to call in for IT support. After over $500 in technician time and no resolution to the issues, we called Lenovo and the technician determined right away that it was a bad CPU or motherboard.

Title: 18 month old computers, upgraded
ReviewText: Here is what you are getting. These laptops were assembled in late 2017 with the latest Intel i7 quad core processors and 8RAM and SSD. They were probably sitting in inventory somewhere and offered at a discount. This seller upgraded them to 16RAM and 512 SSD. If you compare this package with what Lenovo is offering as new, you would have to pay several hundred dollars more for new even if you upgraded on your own.

Title: This laptop loves to multitask
ReviewText: Iâ€™m actually using this laptop strictly for recording music... music performed by me. Running the latest ProTools and this baby just laughs and wants more. Letâ€™s see in a few months if my opinion changes.

Title: BLUE SCREEN!!
ReviewText: I've never been as disappointed as I am now. This laptop has the specs and the brand quality to last for several good years, yet only after less than 1 year (!!) the hardware just gave up.. Went to an official Lenovo lab for 4 (!!!!!) times (and never went to a non-official one), yet the Blue Screen won't stop haunting this damn laptop, ruining my schedule and ability to focus on my studies. I know a thing or two about computers and how to take care of them, and despite all my efforts to treat this one with silky gloves, it keeps disappointing time after time..

Title: Great laptop
ReviewText: Works great. Well built.

Title: Great business laptop.
ReviewText: Did a lot of research before buying. This had everything I needed for work and more. Should last me a good while without going out of date.

Title: Lenovo is really bad
ReviewText: Words can't describe how dissatisfied I've been with Lenovo products. I really don't get why people like them. My work computer is a Lenovo laptop and it's horrible, and my personal computer is a Lenovo laptop and it's horrible. I'm looking into getting a new computer as mine is only a couple years old and I can't stand it anymore. I bought it for video editing and it is just about useless for that. I bought it directly from Lenovo and don't understand how they build computers that have the capacity to run Premiere Pro, as in processor speed, video card, and RAM that are supposed to be enough to handle video, yet I get maybe two seconds of playback in PP before the video freezes, and sometimes the audio freezes as well, even when set to the lowest possible resolution for playback. The processor is always maxed out, even when I'm only running a browser and one program. Ever since I got it, if you bump the computer at all while playing a video file the video freezes with digital glitches all over the video image, which is probably due to the cheap hard drive. It may not be solid state, but I've never had this problem with any other SATA drives.

Title: Battery died in less than a year

Easy laptop wakeup from sleeping by pushing the power button at the top . Single plugin connects everything to my laptop.

Title: Thunderbolt standard still needs some work
ReviewText: The firmware on these units is older so I went through HPs process to update them and it causes my zbook 15 G3 on Win 10 1809 to blue screen while updated the USB drivers. The Dock itself is nice but it seems like the Thunderbolt standard and HP have not worked out all the bugs. Just do a Google search and you can see the issues.

Title: Great Thunderbolt docking station with USB C IPad support.
ReviewText: I got this to use on my elitebook 840 g5 and found it also works great on a 2018 IPad Pro with full peripheral and display support.

Title: Terrible.
ReviewText: Bluescreens, freezeups, video overheat. Was dumb enough to buy it here ergo the outcome is deserved. Returning it asap.

Title: Think twice if you plan to use with docking station
ReviewText: Laptop performance itself seems to be fine. A little heavy for frequent travelers. Trackpad is the best I've used on a laptop. HERE ARE THINGS TO KNOW if you are planning to use this laptop with docking station. The ThinkPad USB 3.0 Ultra Dock is compatible docking station, however: 1) You have to plug an adapter in to the computer from the docking station (not the traditional 'click-in, click-out' connection) 2) The Ultra Dock DOES NOT supply power! SO - the whole setup takes up two outlets on my power strip, and I have to stop and unplug/re-plug not one but two side connections to go completely portable. Takes a couple more seconds than the click-in/out feature of most docking stations.

Title: Everything fine
ReviewText: The laptop is working fine, is the product I expected to have.

Title: Does not work with Macbook & Dual Monitors
ReviewText: This is probably superb for a Windows PC, but the description is deceitful. It claims to work with Dual monitors for a Mac, but in reality, it is just a mirrored (the same) image on each monitor. It's hard to comprehend anyone would want mirrored monitors for their docking station in the office. I returned because of this reasion and indeed was charged a 15% restocking fee on top of the disappointment.

My sense is that the powering might be a little weak, but it is enough to add charge to the laptop battery while playing a full screen 720p YouTube video on the native 4k display and doing not much on the two external displays.

Title: Doesn't save you from connecting important cables
ReviewText: I have a Zbook G5 15. It draws more than 100 Watts power and that exceeds USB-C standards. So that would need an additional (and obviously expensive) cable to be connected with the Zbook power input. Dock does not manage HDMI, so another cable connected directly to the Laptop. Ethernet is much slower using the dock, so another cable directly connected to the Laptop...â€¦

Title: Does NOT work with dual monitors on HP laptop
ReviewText: I purchased this dock thinking that it would work with my dual monitor setup. It did not. I spent some time reading the description and reviews on this item before making this purchase. I don't know what the other reviewer did to get it to work with dual monitors but the product that I was sent definitely did not function as expected. Overall, I am very disappointed with this item and will be replacing it immediately.

Title: Maybe it will work someday, but not for Razer/Apple laptops
ReviewText: Beautiful design, terrible product. Connecting this to a razer blade stealth never worked, and I tried a 15 Macbook Retina with the same problems, even after installing all the drivers. If this product worked then it would be an amazing product, but for now I cant recommend it due to the lack of compatibility.

Title: Sufficient and Elegant
ReviewText: This is visually one of the nicest docks out there. It hardly takes up any space and makes plugging in everything much less of a hassle.

ReviewText: This dock works as advertised (thus far). No issues there. But I seem to have been sold a previously used & returned unit.

Title: Thank you
ReviewText: Thank you

Title: DECENT PRODUCT BUT MISLEADING PRICE
ReviewText: This product works fine. In fact it has been great. However, I paid $160 for this item, only to find out that there are EXACTLY the same products on the market under different branding at lower prices. Since I have two locations set up for my laptop, I had to buy another docking station. When looking, a "Diamond" brand pulled up and after looking at the pics, I realized that it is EXACTLY the same product only with different printing on the logo area. The Diamond product was $30 cheaper, and works exactly the same.

Title: So Far So Good
ReviewText: After my Plugable docking station crashes my brand new laptop multiple times while trying to wake it up, I thought it was best to try something different. The Plugable used to take between 5 to 10 seconds to wake up the computer and all the monitors with a Windows sound for each device that is connected, but this one takes up to 2 seconds. It makes only one sound to wake up the computer and all the devices are automatically available. This one is about 75% faster than the plugable and my internet speed is about 40% faster than it used to be with the Plugable.

Title: Exactly what I was looking for - Just like the description
ReviewText: I compared model after model of USB C docking stations and this was by far my favorite - Supports 2 additional 4k or 1 5k monitor (both HDMI and DisplayPort), has separate mic and headphone jacks, 6 USB ports, and a LAN port.

Title: Might work intermittently, but causes external monitors to flicker, and randomly disconnects...
ReviewText: With 15+ years of experience working in IT, I'm no stranger to laptop docks, and frankly have rarely given them much thought. You plug them in, and they just work. However, with this one, I'm seeing a very strange behavior in that my external monitors exhibit a subtle flicker when connected to this dock. They are perfectly stable and have no issues if I connect one directly to the HDMI out on my laptop, or when I test them on an alternate computer... however, bizarrely, when I type on my usb keyboard (also connected to this dock), the image on my external monitor flickers just enough to catch my eye and be distracting. I have already downloaded the latest display link drivers, and have not seen any improvement. I'll keep looking for a solution, but if I can't find one soon, I may be forced to return this one and look for another brand.

Title: Go to displaylink website for driver software
ReviewText: My device did not auto download. I went to the wavlink site and had issues downloading the drivers / software. I used the displaylink site and downloaded the first option on that page and then it worked after the download. I wasted so much time on the first website trying to download the drivers. Go directly to the displaylink site and save yourself some time.

Title: I WANT TO LIKE IT
ReviewText: It Lacks USB C Charging, and The Ethernet Port is Slow, When doing a speed test it maxes out at 60mbp every single tests, while if i switch over to my Wifi on same routher i hit 200mbps. Still looking for a solution for this, If cant be fixed will be returning this.

Title: It's decent
ReviewText: I once bought a laptop for $500. It is now on it's last leg. I can't unplug it or else it will die and load up time is unbearable. I'm an artist, so I need something with power. I decided the Omen was for me. I do find myself on occasion lamenting the $1,000 I've spent on this. I do like it though, so I haven't returned it. It lags every once in a while with only 3 programs running. I was warned a long time ago though, that gaming laptops aren't so great at multitasking. With the HP Omen having twice the power of my old HP, I thought this would be better. I still can't play Street Fighter 5 on this and I couldn't on my old one. It has trouble working with large Window's Paint files, while my old HP didn't really. I love the lit keyboard, though I don't use my computer in the dark. I like the feel of it all. I can type faster on this keyboard and the weight is surprisingly light. I am mostly pleased with this.

Title: It ainâ€™t cheap, but what is?
ReviewText: This is one nice computer, this little baby tells us exactly when the early bird special starts at diner. Heâ€™ll, it even calculates tips for us. The Missâ€™s uses it to find new cornbread recipes. I give it 5 shiny stars.

Title: Good Workstation
ReviewText: I like its speed with the 6 cores. I use it for cycles computations rather than games. It's a little hard to read the red keyboard, so I keep the backlighting on. I've recently purchased a virtual reality headset, but I haven't had the time to try it out. Looking forward to it.

Title: Amazing machine!
ReviewText: Up and running in minutes after taking it out of the box. So far, not a single issue. Powerful and fast. Couldn't be happier. Strongly recommended.

Title: Excellent pc!
ReviewText: Excellent pc! I got it upgraded and am so glad I did. They did an awesome job and have outstanding customer service @ Michael Electronics 2. Love this pc!

Title: Too many performance issues for such an expensive laptop!
ReviewText: When I first bought this laptop, it seemed promising, not gonna lie. The positive reviews outweighed the negative, the description of it seemed on point, everything seemed great. Then I received it. Upon unboxing it for the first time, I was pleasantly surprised by the shear size and weight of it. It was definitely heavier than most other laptops I owned in the past and it had a much larger screen size than I was expecting. Obviously, neither of of these characteristics were bad in my opinion, just a little unexpected is all. However, the real problems came AFTER I had turned it on and installed all the essentials. After installing the essentials such as Windows and the numerous different drivers required, I began testing the laptop out to see JUST how effective it'd be with simple, lightweight tasks such as web browsing and video streaming. I was NOT pleased. I had installed Google Chrome, as I do with all my computers, however, simply opening the app proved to be a difficult task in itself for this laptop. It'd take anywhere between 10 to about 20 seconds JUST to open Google Chrome. Sometimes it could take longer depending on whether or not you're trying to open it soon after powering on the laptop. If you power on the device, THEN try to open Google Chrome shortly there after, it would take anywhere between 20 to around 30 SECONDS! This, as most of you know, is unacceptable for modern day PCs, especially ones of this caliber.

ReviewText: The only think I dislike in the laptop is the display quality. I found it more dim than others. But if you dont have 2 laptops side by side to see the difference it is not big deal.

Title: Solid laptop with no issues so far (except Win10)
ReviewText: I've been a long time computer guy and traveler that is hard on equipment. I've had many different laptops including, Asus, Sager, Apple, and Dell. My son and I have both had our Sagers fall apart after a year or two, good hardware, bad construction in both cases. Apple did slightly better lasting 3 - 4 years but finally dying due to hardware failures, the conspiracy theorist in me thinks Apple may imbed some code in their updates to force obsolescence? My sons Dell XPS 13 has been flawless so far and I would have bought one of those if I could get a good price on XPS15.

Title: There aren't a lot of reviews or info on this. Read this.
ReviewText: Writing this, there aren't a tremendous amount of reviews. i probably know what you went thru. i personally looked at the dell XPS 13 and the Lenovo T480. had and felt both.

Title: It is in fact awesome.
ReviewText: All the BS and hype in the write up, on the HP site, and in the ads for this thing are true. I game better with this thing. I play multiplayer FPS daily. OW, CSS, CSGO, PUBG, Realm Royale, you name it. My aim is more concise and I sure as hell win more sniper peek battles. My shot just goes off first. 200% satisfied with this purchase.

Title: Excellent gaming mouse
ReviewText: I picked this gaming mouse up on a whim as back when I got it it had just released and had no reviews. First off the build quality on it is excellent, definitely a huge step up from the stuff HP normally makes. Second it integrates great with the Omen Command Center app I already have installed on my Omen gaming laptop (yay less bloatware). The DPI settings via color code are easy to get used to. I now just know which color is where I like to be 90% of the time and if I have a setting I like for a particular game I just know what color to jump to. The adjustable palm wrest is probably my favorite feature, it really lets you dial in the mouse so it fits just perfectly for how you hold.

Title: Awesome Mouse!
ReviewText: I have several gaming mouse and this one is the best by far! I have Logitech, GSkill and Corsair but this one is the best. Fast response and the mouse click is very pleasant! I don't have the biggest hand and I struggle finding the right mouse for it and this does it well! Definitely my mouse of choice. Highly recommended! The wired is very nice looking too!

Title: Good shape
ReviewText: I like this more than my Logitech mouses. My aim just feels more smooth, I think it's because the shape fits my hand comfortably. The only bad thing I can say is that you need a mouse bungee other wise you're going to feel\ hear the cable moving around.

Title: Mouse Click and Minimize Windows
ReviewText: I purchased this mouse a few weeks ago, and the out of the box experience was very pleasant. The Omen mouse provided a total response without any "lag". Fast forward to earlier this week, and I was faced with the left mouse button not responding. I at first thought the issue was my system; However, when I changed the mouse to a super cheap one, I had no issues. I am NOT slamming any products from HP with this review. I further will not return the product to Amazon as I would really like to figure out the root cause of the issue. I just would like other gaming people to understand there may be issues with the "out of the box" performance of this mouse. HP may have an update for this mouse which I was unable to locate and install to correct the concern. Honestly, after several HOURS thinking the minimization of a game playing issue was because of my system...and then only to find out this was do to incorrect mouse input is really sad.

Title: Great mouse for the most part.
ReviewText: Just got it today and been using it for a few hours and all around it is a good mouse. Two downsides in particular that may only apply to me, and one is just a very minor nitpick. First, for me at least, one of my more natural resting positions makes it so the mouse wheel is a good finger joint too short so I have to reach up to scroll, but I am sure I will adjust to it overtime. Second thing is found out I need Windows 10 to get the Omen Command Center to program the mouse. Currently I have Windows 8, but I plan on making a new computer entirely within the next few months, which will have Windows 10, so it is just a small gripe but maybe something to consider if you aren't yet modernized as I am. Other than those two things though it is a very good mouse, very accurate so that is lovely. I was able to use it perfectly straight out of the box. Another bonus is the cable is sturdy and durable looking as well. I would recommend.

Title: Overrated
ReviewText: Overpowered and the sensitivity is though the roof.

Title: Great mouse, but damages easily if not careful
ReviewText: I received this product a while ago and it was broken, in the sense that it could not right click. I sent it back and the new one worked but malfunctioned. I ordered a brand new one and it works fantastically now, just be aware that mechanical problems may be evident in your buying of this product.

Title: Poor quality and crappy customer service
ReviewText: My first one came dead on arrival. The second one worked for a little over a month and then the GPU broke. HP customer service is terrible. They really don't care and just will tell you to mail it back to them which takes a pretty long time. For this price could go with any other company and get a better laptop.

Title: Item defective when received.
ReviewText: Â The thing was a beast and it was built beautifully. A lot of titles hit the 144fps mark. The problem is whenever you tilted it forward, it would click. I thought it was a HDD failure, but it wasn't. The right fan was failing. For $2,000 dollars that is unacceptable considering the GTX 1070 and i7 8750H NEED proper cooling. I returned this item for a full refund. I'd buy another one but, as a college student, I can't risk having this thing failing me when I'm away from home. My case might be a rare one, but I can't take that risk.

Title: Edited: Loud but packs a punch. Currently having issues.
ReviewText: Â Used for gaming on the go. Great for COD BO4. However it gets pretty loud so wea ear phones and prop the laptop up to get air flow to the machine. Ran 85 degrees Celsius during gameplay (Black ops 4). The only issue is one of the fans is clicking. Possibly a loose bearing or smacking against a wire in the case. Title: The Heat, and the Fan noise bother too much When in regular use.
