Title: Hands down my favorite laptop
ReviewText: I love this laptop! Fast, beautiful, and versatile. I wish I would have sprung for the bigger hard drive, but that's on me.

Title: Incredible piece of hardware.
ReviewText: The laptop is stunning and the hardware specifications are incredible. I've been using the laptop for around a month now and I'm very happy with all aspects.

Title: Upgrade from HP Probook 8GB RAM/1TB Storage
ReviewText: I bought this as an upgrade to run Revit more efficiently. Just set up last night, but so far it is so much better than my HP with only 8GB RAM. The 4K display is nice, it was easy to set up, and was delivered quickly. Prior to purchasing I called the seller with a few questions and they were very helpful. Will try to update more on the laptop once Iâ€™ve used it for a while. As someone else may have mentioned, the USB port by the power source is a little awkward. So far, thumbs up for a great laptop and seller.

Title: Excellent replacement for a high end desktop!
ReviewText: Perfect laptop. I been holding back switching to laptop from desktop. Finally switched after seeing the capacity of this laptop (WIN 10 PRO, 2TB SSD, 32GB MEM, i7 CPU). So far it is not making me miss the desktop with similar capacity, except I had 16GB memory on the desktop. I was constantly syncing Office and Home Office PC. Now I just take the laptop with me, so I have my office PC with me always. No problem with hardware, software and or connections so far. I did get USB C hub, so I can connect to Ethernet at the office, and 32 inch 4K monitor. As well as external KB and mouse. Resolution is 4K on laptop, perfect for my needs. I did run into a problem with Acronis True Image 2019 backup, but that is not an issue with the laptop. I am waiting on Acronis tech support to resolve that today hopefully. This is a perfect laptop, thin, also tablet with pen (which I have not yet tried out), but good to have. I have replaced 2 desktops and surface pro with this one laptop. Highly recommend it.

Title: Expensive but exactly what I needed
ReviewText: This laptop is incredibly expensive but fast and responsive. I've bought it for work and to be handy when giving classroom instruction. A very sleek look and the 2 in 1 feature is pretty cool. I had to buy a USB port for the ethernet cable I need but it's not a serious concern. So far this laptop outperforms any laptops I had before it and I expect to use it for the next several years.

Title: Update Windows 10 takes some time. Driver updates etc. Great for with Adobe Premier Pro.
ReviewText: Need to update all drivers. Takes time. Had issues with graphics card compatibility with Adobe Premier Pro, but after a few hours with HP customer service all was good. Over-all I am pleased with the performance and graphics display. Slight rickety sound on the bottom panel of the laptop when grabbing it as you would a book. Initial boot up speed is wonderfully fast. I mean FAST!

Title: Incredibly slow doing basic tasks AND OS errors less than 1 year old!
ReviewText: It'd been a long time since being a Windows user. The past few jobs had provided MacBook Pros for free, but it seemed like there was SO much more value for my dollar by buying this HP laptop with improved RAM. Unfortunately, I was wrong.

Title: Awesome!
ReviewText: I've probably purchased thirty laptops over the past ten years for my business and for personal use. I never thought I would ever purchase an HP computer, but I took a chance after reading the reviews. So far, this laptop is fantastic. I use it for about 6-8 hours almost every day. It's very fast and seems like high-quality components.

ReviewText: Battery life could be better. Good for any thing from movies to school work.

Title: Five stars but with an important Caveat.
ReviewText: The HP specter x360 is an excellent laptop. Is is sleek, thin, extremely aesthetically pleasing, and a joy to use. The 4k screen is bright, vivid, and amazing, unlike other laptops that I have had to send back because they were either too dim or has visual defects when scrolling in terms of color and sharpness. And the built in speakers/sound system is probably the best I have personally heard on a laptop.

Title: Awesome Laptop
ReviewText: Very pleased with this purchase. The laptop is sufficiently zippy although I went ahead and maxed out the RAM and added a SSD immediately which of course increased the performance of the machine.

Title: Cheap screen, irritating trackpad
ReviewText: The screen has a poor refresh rate (blacks will blur away into white as you scroll) -- but most significantly, if you're looking to do any artwork, the color and brightness vary by vertical viewing angle to such an extent that you can't view the entire screen without darkening bands.

Title: Life should not be so difficilt
ReviewText: I don't know what I'm more frustrated with: Windows 10 (I miss XP Pro) or this ridiculous touch-pad that has far too many features that get in the way of productivity and function. And unless you really want / need a number pad keyboard, don't get it. At the end of the day, this laptop does perform as advertised and is light, great battery life and does the best it can with what it has to work with. But being Windows 10, it's crippled out of the gate. A MacBook Pro with Parallels will run circles around this thing and that is a fact. But it will cost about 3 times as much so bang for the buck, this is very good computing power.

Title: Gaming -NO, Business-YES
ReviewText: This is a very Good business class laptop, and for that purpose it works very well.

Title: Purchase 4-year protection!!!

This means the Laptops get tossed around in a pickup truck, pulled out at customers tables and used to put together proposals as well as in the office network to the server. The ASUSPRO P2540UB-XB71 handles all of these needs, is fast and reliable.

Title: Great Specs at a Moderate Price
ReviewText: This is a bargain laptop. The core I7 8550U Kaby-Lake processor is the same one you'll find in most high-end laptops these days, and better that the Y processors in the new macbook air. It has a generous number of connections; full size HDMI, USB 3, Usb2.1 and USB-C (3.1 specs), along with a Micro-SD slot and a 3.5mm headphone /microphone jack. The screen is a non-touch 1080P and a backlit keyboard and fingerprint reader. All in a 2.6 lb (by my scale) aluminum package. I have read some criticism of the keyboard, but personally I find it as good as any laptop keyboard and have no complaints. But, I do not write novels or technical manuals for a living so my typing is pretty basic and your mileage may vary. The down-firing Harmon Kardon branded speakers are OK. But in my opinion, people who insist on blasting there speakers for sound either live alone or don't mind annoying people around them. I have always preferred headphones.

Title: Go in stores where you can see and feel your product
ReviewText: Â What a waste of money . Screen started flickering after 2 weeks. What makes it even worst my daughter bought it and took it to England where she lives. Now they are saying to me we have to pay shipping cost back to the U.S.

Title: Slim, silent, low-heat, great battery & portability
ReviewText: My priorities in searching for a laptop were as follows: good brand, low emission (meaning low heat and low noise), MATTE display (because the common glossy displays reflect way too much light), HD monitor, >8GB RAM and a Solid State Drive. I spent a lot of time reviewing newegg, bestbuy and amazon for top sellers, along with pcreviews and notebookcheck dot net (which does incredible detailed reviews showing how much heat and noise a laptop generates). I settled on this notebook and am very happy with what I got. The 2018 version is definitely worth the extra $50 over the 2017 version because the bezel (plastic border around the screen) is much smaller resulting in a laptop that is 10% smaller than the 2017 version while maintaining a 13" screen! The faint high pitched noise put out by the motherboard is only detectable in a silent room when you place your head within 12" of the keyboard. The battery life is stellar. Under load, the system hardly generates any heat and under light use (browsing/Word), I never hear the fan kick in. This 8th generation i5 is much more powerful than older i7 CPU's. It's incredibly thin. I was worried about the laptop looking 'gold' but it doesn't - it looks very silver with a faint hue. Very fast start-ups - I press the power button from hibernation and by the time I moved my finger to the fingerprint, I'm up and running within 2 seconds. Fully recommend.

Title: MSI great for Photos
ReviewText: i am not a gamer, but my son advised a gaming laptop to handle the intense graphics from my photography. He was so right! I have been very happy with this computer and the speed with which it handled my pictures. Editing has become a pleasure again.

Title: Best Gaming Laptop I've Ever Had
ReviewText: Where do I begin? This beast of a gaming laptop from MSI is simply amazing. The screen is a full 1080p, the keyboard is soft, quiet, and perfect for typing as well as RGB'd, the touchpad is probably great, but I never use it as I much prefer mice, the cooling is fantastic, the sound is great, and I can tell that MSI put a lot of thought and consideration into designing this laptop. It includes a 256-gig solid-state boot drive and a terabyte HDD, which means more space and better reliability. The GTX 1060 graphics card makes it competitive, even against my old Dell Inspiron 7559, which only had a GTX 960M; and the i7-8750H processor is as fast as it is powerful. My old Dell had an i7-6700HQ, which sounds good, but only ran at a modest 2.4 GHz. According to MSI, whom I emailed to help confirm this, the i7-8750H idles at a low 2.2 GHz, but actually accelerates when gaming, making it easier to cool when not in-game, and giving you power and speed when you need it most. The i7-6700HQ does not, and thus, I experienced a lot of crashes in higher-end titles, most likely from that processor. Considering it was from Dell and not an overpriced behemoth from their Alienware lineup, my old Inspiron was good, but my MSI is downright outstanding. I simply cannot recommend this laptop (or one similar) enough - between your processor, graphics card, and 16 gigs of RAM, you're practically unstoppable.

Title: Great laptop, a little hot
ReviewText: First of all the performance of this laptop is EXCELLENT. The only downside as with almost all laptops, even ones designed for gaming is over-heating. Under-Heavy load it will be running in turbo mode (loud) and performance will be throttled. A cooling pad greatly helps this.

Title: Completely Defective device
ReviewText: I purchase this computer and kept it in it's package a couple of months. When I opened the package, the return warranty had already expired. I could not believe how these people could sell a useless and defective computer in such bad conditions. Almost every part of the computer had to be replaced, including screen, keyboard, mouse, processor, video car and several other issues in order for it to work. Till this date my audio keep going and coming as this was also an issue that apparently failed again. I had send the computer back to MSI 4 different times in order to get it to work properly because I could not return it back. In conclusion; never buy a pc on amazon because you never what your going to get. Apparently this was a defective refurbished computer sold as new. It's just to risky!

Title: Great Hardware.  Windows 10....meh
ReviewText: Out of the box the X1 Carbon is an impressive machine. Very light weight and aesthetically pleasing. The keyboard is a pleasure to use and the touchpad is much better than other PCs I've recently used. The model I have has the standard 1920 x 1080 display which is fine for an ultraportable. Should you desire something comparable to a Mac Retina display, I recommend upgrading to the Lenovo hi-res HDR display. For typical business use - email, MS Office, web browsing, video conferencing, etc., the Intel 8th Gen i5 processor, 256GB SSD and 8GB RAM configuration is fine. The X1 also has a good array of ports including USB A-type, USB-C/Thunderbolt, and HDMI. After a few days of use, battery life is impressive -- probably 10 hours with web browsing, Office, and email usage. The only knock I'd give it in terms of hardware is the lid has a lot of flex to it, but I suppose this is to be expected since it's not aluminum. The other negative is not the fault of the hardware, but rather Windows 10. Setup was tedious. After going through multiple rounds of updates taking a couple of hours, I had to do a full reset and start over because the Start Menu would not save any changes. I would delete the Windows Games and other bloatware I don't need only to have it reappear. I am not set up on a domain where a Group Policy is doing this, so I decided to reset and that solved the problem. I also had to do a BIOS update and some Lenovo-dictated driver updates. After three days of use, all has been good. Within this price range, I have recently used a Microsoft Surface Laptop and a new Dell XPS 13 and prefer this Lenovo to either of those.

After spending so much money on this product and within 5min of using it, it is no good. I keep getting this stupid message ever time the laptop reboot its self over and over again with me touching anything. Iâ€™m going back to MAC.

Title: Great Chromebook!!
ReviewText: We bought this laptop several months ago for teaching online classes and we couldn't ask for a better machine for the price. We are very impressed with the overall speed and function. It has a touchscreen which we have ended up using much more than we anticipated. It feels sleek and smooth and looks nice as well. We use it for a few hours a day and only have to charge it every couple of days. My only issue is the camera quality. Its not bad, but because we use it daily for work it is noticeably inferior to a more quality laptop computer (which was expected for the price). I would absolutely buy this computer again as it meets all of our needs.

Title: Good value Chromebook for Productivity
ReviewText: Been using a HP 14-Q007TU since 2014 and it has served me very well. Unfortunately, the keyboard is no longer reliable. Otherwise the Chromebook works just fine. If I attached a keyboard, it will work. But that's a pain. It did not have touchscreen or Google Play Apps. Have been looking for a replacement. The HP 14-ca061dx caught my attention. It ticked the boxes for touchscreen and includes ability to install Google Play Apps. Personally prefer the 14" units since it makes it easier to work. Found the 11" units a little fiddly. Hopeful that it will be better than the 14-Q007TU.

Title: Good inexpensive Chromebook
ReviewText: This is the second one I purchased and both were for retired older ladies to use for email and surfing the internet. Both women seem to like the Chromebooks and found them easy to use. So far we've found the battery life to be pretty good. Plus I wanted to point out a couple things that people seem to get wrong in the Q&A section and review section. THIS IS A NEW CHROMEBOOK, it isn't refurbished. THIS IS A TOUCHSCREEN CHROMEBOOK, yes I tested it and the touchscreen works every time I've tried it. The only downside I would point out is that the screen is a bit on the weak side, it has a limited viewing angle, have to be right in front of it, off to the side a bit and it'll be hard to use or view. Only other thing to mention is if you want to hook it up to a monitor or TV you'll need to get a USB-C adapter like a USB-C to HDMI adapter or cord, it doesn't come with a video out port like HDMI.

Title: Came Defective Immediately
ReviewText: I was so excited for this new chromebook. I was excited about the app feature and I did a lot of research before I purchased. I thought, considering my needs and the price, this was exactly what I wanted. When it arrived I rushed home, ready to finally have an upgraded piece of technology, only for the screen to go black than white with a yellow caution sign telling me Chrome OS was defective or missing! Overall, extremely disappointed and I didn't want a replacement at the risk of this happening again so I returned it. Glad I did this through Amazon as their return policy is really forgiving and quick.

Title: Not a Touchscreen But it is Fast
ReviewText: The title says Touchscreen but it is not. I didn't buy it because it said touchscreen I just thought that would be a plus if it did so it is not a deal breaker. It is fast it uses 5g and has a 4k display.

Title: So far so good
ReviewText: I've had this computer for a month and am very impressed. It's light, has a great battery, and the chrome OS works better than expected. Speed is great so far, but I will see if holds up. I'd give it five stars except I've only had it for a month so am still holding by breathe with problems that sometimes bubble up with low cost computers

Title: This is the best Chromebook i Had ever bought !!!!!!!!!!
ReviewText: When i saw it wasn't going to buy it because i saw in the comments that is was not touchscreen but it is written touchscreen in the title so i said to my self it is cheap but what if it wasn't touchscreen so i just bought it and it turned that it is touchscreen! And if you are looking for a chromebook this is the best choice.

Title: Great Value BATTERY NEVER DIES
ReviewText: Great battery life, don't expect this to be top of the line, but the best bang for your buck by far. Stream hd, check email, browse the web (90 percent of the stuff I do) it's absolutely perfect. Ended up having to get more ram for web design but this is my personal laptop for hanging out at home. Great but for the price, literally runs for 13 hours without a charge.

Title: Top notch specs and design - minor letdowns but still a 5 star regardless!
ReviewText: Wow, what can I say... let me try to constrain my emotions and keep my ROG fan boy inside my pants for a moment and write an unbiased review to the best of my abilities.

Title: Great purchase, recommended.
ReviewText: RTX 2070 Max Q 15" inch version

Title: Powerful Laptop -- but a hinge broke after 1 month?
ReviewText: Powerful laptop. Runs everything I've thrown at it. Looks great. Lightweight. Very quiet when not under load. If you crank the fans up, expect to hear a jet engine nearby, though!

Title: HP Spectra laptop owners beware!
ReviewText: The company I purchased this from through Amazon has been great. The fault lies with HP themselves. One would think that when HP makes a laptop called Spectra (which I have) and they make a travel dock called Spectra (which I bought specifically because it was a Spectra) that stupid me, I thought they would be compatible. I had all kinds of problems and finally called HP customer service and found an absolutely wonderful woman in India named Nikita who called me back several times over the next week or so, only to find out that the Spectra dock is NOT compatible with the Spectra laptop. She had gone through their in house information and found that they have nothing to do with one another and do not work with each other. Whoever put that name on it should lose their job!! I emailed the seller and they took it back quickly, no further questions asked. However, it caused other problems with my laptop which took a little while to sort out. Do not buy this product if you have a Spectra laptop.

Title: Works on HP Spectre Folio
ReviewText: This is a preliminary review since I just got the dock a couple of days ago, but it works fine with the Spectre Folio. I have used the HDMI port, the VGA port, the ethernet port, and a USB A port(with a wired mouse). Those all worked without any fuss. The VGA picture, on an old LCD TV, is in a 4:3 aspect ratio, so some farther adjustment is needed. The ethernet internet speed was somewhat slower than my wi-fi internet connection, which surprised me, but the whole internet connectivity thing is quite variable here anyway.

Title: Basic Dock that does it all.
ReviewText: This works fantastically with my new HP Spectre 13t. Network plug over wifi is noticeable. Thunderbolt 3 pass-through takes care of charging, so only 1 cable goes to notebook. Also a spot for wireless mouse link. This is compact and lightweight for easy packing.

Title: Great!!
ReviewText: Works great! Exactly what I needed.

Title: Worthless
ReviewText: I tried using this with my HP Spectre x360 laptop. It is practically useless. Video flickers, mic audio keeps disappearing, network drops. I updated the dock's firmware to no avail. HP support is useless. I had to throw it away and get one from Pluagable. Works really well.

Title: Great quality.
ReviewText: Great quality. Highly recommended.

Title: Burned Up and Quit Working on First Day - REFURBISHED?
ReviewText: Plugged this in and it got SUPER HOT then quit working.

Title: Easy setup
ReviewText: Great product! Easy to setup with exact number of connection to setup keyboard, mouse, ethernet, on monitor.

Title: Monster performance, damsel looks
ReviewText: First of all I've been using a Desktop for the last 2 years so when I decided to buy I laptop I didn't want a downgrade on performance. Normally I would make a build of a computer with the price that a laptop would cost to balance out how each component measured. The build I did was as expensive as the laptop and the big difference was the processor which was overclock-able. This is by far of the best if not the best ratio of a laptop against a desktop. Needless to say I've loved this laptop, the benchmarks are great and the jump from a 60hz monitor to a 144hz one is massive.

Title: ASUS Knocked this one out of the park!!
ReviewText: Let me start off by saying I've played competitive PC games for over 15 years. I have a custom built desktop at home but decided i wanted to somehow bring my gaming with me when I'm traveling. This laptop checked off every box for me. I wanted a laptop that would give me the best competitive edge compared to the rest, but i didn't want something that weighed 10+ LBs. I also didn't want too much of the gamer look as well. This laptop is truly stunning on the outside and in. The build quality is exceptional for how thin it is. I also appreciate the ventilation and cooling system. ROG Game Center lets your customize the fan speed and accommodate how you are using the laptop. I was playing PubG over 100 FPS, Overwatch 250+ and WoW 100+. I can't stress enough how Asus knocked this one out of the park! 6.5 LBs i believe of pure gamer fury. 144hz display with a 3ms response time is phenomenal! Most gaming laptops last year were 120hz 3ms with 1070 Max-Q GPUS (under clocked for better battery). This is a full 1070, with a 6 core i7, expandable memory and tons of storage! I am extremely happy with my purchase and will update if i run into any cons..

Title: Finally, Asus Nails it!!! :)
ReviewText: A+ Asus.

Title: Runs great and is everything I hoped it would be
ReviewText: Runs great and is everything I hoped it would be. Exceeds my expectations and is very quiet. Doesn't over heat and runs everything at max settings. Its very thin and it really is a bad ass machine.

Title: This computer is hands down the best laptop I've ever used
ReviewText: This computer is hands down the best laptop I've ever used. The display is very color accurate and pretty, but it's mind-blowing fast. Gaming with refresh rates this high not only gives an advantage, but I've found it to be easier on the eyes for long gaming sessions. The 1070 Max-Q GPU is extremely stout for a laptop. It does run warm whenever under a lot of load (75 C), but I'm yet to see it throttle. When it does get warm though the fans go into overboost and cool it back down quickly. They are audible very slightly in balanced mode, a bit noisy in overboost, but extremely quiet in silent. The computer runs fast, quiet, and very smooth. The only upgrade I see myself purchasing is an extra 16 gb stick of ram to supplement the current one. I have only one "complaint" with this whole computer. I knew this going into it, but any PC with components like these and a display with G-Sync battery life is gonna be bad, but be ready to keep the charger nearby. I get close to 3 hours with the brightness at 50% and no audio. That's just being on the web and streaming netflix through a wireless headset. Gaming is closer to the 2 hour mark. Aside from this though, I don't believe there's a better gaming laptop out there under $2,000 dollars.

Title: Performance sacrifice for pricepoint.
ReviewText: The specifications of the device are definitely why this device captured my attention over competitors in this class of gaming device.

Title: Good work laptop so far
ReviewText: My laptop is not for gaming, its for Adobe CC suite and light video editing so I went with the i5-8300H/1050Ti combo. So far I like the laptop especially for the price I paid but its not perfect. I upgraded within 3 days to 16GB RAM and a larger faster M2 drive. Here is my general review:

Title: Great for 3d content creation.
ReviewText: So far it has been an awesome laptop. I use it for 3d work and it flies with the new processors. The 1050, although no the best card, can run substance painter very well with 2k textures, but if you want to work directly with 4k textures it will slow down.

Title: Asus is slacking on quality assurance
ReviewText: I'll start with the bad and the annoying stuff first:

Title: Definitely a good laptop... if you can afford it
ReviewText: This review will largely compare the new model against the previous model of the Zephyrus, as I haven't had much time to acquaint myself with the newer version. I'll update this review if I encounter anything worth mentioning while getting used to the new model. I know that it's a bit of "appeal to authority", but my credentials in writing this review are that I work professionally as a software developer and have a degree in Computer Engineering (just so you know I'm not talking nonsense).

Title: It's a hot unstable mess
ReviewText: The laptop looks great, but I don't have anything else good to say about it. It is thermal throttling 100% of the time, as much as 30%. I can't even browse the internet and enjoy a stable system. Fans will randomly turn into jet engines when doing nothing to tax the CPU or GPU. During gaming CPU temps average 96C and GPU temps hover around 85C. I've never seen such an aggressive thermal throttle where framerate in a game can be 125FPS one second and then 10FPS. It is apparent that the cooling solution is inadequate and they have released multiple BIOS revisions that make the thermal throttling even more aggressive to compensate for it. Contacted Asus support and they wanted a lengthy RMA process. I'm returning the laptop for a refund.

Title: Absolutely terrible audio system, returning.
ReviewText: The laptop seemed fine at first and I loved it, but then the Audio issues just wouldn't stop, casuing me to update this review.

Title: Audio problems
ReviewText: Had issues with the machine not charging. Sent it to Asus for repairs. They changed the motherboard. After receiving it back, the audio went out. Reinstalled drivers with Asus technical support and sound would still come and go. Bought another one, exact same , and had the same audio problems. The 2nd laptop sounded like the speakers were shot. Sound would also come and go. I chatted with Asus tech support and the final verdict was to send the laptop in for repairs. I just returned for refund . I wouldnâ€™t recommend .

Title: Incredible thin-n-light gaming laptop with outstanding cooling
ReviewText: This is a powerful gaming laptop that is thin and light, and can also keep good low temps while gaming. It scores 14150 on the 3DMark Firestrike test. This compares well to the ASUS G701VI full sized gaming laptop 16593. The only issue I have had, and the reason for the 4 star review is coil noise. If you listen closely, you hear high pitched beeping like a radio operator transmitting morse code. When gaming you cannot hear it, but in a quiet room, it stands out.

Title: Great Chromebook, One Major Design Flaw
ReviewText: Great machine. Battery lasts incredibly long. Easily stays on sleep mode for hours without losing a single percent on the battery life, and wakes up from sleep in 2 seconds flat, which makes this an incredibly handy device.

Title: This is my first lap top/chrome book and I love it.
ReviewText: Nice computer at a very reasonable price. The battery life is good. Screen size is perfect but the resolution is average. Battery life is excellent. My main criticism is the power cord outlet. Due to some carelessness, I have had to replace the power cord twice already because the stem broke off. I wish this had a two-prong adapter which would be more stable and no so easily snapped. Otherwise I would give this 5 stars.

Title: SHE IS VERY HAPPY WITH ALL THE EXTRAS
ReviewText: BOUGHT THIS FOR MY GRAND-DAUGHTER. IT IS LARGER THEN THE ONE SHE HAD FOR SCHOOL BUT THIS IS THE ONE THAT THEY USE IN SCHOOL. SHE IS VERY HAPPY WITH ALL THE EXTRAS . MORE RAM, ETC

Title: Unable to access Steam
ReviewText: Got off to a good start. Very nice looking laptop and easy to set up. Tried every which way to access my Steam library but couldnt do it. I wanted to use this Chromebook for gaming but the Chrome OS that it comes with doesnt run Steam and Steam doesnt have Chrome OS app. Also can not run Linux on this Chromebooks OS which further limits access to good apps.

Title: Great deal!
ReviewText: The Chrome book is extremely fast. I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ll be going back to buying a traditional laptop.

Title: Ok
ReviewText: Oh for back up

Title: Great price-photo logging not available and cant set up Picasa Photo viewer or CCleaner.
ReviewText: FAST little computer-but limited features.

Title: New Chromebook
ReviewText: So far so good I just opened it last night

Title: Has its flaws but with a little work is great!
ReviewText: Overall, the laptop is great. I ordered the one with the smaller hard drive as I already had plans on swapping existing SSD's into the unit that were larger and performed better. I was surprised to see a Samsung M.2 NVMe SSD in the unit that was a decent performer which I considered a bonus as I was expecting one of lesser quality. The laptop is gorgeous. The screen is beautiful and the blacks are amazing. Physically, this thing is great but slightly flimsy which was done to cut down on weight, so "I get it". On the lesser side of things, the drive partitioning was weird. I had a 256GB drive that had two separate partitions, a 133GB partition for C: (Windows OS) and an 88GB for D: (Data?). Odd to say the least. Also, when I booted into a live linux USB and fired up gparted to fix this, I noticed that there was a partition in between the two making it a little more challenging than simply deleting a partition and expanding the other. Now, I had to delete the "data" partition, move the offending "in-betweener" partition and then expand the Windows OS partition. Next was removing as much bloatware as possible. Windows 10 bloatware, MSI bloatware, you name it, it's on there. So essentially, it took the better part of a day to get the laptop "where I wanted it" which in my opinion is a little much. The BIOS. There are no options for memory speed settings or XMPP profiles. There are no temperature monitoring settings. Spartan to say the least. The laptop is advertised as supporting memory up to 2666mhz, yet when I installed 3200mhz ram, it did not "auto-detect" the new ram speed or 2666mhz, nor were there any settings in the bios to adjust the timings or speed. This must be addressed by MSI. There are two slots for m.2 SSD drives but the motherboard is flipped upside-down so one must remove the motherboard from the laptop in order to install/change the ram or the hard drive. The "Killer" wifi was horrible. I changed it out with an Intel 9260 and am much happier.

Title: One of The best.
ReviewText: As far as portable gaming laptops go this one takes the cake. Its simple, powerful, and portable. Everything a laptop should be. The one thing I didn't like was the limited storage the factory laptop gets. I got the gtx1070 with 256g of storage and that just wasn't a lot. I do understand that they have to cut corners somewhere to keep the price down but it would be nice to have a way to upgrade. Otherwise the laptop exceeds all expectations. No throttling and the fans aren't too noisy, plus the keys on the keyboard are very smooth. I really like the feel of the hardware. I don't like the speakers on the bottom but they are very loud and do a good job. The 144hz screen is phenomenal I think that is the big selling point for this laptop. Overall 4.5/5 stars.

Title: Rough Start So Far...
ReviewText: I ordered this laptop as I was looking to upgrade and this seemed to be one of a few obvious choices if you need something compact that packs a punch. This laptop had awesome reviews on and off Amazon so it appeared to be an easy choice. That and the price was just right so I jumped on it. So far my initial experience has not been very good as the following is what I experienced. I'm not sure if this is the manufacturers fault or Amazon mixing my order up and sending me a used laptop.

Title: Competitive Thin and Light Gaming Laptop
ReviewText: If you're looking for a laptop that can play any modern game yet still weigh and feel like a regular laptop, this is the one. The IPS screen has a little bit of backlight bleed from a particular section, but is only noticeable when the screen is displaying black. I had to re-paste the CPU with Thermal Grizzly Conductonaut to eliminate the CPU thermal throttling that always occurred during full CPU load. Speakers evidently lack bass or treble, but I'll be using my headphones or desktop speakers most of the time anyway.

Title: Absolutely the Best Laptop I've Owned to Date
ReviewText: I normally purchase Asus brand products but this Lenovo by far is the best laptop I have owned to date. This is perfect for a business or just a starter laptop. The speed is impeccable and the memory is to die for. I absolutely love all of the functionality and the price is amazing. This was definitely a smart purchase and I highly recommend the ThinkPad.

Title: too many malfunctions
ReviewText: Looks fine, works fine for the most part. Battery life is not good but I knew that before I bought it so no deduction there. There are other annoyances though:

Title: Super fast, great for Autocad and Revit
ReviewText: Bought for civil design with acad civil3d software. Have done some medium sized projects and I dont think the fan has kicked on once. And never has it gotten warm. This machine processes 3d and graphics like butter. Love it. Touch screen is awesome too. Get the dock.

Title: Great for Business
ReviewText: I love the product, a few criticisms. It is a bit dated. not for gaming for obvious reasons, The screen is not very bright. and the look feels a bit dated. the tracker in the keyboard would be so much better if you could change the acceleration and other aspects of it. It is a bit heftier than some of the other laptops we use but nothing horrible.

Title: Great computer
ReviewText: Great computer. Big screen, light weight, super fast running SPSS and GIS.

Title: Computer doesn't work; Fan System error; Warranty already activated before purchase
ReviewText: I just charged and turned on my device last night (October 13th) for the FIRST time , only to find it immediately displayed a black screen with "FAN ERROR" after displaying "Lenovo" and automatically shut off. I've tried starting the device several times and it gave the same problem each time. I'm extremely disappointed with this purchase as I feel I have received a defective product. Also, when inputting the serial number on Lenovo's official site, the warranty appeared to have been activated even before I purchased this device. Why is this so? Will be returning this product. This is the first and only time i will EVER trust making such a large purchase like a laptop on Amazon again !!

Title: Works great
ReviewText: This works really well for what I need it for. I just use it for standard office work. The touch screen works well with no issues. I do not play games or anything like that so I canâ€™t say if itâ€™s good for things like that but works great for me!

Title: Cant go wrong
ReviewText: Love it

Title: This is the backbone to my "Big Bertha" build
ReviewText: I wanted a unique looking case for my build I intended on going all out on. Since doing a custom cooling loop was on my list of wants I needed a case that would display it. This one provided that unique factor of having a rather different shape to from your standard case and as I like to describe it, Function meets Fashion. Not only is having the glass panels standing off on 4 posts unique looking it's also nice for venting the hardware rather than keeping it all boxed up with some fans blowing on it.

Title: Rugged & Beautiful case. So many customizable options. Why not build into a desk or table?
ReviewText: Â I'm absolutely in love with this case and for the low price it's a steal. Especially with the tempered glass. It's truly one of a kind and will display your goods in style.

ReviewText: I am an IT guy and love to build my own computers. It took me forever to figure out how to handle the PCI cards because they have 3 different configurations, one for ATX, mini-ATX, and some other one. Instructions were extremely poor. Looking online is no help.

Title: Nicest case I've ever owned
ReviewText: Pros:

Title: Build in camera faulty + weak return policy
ReviewText: This Lenovo's built-in camera does not consistently work. On this brand new laptop, within about 3 weeks of using it, the camera became faulty and doesn't consistently work - goes black, goes out completely, etc when using on video calls. Further this seller doesn't take returns after 30 days post-purchase, even when the laptop takes a week to even arrive. Do not recommend.

Title: Wonderful laptop
ReviewText: I bought this laptop for my graduate program and I absolutely love it! The battery life is great, all of my programs load quickly, there have been no glitches, and it is lightweight yet durable. I love Lenovo products and this laptop exceeds all of my expectations

Title: Great laptop for the price
ReviewText: Easy to order. Received laptop as expected.

Title: Excellent
ReviewText: Excellent

Title: Dual vs Triple Monitors - USB-C DisplayPort
ReviewText: I bought this product for my work laptop (Dell 5285), my regular ASUS laptop, and for my MSI Gaming laptop. This product works great if you install all the drivers---the exception of Dell 5285. Ok.....I just don't want to babble any longer. Here is the summary:

Title: Dell is incapable of customer service
ReviewText: Ordered this product for my brand new Dell computer. Was having very strange computer problem, where my keyboard would jumble letter and my bluetooth randomly be completely missing from my computer (not turned off, but gone). My IT Dept and Dell could not figure it out. They kept resetting drivers. Suddenly it stopped having these problems (yay). However in July I headed back into the office for a day to work and BAM all screwed up again?!? Got everything reset and cooking along. Go into the office in August, it starts happening again. I then realize... it is the DOCKING STATION. Seems easy. I spend an entire afternoon being transferred between departments at Dell because for some reason my docking station doesn't have an ID tag. They can't do ANYTHING without this. "I must HAVE removed".... umm no I didn't. Finally after about 2 hours of being hung up on and transfer some guy seems to be able to help. I am on the phone with him another hour and he has me email him pics of my Amazon invoice, pics of the docking station. No problem, they'll get it out. The next day my case is "closed" and I am told by email to call again and they will restart this. Then they can't get me routed to the correct place again. This has now went on for 30 days of being promised it was handled to have it closed and have different person tell me to call to start a new case. I have asked for them to start a case based on the history of emails I have, as I do not have another 1/2 a day to have them transfer me around, sit on hold, and be hung up on. On top of that I have told them, at this point I want a paper trail because I have been lied to on the phone. I work (which is why I need a docking station) and can't spend 2-3 on hold. I realize I probably got the one lemon out of 1000 but seriously I can not think of a worse customer service experience than this. The docking station is useless and it causing electrically problems with the computer, Hence one star...

Title: Docking Station
ReviewText: I telework some days and I needed to have two large monitors to connect to my laptop... I had an 17" monitor and bought another one so I needed a docking station. IT guru at work recommended this particular docking station because it's compatible with our (work) Dell laptop. It works just fine, I'd recommended it if you're in the same situation.

Title: Great for working at home
ReviewText: I bought this so I could work at home more easily since this is what my company uses in their offices. It's great for multiple monitor usage and also gives an extra three USB ports.

Title: Finally, a dock that works
ReviewText: I've tried 3 other docks that would not work on my Dell all-in-one. This one worked perfectly with no need to install drivers. I connected two 27" 4K monitors. One with HDMI & one with Display Port. Easy peezy.

Title: 2 months no problems
ReviewText: Iâ€™ve had this for2 months and have not had any issues. Iâ€™m able to use the USB ports for my wireless keyboard and my USB printer. Iâ€™m only using the 1 hdmi port cause I donâ€™t have Display type cables.

Title: Did the job very well
ReviewText: I used this product for about a year before I needed to buy a different docking base because I purchased a 2nd monitor. It worked fine and I had no complaints regarding its performance.

Title: It fine.
ReviewText: Used it for work

Title: Nothing to get excited about
ReviewText: I have owned it for two months. My first impression is that it was small and slippery. The buttons are noisy when clicked. The middle button works too easily, especially when I do not want it to sending my page careening up or down. The wheel has a clumsy feel probably aggravated by the middle-button click problem. It does not hold a charge for weeks at a time like they suggest. I can get a week or ten days out of it. Despite the advertised 1,600 dpi resolution there is no way to take advantage of this under Windows 10 because there are no settings for this under Windows 10 and no additional drivers or support software comes with it. Windows 10 treats this just like an ordinary mouse. You know, it is okay but I wouldn't go out of my way to buy one at a premium price. They only thing it has going for it is the cordless operation and quick rechargeability but beyond this, those two letters "HP" are an unnecessary extra expense.

Title: Great for arthritis & everyday use
ReviewText: I am a student and had to purchase a new laptop. I purchased this mouse because it is supposed to work well with the HP Envy 13t and it does. I have arthritis in both my hands and this mouse fits perfectly and does not place strain on my hand when I use it nor does it make my arthritis act up when using it for long periods of time. It may be a little pricey due to the HP name, yet for me, it was worth it. For my new laptop, I purchased the added gold coloring and this mouse matches the color of the laptop.

Title: Not good for gamming
ReviewText: Not really responsive enough for gaming. Even just swirling the pointer around my desktop for a while and it skips and hesitates. Tried switching to a mouse pad but didn't help. Other than that it's OK and holds a charge long, but I'd rather have something that has precision I can depend on.

Title: Buyer beware!
ReviewText: This product is unusable, because it arrived without the USB transceiver. And...before anyone tries to say it's inside....I know the transceiver is supposed to be located in the compartment on top to the mouse. It is NOT there. The compartment is empty. And, unfortunately for me, the box was opened by my 9-year old daughter who destroyed the packaging, so I can't return it. Before you throw away the packaging, make sure all the components are there, so you can return it if parts are missing.

Title: Compliments My HP Spectre
ReviewText: This mouse compliments the HP Spectre. Very easy to set up and use. Company provides excellent customer service. Would definitely recommend buying from this company and the product.

Title: No battery replacement!

Title: Love it

Title: HP and Windows 10 Suck

After he finished I ran PC magic again, found a virus and removed it. Given my experiences, I would buy another brand even if it cost more. HP and Windows 10 not worth the trouble and frustration.

ReviewText: Great machine at a lower price than anybody else. Highly recommended

Title: Great Computer IF YOU ADD A WIRED MOUSE!!!
ReviewText: I've had this computer and I feel I can now rate it fairly. My biggest complaint WAS the touch pad. I causes the machine to bring up various drop down screens constantly. This resulted in constant errors which required the user to stop and close the menu before you could proceed. I add a wired USB mouse and cured the problem immediately.

Title: Very fast great picture
ReviewText: I am very happy with this computer so far. It is much faster than my old one and with better graphics. I'm not going to say a lot of great stuff because I don't want to jinx myselfâ˜º. The only issues I have had so far is solfware related and not hardware. I am working through setting up a new system only because my last one lasted since 2011 and felt like an old pair of shoes. It just fit perfectly. Unfortunately it started have small failures like the wifi quit working and I got an external one the blue tooth quick working and I found a workaround. I figured sooner or later it was going to die so here I am. So far I am thrilled with this device and very soon it will be as comfortable as the old one.

Title: HP and Windows 10 Suck
ReviewText: HP telephone support is bad news. No more HP Products for me. One HP support Rep tried to get me to buy virus protection software, I said no. He had been tuning my software, remotely and left a virus on my laptop. The reason I know that is I had run PC magic before I let him on my computer and everything was clean. After he finished I ran PC magic again, found a virus and removed it. Given my experiences, I would buy another brand even if it cost more. HP and Windows 10 not worth the trouble and frustration.

Title: Amazing Computer So Far!
ReviewText: This computer is awesome so far (2 weeks old), great price for such a big, thin laptop with Touch screen. I love it!

Title: Powerhouse laptop
ReviewText: I use my laptop for web work and graphics design. This Envy has no trouble keeping up. The SSD is awesome and the laptop is great for everyday use. A great replacement for a desktop!

Title: Good Laptrop at Resonable Price
ReviewText: So far so good. Have not had any issues with the laptop. I use it for presentations.

Title: Great laptop for business
ReviewText: Lenovo makes a great laptop and thinkpads are the best, this one being an entry model I was quite impressed by the price and features.

Title: Que los que vende este vendedor no sirve
ReviewText: No funciona no la compre me DurÃ³n un aÃ±o inicio con problemas tiene un programa de Lenovo muy, lamento que Amazon Apollo este vendedor llamado soft network.inc estaremos asiendo el movimiento todos oscuro para Amazon y este vendedor de Amazon

Title: Great image, but buy the right USB-C cables
ReviewText: I got a pair of these for my home office. I do quite a bit of engineering and graphical design, so I needed real-estate, a sharp image, and good color reproduction, and these monitors fit the bill perfectly. The bezel is narrow, so I can place these side by side without an ugly black bar down the middle. The monitors are large, so I angled them in slightly for a more natural viewing angle.

Title: HP over engineers it again but threw in old parts from their parts bin.  This is a pas
ReviewText: Pixels and color fantastic. Screen brilliance truly outstanding. Once it is functioning there are few better monitors, well actually there are better monitors, and at better price points. I have (had before I returned it) it working with a 2019 Apple Mac Mini, only after a cable matching problem. HP did with this monitor what it does a lot: it punishes consumers for not buying all HP, it does it by engineering technical and compatibility issues into its monitors (this is a poster child for this sort of consumer relations). The screen quality is excellent, but the user interface is from 5 years ago, as are most of the few and mostly out of date and useless inputs. As to inputs, they arrive inactive and stay that way unless and until you call HP product support to find out how to make them active. "C" port, it has one, but it is inactive. In fact after using the monitor and understanding how HP is engineering old parts bin parts onto a slightly above average screen I felt like a HP victim, not a customer. That was confirmed by the lack of phone support and the below average AI screens the poorly trained telephone support has when you call for help. All in all it was my mistake..again.... for trusting HP to be anything other than HP...Hopeless and Problematical. Save your money and keep looking there are better monitors out there in this price range and you can let others struggle with HP and it's average (with this monitor below average) engineering and lack of support.

Title: Excellent panel, suspect quality control, slightly wobbly stand
ReviewText: I was looking for a replacement for my aging Dell 27" monitor, and this fit the bill based on The Wirecutter's review of it. I'd read reviews here mentioning bad pixels, and sure enough, the first one of these I received had a stuck pixel right in the middle area of the screen. I returned it and the second one is perfect, so I'm happy with that, but it's unfortunate HP's quality control is so bad this happens to some buyers. I don't understand how a panel can be colour-calibrated at the factory, but the same process doesn't also catch panels with dead pixels.

Title: absolutely beautiful monitor
ReviewText: That other reviewer must have some other problem because the z27n is stunning. I've purchased around a dozen of them and they are all flawless. Colors are great. Brightness is great. Bezel is tiny. Well worth the money.

Title: Best Monitor I Have Ever Used
ReviewText: Of course, this picture just doesn't do it justice; but I had to post it. I have owned many monitors since the mid-1980s, as well as using countless monitors at work. This is, by far, the BEST monitor I have ever used, especially for what I paid for it. Calibrated at the factory by HP (I use the Neutral Color setting - Looks very natural), plenty of connectors, including the newer USB-C, and it'll be my monitor for many years to come. The 27" screen is perfect for my needs, and many times I will work with 2 or even 3 windows open, which makes for an awesome working experience. Everyone seems to get hyped up about 4K screens, which cost a lot more, and I guess they have a place, in some circumstances; but 1440p is plenty for most folks' needs. Keep in mind that the higher the screen resolution, the smaller everything gets on a desktop - I have no issues with 27" & 1440p, but I know some folks who actually liked the "standard" 1080p better; it was more of a size thing for fonts, icons & such than any type of screen quality.

Title: Workhorse and fast but slow Ethernet card
ReviewText: This machine is a powerhouse for the money, but for some reason Dell is selling machines with 10/100mbs Ethernet cards (rather than a better/faster 1000/gigabit ability - this created an issue with communicating with our server). We were able to bypass this issue by using a USB3 to ethernet converter which allowed us to get 1000mbs ethernet communication speed...but this forces us to lose a USB port. If you are running wireless this is probably not an issue.

Title: Value for money
ReviewText: Value for money

Title: DON'T BUY
ReviewText: Had it for 14 months. Then it stopped booting. Seems the morher board is bad and can't be fixed. Tried to contact Dell to see what they can do but tgat was a big waste of time. WILL NEVER BUY A DELL AGAIN.

Title: Beast of a Machine
ReviewText: Great value for the money, vendor and amazon quick to answers delivery questions.

Title: Fabulous computer
ReviewText: This computer is amazing. Firstly, it is GORGEOUS! It is ripping fast, easy to manage, and I love the full keyboard. I do a lot of work on my computer and have multiple files open at a time. The screen is big but clear and lovely. I can easily have two files open at a time and see clearly. I have had no problems downloading all of my software packages, and there is plenty of room to keep all my files. I am very happy with this laptop.

Title: Great machine

Title: Powerhouse laptop
ReviewText: I use my laptop for web work and graphics design. This Envy has no trouble keeping up. The SSD is awesome and the laptop is great for everyday use. A great replacement for a desktop!

Title: Great quality, sharp and color is perfect
ReviewText: Attractive, with sturdy base. Rimless is very elegant. The quality of picture is outstanding. Sharp and true to life colors. Easy set-up. Relatively light weight. At the price you really cannot go wrong. Would buy again and again.

Title: Very nice monitor
ReviewText: Replaced another monitor with poor picture quality due to 1000:1 contrast ratio. This one has a great picture and it's easy on the eyes.

Title: The buttons are on the back, otherwise I love it
ReviewText: I have an older version of this monitor and wanted to add a second monitor with a stand but I wanted them to match. The outside dimensions and looks are almost identical to the old one but the buttons are on the back on this one. I originally had it on the left to replace my Samsung monitor but had to move this one to the right in order to have access to the power button. I would not be happy if I bought two of these for my stand and have to reach over or under to use any of the buttons. The picture quality is awesome though and better than my older one, so I am happy for the most part. If this will be a stand alone monitor for you I would definitely recommend it!

Title: box had another person's address on it
ReviewText: This was supposed to be a new item but was a returned product. buyer beware.

Title: Didn't know you could still get one this good! Highly recommended!
ReviewText: Bought one of these and couldn't believe how much less eyestrain, so we turned around and bought a second one for another computer. The picture is almost as nice as our primo Panasonic plasma TV. We highly recommend this! (We do not watch TV or play "serious" games, but we ARE heavy users of three computers in our home.)

Title: Great monitor for the price
ReviewText: So glad I bought this monitor. I bought a new computer...and was having to take a new course for a new job and decided I owed it to myself to invest in a newer, larger monitor. It was a great purchase.

Title: Great monitor
ReviewText: I use this as a second monitor for work and I love it, the size is perfect and the colors are great

Title: Good quality
ReviewText: The monitor is nice. It is for basic web surfing and it does the trick well. The package was a little beat up but the monitor sustained no damage.

Title: VERY HAPPY with this purchase!! ðŸ’¯
ReviewText: I purchased 2 of these plus another under a different name for my business. We absolutely love them. The speed is incredible. We also use many apps and windows open at one time during the day and this laptop has handled all of this with ease. It is such a blessing to have over 10 Outlook acccounts operating with the aforementioned, several screens and all running smoothly. Happy so far!! Should mention how far the technology has come in the ease in setting up a new laptop- so easy, yet a lot to learn at the same time with touchscreen and using as a tablet. However, the directions are accessible so it is so easy to search and find answers. The screen clarity gorgeous is and sound with bang and olufsen is like being in my car!

Title: Fast, robust laptop good for economist work with Stata, with minor annoying quirks.
ReviewText: So I've been using this laptop for about 2 months now. So far no regrets. Shipping was fast (arrived one day earlier), so everything good on that front. Haven't needed any customer help so I can't judge that.

Title: This labtop is nice. the touchscreen is sweet
ReviewText: The only bad thing is a little heavy. the performance works for me. great home computer.

Title: Bad customer service
ReviewText: Love the laptop but don't count on any help from Michael Electronics. I'm having trouble writing Audio CDs, probably a missing codec, and have tried contacting customer service several times without any response. So the laptop is good but you might want to buy from another supplier.

Title: Much better than I could imagine.
ReviewText: This is what we could name as a perfect product to produce and edit videos, working as a pro paying much, much less than an equivalent Apple. It does support dual Wi-Fi frequencies, using at high-speed all the potential of the Fiber channel service that I have at home without any cable. Be prepared to purchase a bigger backpack or equivalent case. I buy one here at Amazon but I feel worth to go a Best Buy or equivalent store and find a better product due time restrictions in U.S. (the one purchase here has a ocassional problem, the laptop zipper container stucks at the fabric sometimes). I have payed something like 2x more for the Wenger 17' inch backpack at BB but you could find at a good price here at Amazon (Wenger Ibex Laptop Backpack).

Title: fast machine when configured properly; 2 little peeves
ReviewText: Configured w/ i7-8550U, 32GB RAM, 512GB SSD + 1TB HD, Win10 Pro 64bit, pen and touch support. Very fast, multiple windows open simultaneously, spreadsheets are a breeze, great video. Two minor peeves: 1. NumLock key doesn't have a light to indicate it is on/off (does make a different sound for "on" vs "off", as does the CapsLock key -- but CapsLock key also has a light), 2. No dedicated right- and left-click keys under touch pad; rather -- the touchpad right-bottom-corner is your Right-click. These are minor peeves. Overall, a superb machine.

Title: Amazing machine
ReviewText: WOW I am used to an i3 this thing is a beast. bought it for a digital audio workstation and it is excellent. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who needs the horsepower. I have really enjoyed the machine it is much better than I expected and half the money of the alternative.

Title: Do you need to run Hyper-v! YES!
ReviewText: Running a Hyper-v virtual lab on this monster. Couldn't find a hard drive caddy for the DVD bay that was exactly for this model, probably to new, so I found one that was close, took the bezel of the DVD and added another 2t ssd. MUHAHAHAHA!

Title: Not backlit keyboard
ReviewText: Misleading product. If you look at some of the pictures, it makes you believe that there is a backlit keyboard. This is not the case. The button you'd press for backlit is just empty on mine. It says on title that it is 128gb ssd, which is correct, but then images show 1tb hdd. These pictures are not of the same product, so it definitely should be changed.

Title: Power button stinks!
ReviewText: Ahhh man, I think I goofed with this product. I absolutely loved this laptop for the short time that I had it. I just wish the power button wasnâ€™t the way it was. Itâ€™s like this tiny little pointed rectangle on the side and is even hard to press sometimes. Whatâ€™s worse is it broke on me! Now I canâ€™t turn the laptop on. This happened months ago and now the laptop is just sitting there, but now after getting a new laptop I wish I could use this one sometimes. I was walking into a narrow doorway and the side of the laptop seemingly barely GRAZED the side of the wall and that was all it took for the power button to be almost completely dented inside the laptop. Iâ€™ve reached out to HP but they charge way too much for what should be a simple repair. Besides this, the laptop WAS incredible, and this is coming from someone engulfed in the Apple Eco System.

Title: Stopped working after 5 days of use.
ReviewText: I have not even had the laptop for a week and the power button is not working. It won't turn on and the charger light is on so I know the battery should be in working order. I'm so bummed. I didn't think I had to save to the external hard drive before I put it on the computer. Now I lose everything. Good thing it was just a week.

Title: I have had this computer since Dec. 27, ...
ReviewText: I have had this computer since Dec. 27, 2017. After less than 2 months I notified Amazon of many issues. The seller now says I've past the return date of Jan. 31, 2018, I've never hear of a 30 day on this type of purchase. Now I will have to return it to the seller for the to fix it. There are multiple issues not to mention freezing, not turning off, over heating and Windows defender not defending. The original issue was updates failed.

Title: This would of been a great laptop but the power button stopped working
ReviewText: This would of been a great laptop but the power button stopped working. I loved every aspect of this laptop but the second day we had it I could not get it to power on after a shutdown without a lot of effort. I had to hold down the power button multiple times for like 20 seconds and then unplug the laptop. After doing this dance a 3 - 5 times the laptop would boot. Sometimes it would boot into a black screen with a CMOS checksum error. So I open a ticket with HP and spent hours reloading win 10, patching and reloading the BIos, which did not work. So I am returning it today since I did notice someone else with the same problem on Amazon and searching the internet it seemed like this is common.

Title: The laptop's hardware is all right however the new one ...
ReviewText: The laptop's hardware is all right however the new one I received was suffering from a lot of black light bleeding. In the end, I returned it and went with the Lenovo Flex 5

Title: Power button issues, like everyone else...
ReviewText: The power button is a POS. If you have your power chord plugged in, it takes honestly 15 to 20 attempts to turn it on. If its unplugged its usually only once or twice. So irritated. Im now in the middle of my classes and cant afford to return it and wait.

Title: I love it. Could not be happier
ReviewText: Have had this for about 2 months now. I love it. Could not be happier. And the price was fantastic.

Title: Do you need to run Hyper-v! YES!
ReviewText: Running a Hyper-v virtual lab on this monster. Couldn't find a hard drive caddy for the DVD bay that was exactly for this model, probably to new, so I found one that was close, took the bezel of the DVD and added another 2t ssd. MUHAHAHAHA!

Title: Storage Surprise
ReviewText: Nice laptop at a great price. I've had it for a week so it's hard to comment on durability but I'm counting on my previous experiences with Dell to carry on. For some reason I ended up with a 1TB SSD instead of the advertised 500GB SSD, probably a total fluke but I'm happy to accept it. I mostly purchased because of the i7, 16GB RAM and SSD because they contribute to a machine's longevity the most. I wanted to try the touchscreen and tablet mode but not sure how practical they are. So far running Virtual Box and Fusion360 without a problem. Looking forward to a long life together.

Title: I'm Satisfied!
ReviewText: My old laptop is a Dell Inspiron 15 5000, and it worked well for years. I really loved it, so when it started malfunctioning I knew I had to get another later model if available. This is the most expensive laptop I ever purchased, with my previous one being around $550. If I were to compare the two, this one is noticeably more light weight. It's has a great design. Everything is smooth and thin. The sound quality is about the same honestly. The camera is much better, but do not expect quality like you would on a phone or an actual camera. The screen quality is definitely nice. I love how you can fold it and it looks like a tablet. I already ordered a case, screen protector, and keyboard cover, because I'm that type of person. lol. The touchscreen responds well and with a stylus pen this is pretty much like an oversized tablet! That's all I got from it so far. I literally just got it today after ordering it two days ago, but so far so good!

Title: Great laptop at an excellent price!
ReviewText: Bought this laptop for DJing purposes and I love it. The SSD boots the computer up very quick and moving from apps to websites to files is seamless. Touch screen works great and screen quality is very good. Love the i7 processor as well. Could not have asked for a better deal!

Title: Good machine.
ReviewText: Overall good. No problems. My other laptop is a dell xps 10gen 6 core 32g ram. So,my view may be skewed. Use it for my sons middle school / high school use. Screen is a little big to be easy to handle. Battery lasts about 3-4 hours depending on what you do of course.

Title: Thought it would last longer than 9 Months
ReviewText: Started having problems with the fan - Very Loud and runs hot even after cleaning the fan. Battery runs hot. Also, it freezes up now and then.... I should have stuck with Lenovo; lesson learned.

Title: Its ok
ReviewText: This laptop is wonderful. My only complaint is that it runs hot quickly which can be annoying and uncomfortable.

Title: Love this laptop
ReviewText: I use this for my online business. It converts to a tablet and is amazing

Title: Great quality
ReviewText: I use it for work. Great laptop fast international shipping

Title: Overheating
ReviewText: I used this laptop very lightly (no more than 6 hrs/week) for about 5-6 months before I began to get a System Fan (90b) error message on startup. I worked through all the solutions suggested by HP including cleaning vents (the device was immaculate and had been exceptionally well cared for - always enclosed in a sleeve when not in use), updating the Bios, etc. I could not get a response from the seller - the device was then out of their warranty period. I continued to use it as I was out of the country, and just did as little as possible to prevent damage from overheating. Last week I spent $187 on a repair service to confirm that the device is indeed overheating (not just a bogus error message), and that the fans look fine, nothing in the vents, no dust, just that the fans don't come on so no cooling. They tested some of the other components as well - but no solution. They suspect a bad motherboard. However I've ordered new fans on the off chance 2 perfect appearing fans went bad in 5-6 months of very light use. I really loved this laptop - it worked well for me and was so light and easy to use in my travels. I did install an app to monitor the temperature and hibernate when it overheats. But since it overheats quickly and goes into hibernation as soon as I start to do much of anything, that isn't a solution. I've had to switch back to my heavy ThinkPad. Just hoping the new fans (another $$$) will solve the problem.

Title: Very nice product.
ReviewText: I would have given this 5 stars, but it needs more USB ports.

Title: Over Heats
ReviewText: This computer's fan is ALWAYS running and it is very loud. I can't hear myself think. The noise is embarrassing when youre sitting in a relatively quiet space like in class or the library. After 5 minutes of being on it gets very hot. I often lay in bed with my computer in my lap. This laptop has burn my skin multiple times

Title: Perfect laptop for a business user!
ReviewText: I bought this laptop in June in BestBuy. Everything was well except the cracking speaker and HP support helped me with the replacement. Other than that, this laptop is almost perfect! There are some suggestions though.

Title: Disappointing
ReviewText: Love this for the keyboard, lightness and flexibility. Power port went bad after 9 months and it was a nightmare to have it repaired by HP. Unit was clearly under warranty as confirmed by search but once the unit arrived at HP no communication from them for several weeks. When I finally reached them they insisted I had to upload sales receipt, etc even though their OWN database clearly showed it under warranty. Was without unit for almost 2 months for that repair. Now 5 months later power port is going bad again and getting a fan error message. Nice machine if you don't mind giving it up for constant repairs. Not worth the cost.
