Title: Great for the price!
ReviewText: I dont know what's not to like for this price. Personally, I expected less.

Title: NOPE
ReviewText: The screen is awful and you can't change contrast in a way that balance's the brightness. If all you need is Internet/email then go for it. But any video or pictureven quality will be trash. Save your money.

Title: Really Good Laptop
ReviewText: Alot of laptop for the money. The best laptop deal on the market.

Title: Three Stars
ReviewText: Just ok. Doesnt seem to hold a charge. We have to use it plugged in.

Title: Good buy
ReviewText: Good laptop, it has good enough specs which allows for you to do multiple tasks on the computer without much sticking.

Title: Four Stars
ReviewText: As described!

Title: Waste of money
ReviewText: I bought this computer to use for school and it stopped powering on after 3 months of use. I bought a new battery thinking that might be the problem and it still wonâ€™t turn on. Complete waste of money.

Title: Junk
ReviewText: It a piece of junk touchscreen didnt last a month now it opens new screens all on its own

Title: great monitor for photo editing
ReviewText: I spent a little more than a month looking for a quality monitor at a reasonable price to use for photo editing in Lightroom. This is a great looking monitor and the image quality is very nice. Its a great monitor all around, so much so that I ended up buying a second matching monitor. I highly recommend this monitor. keep in mind if you buy 2, there was one HDMI and one VGA connection in the back, so i bought a HDMI to VGI cable for higher visual quality. One more thing to keep in mind is this does not have holes in the back for a vesa mount. However, I found a VESA Mount Adapter that allowed me to mount to a VESA mount.This set me back about another $60 but totally worth it.

Title: Itâ€™s wonderful!
ReviewText: I donâ€™t understand why people rated this monitor so low here. I opened it and set it up and it looks amazing when you connect it to a computer or console. I love how many settings it has for certain types of games and how easy it is to edit settings. Iâ€™m so satisfied with this product and would definitely recommend this to anyone who wanted a decently priced monitor that works and looks great. 10/10 â¤ï¸

Title: My eyeballs melted the first time I used it.
ReviewText: Connected quick, colors are great, I use it for gaming and have no complaints. I hope to buy another to replace my other monitor soon. The manufactureres box was a little beat up when it arrived but that was inconsequential since there was no damage to the product.

Title: Dell Comes through with another fine Product.
ReviewText: Received my New Dell Monitor 3 Days early. Set up was easy. Came with All the Cables. Startup was Clean and uneventful. Made a slight adjustment on the Contrast and Brightness.The Quality of the Display was outstanding. No Blurs, no Dead Pixs, and Controls were easy to find and operate.

Title: So not bad, weird thing is I had an invoice from ...
ReviewText: So not bad, weird thing is I had an invoice from best buy for another person within the Dell box. Thought it might have been an RMA but everything seems good. The monitor has a little light bleed on a black screen but other than that great for the price.

Title: Buyer Beware.
ReviewText: Starting displaying scan lines and distortion after 6 months. Thankfully still under 1 year warranty - buyer BEWARE.

Title: Finally got these hooked up after waiting to build my ...
ReviewText: Finally got these hooked up after waiting to build my new gaming rig... Found that 2 out of 3 have yellowing/browning on the left/right sides. The color fades after about an inch or so inward. I've tried different sources and different inputs on the monitor and all show the same browning effect.

Title: Perfect Second Monitor for Working at Home
ReviewText: This monitor was so simple to hook up. It came with the necessary cables. I did have to contact my IT guy to make it a separate screen from my laptop other than a duplicate but thatâ€™s because I am not tech savvy. I watched him do it when we shared screens though and it was a simple fix.

Title: Lightweight and Powerful 2-In-1 Windows Laptop With Terrible Touchpad
ReviewText: A 2.78 pounds, this is a very lightweight and powerful computer. The hinge is very sturdy, so you can use it in tent mode or fold it and use it as a tablet. It is somewhat heavier to use as a tablet and if you're going to use predominantly as a tablet, I would recommend using a detachable laptop rather than 2 in 1.

Title: HP is so confusing with their docking stations, with ...
ReviewText: HP is so confusing with their docking stations, with more than a half dozen with slight differences and SKUs. With that said, I found this one to work well and consistently with both 13" and 15" Spectre x360 models, providing dual monitors and charging (with third party PD docks HP puts up a warning every time on startup about using an HP certified charger - annoying). Probably only drawback is that both video out ports are DisplayPort and in general I've found HDMI a bit more stable and more likely available on different monitor models. Until HP drops this one and introduces yet another model, this will be our standard.

Title: Beware - Quality Problems
ReviewText: When it works right, this is a good unit. Very compact and convenient. Unfortunately, quality control seems to be poor. The first unit I received had a faulty DisplayPort port that caused vertical lines to appear down one side of my monitor. I ordered a replacement and got the same problem. I thought maybe there was another problem, but after two hours with HP installing various drivers and doing troubleshooting, they concluded the problem was a bad dock. So beware the quality problems. Fortunately Amazon is gold in dealing with these problems, so I was able to get a full refund on both units.

Title: Worked well but then stopped powering on.
ReviewText: I used it in my vacation home over Christmas for two weeks. Arrived at my house today and it no longer works. Will not power on. Tried everything I can think of.

Title: Otherwise it worked as a port replicator just fine. The HP 1040 g4 laptop required the travel ...
ReviewText: Works as listed. I misread the laptop I had needed a dock with more power to charge from. Otherwise it worked as a port replicator just fine. The HP 1040 g4 laptop required the travel charger added to it, but that's my error.

Title: Not what you would consider a standard docking station.
ReviewText: Does what it needs to do, has all the correct ports and connects to my two monitor system.

Title: The product does not work with samsung 4k uhd monitor
ReviewText: The product only has Display ports and no HDMI ports and did not work with the modern monitors

Title: Works as described, very handy to have
ReviewText: Bought this for my wife so she could charge her phone while at work works great she seems to love it

Title: Items seems used one
ReviewText: I have ordered this item as a new item and what I have received seems it is used and does not have original packing from the manufacture like the plastic bags covered with the new item.

Title: I loved the look and weight of it
ReviewText: I loved the look and weight of it. But unfortunately it is slow! I am using it for simple tasks like web surfing and digital drawing however, there is a delay 2-4 second with every touch. Very difficult to draw on it.

Title: Love it
ReviewText: I love this computer this is a good investment indeed

Title: No complaints
ReviewText: I got mine else where because, I wanted a gbyte ssd. I 've been a Mac guy, but gave my 2018, to my daughter because she's into photography. So, I cut a few corners on the replacement. My Mac was a 6 core, but I'm totally satisfied with this guy. I may upgrade to a 6 core processor down the line, but for now? I don't have the problem with the scroller/selector, I just tap the little screen, works fine for me. I actually prefer this to the Mac. I use a headphone/dac setup for sound, the sound came up specific to the sony dac, wonderful sound on it if your into the master level stuff, actually outshines the Mac, it replaces, and I paid almost a thou more for it.

Title: Exactly what I wanted, no more, no less
ReviewText: Note, this product is upgraded from HP by Michael Electronics. For me, this is the perfect desktop replacement. After market RAM addition by vendor make it super fast. Made for Windows 10 so reboots are quick. Vendor provides good response on questions.

Title: Poor Response from Seller and Battery Life is not great
ReviewText: I am an IT contractor, and really like the laptop. It would give it a 5 if not for the following: The Laptop overall is a great laptop. Very smooth, easy to use and very powerful. After just a few weeks of use I noticed that when I changed the battery over night to 100%, and I left the laptop off (not just closed) for say 36=48 hours before turning it on, the battery would less than 20%. Not happy about this, but the worse part was, I called and left 2 messages with the provider MichaelElectronics2 trying to see if there were reported issues with the laptop battery, I have never heard a single thing from them. Gave up trying. I did not contact Amazon, since I felt this is either an HP battery issue or issue that has no real answer. Would really have liked to at least get a call by from the supplier!

Title: I got the 32gb ram 2 tb and am beyond pleased with its performance
ReviewText: Such a clean, smooth computer. I got the 32gb ram 2 tb and am beyond pleased with its performance. I'm a graphic and web designer and this thing doesn't miss a beat with multiple programs running and a full browser. Highly recommend it to anyone.

Title: Hp keep rolling out products like this!!!
ReviewText: A beast of a laptop. No 'cons' here. Big awesome screen : great processor, graphics card, sound. I am not a gamer, use exclusively for photo/video editing and this machine excels!!!

Title: Very Proficient!
ReviewText: Visually awesome. Thin, sleek, metal finish for a modern, minimalist look. Quick, effiecient and room to expand (if necessary).

Title: Great performance
ReviewText: I installed Ubuntu 16.04 (dual boot) and the only issue I had was the WIFI; but I was able to make it work (there isn't an up-to-date driver for the laptop's wifi device; however as soon as there is an up to date version, everything will be 100% OK). Everything works as expected in Windows, didn't have any issues at all.

Title: Touchpad sucks, there's just no way around it.
ReviewText: I bought this to retire my old laptop, because the touchpad never worked right, and the BluRay drive went AWOL when Windows 10 committed it's breaking and entering offenses. Which makes the price tag of this thing a bitter pill to swallow, because the touchpad on it just flat out sucks. The "buttonless buttons" have to be somebody's idea of a cruel joke. Between that and the bizarre kickstand thing below/behind the screen, it just seems awkward. Bought it to work with the GoPro Hero 6's 4K features - but it doesn't. I don't think that's a fault of the laptop though, that's 100% GoPro's incompetence there.

Title: WONDERFUL - and surprising.
ReviewText: I've always liked HP/Compaq, but I've always thought high end Dells were the best (PC) bang for the buck. Not this time. Since I watch a LOT of video, I got a 4K screen. I got a 128GB m.2 SSD for my OS and a 1TB mechanical drive. I replaced the M.2 with a 1 TB M.2 (149 here at Amazon) and the 1 TB mechanical HD with a 1 TB Samsung SSD and I've got a laptop that looks AMAZING and screams with speed and 2 TB of hard drive. The picture quality FAR surpasses any PC I've had before, the hard drives are FAST, and the product support I received from MichaelElectronics in answer to my constant questions before I replaced the drives was truly impressive!

Title: Crisp and Fast
ReviewText: This is a really nice laptop. It's not a "gamer", but it's a high res, fast boot, light and sleek laptop. This machine came delivered from MichelElectronics2 thru Amazon. It came with a clean install of Windows 10 Pro (no bloat ware), 32 gigs of RAM, 500 gig SSD primary drive, and 1trybt 7200 rpm HDD drive for additional storage. This thing flies. Boots up and ready to use in 7 seconds. The 17 screen is stunning. The backlit keyboard has a nice touch and is nicely laid out with a numeric keypad. I rarely use it unplugged, so I'm not concerned about battery life like others. So far, I love this laptop.

Title: The size
ReviewText: I liked the laptop but it didn't have a touchscreen as i believed it did from the discription but i found out this dosen't have a touchscreen. I decided to keep it because it had everything else i wanted

Title: Thsi is a very nice, modern computer.  Customer service from seller was excellent.
ReviewText: I needed a new computer because my old one crashed. I wanted something modern, fast and sleek. This computer is all of those things. I should be considerably happy for a while.

Title: Easy to use
ReviewText: Don't care much for the touch pad mouse. Would prefer a two sided touch pad.

Title: HP Laptop 17"
ReviewText: Lots os space around the screen is a waste. Could have made this laptop a 21" very easily. But of course that would impact weight and battrey life. Extremely heavy laptop and very ugly keyboard. Other than that... it is great value for money. Seems a bit slow for a 32GB RAM!!

Title: dissapointed
ReviewText: This laptop is really good in terms of the specs. The touchscreen is awesome, it is the lightest and most compact laptop ever. processor is really fast and face recognition is good as well. So if someone is wondering about the cause of giving this a 1 star, there is only one major problem I have:

Title: Short battery life, Fans are loud most of the time
ReviewText: After using this laptop for a week now, I am kinda disappointed, reasons:

Title: Best Laptop/Tablet I've Ever Worked On
ReviewText: I love this laptop/tablet. Unbelievable speed. Speakers awesome. Lightweight. Backlit keyboard. Very attractive laptop - which isn't important to me but is a nice extra.

Title: Battery Issues and Crappy Global Warranty
ReviewText: Had battery issues in first 6 months, terrible global warranty clause, do not buy unless you are in USA as HP will push you around. My laptop issue is still unresolved after 6 months. I had the worst customer service experience.

Title: So far, a great laptop
ReviewText: I bought my Spectre x360 on 2019-10-06 (it seems this link perpetually sells the 'new' Spectre x360 so I like to put the date here; this model can and does change -significant upgrades to a product while not putting some sort of upgrade identifier in the tag bugs me but it is what it is). Here are the points where I initially worried about the laptop

Title: Brand new unit delivered with hardware problem. 1. ...
ReviewText: Brand new unit delivered with hardware problem.

Title: #avoidasus. blackscreen fail twice in first year. horrific warranty dept each time no no no
ReviewText: Black screen and no boot not even to BIOS. Happened at about 6 months, and again at 11.75 months Whenever it was used at the desk I had a laptop fan under it, always in AC as well. This black screen problem seems so common that it stands out as a defect.

Title: DO NOT BUY!
ReviewText: This Deluxe Zenbook is a total scam. Look at how many screens went black due to crappy graphics cards. This unit WILL overheat when charging to the point of burning you. I have contacted customer support many times. They have tried to fix and can not. The USB-C on this unit is a joke. Do not waste your money on Asus!

Title: Works perfectly with Ubuntu Linux 16.04.2
ReviewText: Purchased this to use for software engineering to develop server applications, was running out of memory on a 16g MacBook and a 32gb Dell XPS 15 9560 wasn't really working well. It comes with Windows 10 but Ubuntu 16.04.2 is certified. Installed Ubuntu and it has worked flawlessly, no weird wifi, graphics, or fan issues. I haven't upgraded the Ubuntu to 18.x just because in the past this has always been a problem point, you spend days recovering from Linux upgrades. The positives are 1) 64gb RAM I never run out of memory running Java server apps, 2) well behaved under stress there's no a lot of wild fan activity, 3) backlit keyboard is nice. Negatives are 1) clunky Lenovo design same old form factor from 15 years ago and very bulky, 2) display a little washed out if you're used to say a Mac retina. I mostly use it like a desktop with external monitor and keyboard and all of this works with no issues. Haven't had to go fishing around looking for Linux tweaks which is unusual. Came in a factory Lenovo box and arrived quickly, merchant was excellent.

Title: Poor Response from Seller and Battery Life is not great
ReviewText: I am an IT contractor, and really like the laptop. It would give it a 5 if not for the following: The Laptop overall is a great laptop. Very smooth, easy to use and very powerful. After just a few weeks of use I noticed that when I changed the battery over night to 100%, and I left the laptop off (not just closed) for say 36=48 hours before turning it on, the battery would less than 20%. Not happy about this, but the worse part was, I called and left 2 messages with the provider MichaelElectronics2 trying to see if there were reported issues with the laptop battery, I have never heard a single thing from them. Gave up trying. I did not contact Amazon, since I felt this is either an HP battery issue or issue that has no real answer. Would really have liked to at least get a call by from the supplier!

Title: I got the 32gb ram 2 tb and am beyond pleased with its performance
ReviewText: Such a clean, smooth computer. I got the 32gb ram 2 tb and am beyond pleased with its performance. I'm a graphic and web designer and this thing doesn't miss a beat with multiple programs running and a full browser. Highly recommend it to anyone.

Title: Hp keep rolling out products like this!!!
ReviewText: A beast of a laptop. No 'cons' here. Big awesome screen : great processor, graphics card, sound. I am not a gamer, use exclusively for photo/video editing and this machine excels!!!

Title: Very Proficient!
ReviewText: Visually awesome. Thin, sleek, metal finish for a modern, minimalist look. Quick, effiecient and room to expand (if necessary).

Title: Great performance
ReviewText: I installed Ubuntu 16.04 (dual boot) and the only issue I had was the WIFI; but I was able to make it work (there isn't an up-to-date driver for the laptop's wifi device; however as soon as there is an up to date version, everything will be 100% OK). Everything works as expected in Windows, didn't have any issues at all.

Title: Touchpad sucks, there's just no way around it.
ReviewText: I bought this to retire my old laptop, because the touchpad never worked right, and the BluRay drive went AWOL when Windows 10 committed it's breaking and entering offenses. Which makes the price tag of this thing a bitter pill to swallow, because the touchpad on it just flat out sucks. The "buttonless buttons" have to be somebody's idea of a cruel joke. Between that and the bizarre kickstand thing below/behind the screen, it just seems awkward. Bought it to work with the GoPro Hero 6's 4K features - but it doesn't. I don't think that's a fault of the laptop though, that's 100% GoPro's incompetence there.

Title: WONDERFUL - and surprising.
ReviewText: I've always liked HP/Compaq, but I've always thought high end Dells were the best (PC) bang for the buck. Not this time. Since I watch a LOT of video, I got a 4K screen. I got a 128GB m.2 SSD for my OS and a 1TB mechanical drive. I replaced the M.2 with a 1 TB M.2 (149 here at Amazon) and the 1 TB mechanical HD with a 1 TB Samsung SSD and I've got a laptop that looks AMAZING and screams with speed and 2 TB of hard drive. The picture quality FAR surpasses any PC I've had before, the hard drives are FAST, and the product support I received from MichaelElectronics in answer to my constant questions before I replaced the drives was truly impressive!

Title: Crisp and Fast
ReviewText: This is a really nice laptop. It's not a "gamer", but it's a high res, fast boot, light and sleek laptop. This machine came delivered from MichelElectronics2 thru Amazon. It came with a clean install of Windows 10 Pro (no bloat ware), 32 gigs of RAM, 500 gig SSD primary drive, and 1trybt 7200 rpm HDD drive for additional storage. This thing flies. Boots up and ready to use in 7 seconds. The 17 screen is stunning. The backlit keyboard has a nice touch and is nicely laid out with a numeric keypad. I rarely use it unplugged, so I'm not concerned about battery life like others. So far, I love this laptop.

Title: Frustrated and cannot connect
ReviewText: I purchased a frame for my mother back in April so we could send her pictures. On my recent visit, she handed me the frame in the box and said it wouldn't work, despite her best efforts. I tried to connect to the frame, and it would not work for me either.

Title: Ease of Use
ReviewText: Though the Photo Frame was just what I wanted, it took me 2 weeks to figure out how to get my 1st iPhone bound to the frame. The Guide was pretty useless, and, I could find NO Tech Support help. Love the convenience of the WiFi ability, but, I'd recommend finding a unit/manufacturer with good Tech Support in case.

Title: Great frame!
ReviewText: Itâ€™s a great digital frame. I like that I can upload pics from an app.

Title: The Good: It connects to your home Wi-Fi allowing you ...
ReviewText: The Good: It connects to your home Wi-Fi allowing you to upload photos from you home anywhere in the world.

Title: I bought this for my daughter as a Christmas gift ...
ReviewText: I bought this for my daughter as a Christmas gift. Not even a week old and already the item doesnâ€™t work.

Title: I was going to RETURN this laptop BUT (read if you're having problems with LAGGING/LOW FPS)
ReviewText: Yes, you read right. I was going to return this laptop because the lagging was TERRIBLE and my games were playing at a low FPS. My older laptop I had since 2009 moved faster. I was fed up, and went through the whole process of contacting Amazon to set up a return. I got the packaging out of my closet and everything lol. I was in the process of resetting this computer to return, and something told me to read the 1 star reviews to see if I did terrible research. While scrolling through the 1star reviews, I lucked up and someone posted the solution to my problem.

Title: Great laptop for 120Hz FPS Games
ReviewText: Packaging:

Title: Battery/power plug died after just 7 months of extremely light use
ReviewText: I bought this laptop because my main computer is a Mac which I use for graphic design. I needed something that would play the games I'd amassed in my Steam library and this seemed powerful enough. It worked fairly well for awhile.

Title: Jesus, the FAN on this thing...
ReviewText: Pros - Looks great; fast; not too heavy; graphics are good enough to make your eyes hurt.

Title: Poor Response from Seller and Battery Life is not great
ReviewText: I am an IT contractor, and really like the laptop. It would give it a 5 if not for the following: The Laptop overall is a great laptop. Very smooth, easy to use and very powerful. After just a few weeks of use I noticed that when I changed the battery over night to 100%, and I left the laptop off (not just closed) for say 36=48 hours before turning it on, the battery would less than 20%. Not happy about this, but the worse part was, I called and left 2 messages with the provider MichaelElectronics2 trying to see if there were reported issues with the laptop battery, I have never heard a single thing from them. Gave up trying. I did not contact Amazon, since I felt this is either an HP battery issue or issue that has no real answer. Would really have liked to at least get a call by from the supplier!

Title: looks good, works poorly
ReviewText: I have a late 2017 model (HP - Spectre x360 Convertible 15-bl1XX) 16gb ram, 512g ssd.

Title: Stepped up my work-from-home game.....
ReviewText: The short version: This is a simple to setup and easy to use docking station. It's worth every penny.

Title: Expensive but worth it
ReviewText: I purchased this dock to supplement a new Dell laptop, as newer Dell laptops are no longer compatible with their famous E-series port replicators.

Title: Works Great with windows
ReviewText: We recently moved from a home computer system to laptops for my wife and me. This box allows us to hook two monitor, a full size keyboard, large hard drive, and two printers to either Computer as needed. The only problems I have had is finding drivers on the website, and it doesn't work with newer versions of apple OS. Hopefully in the future they will be able to come up with a fix so I can hook my apple laptop to the system. I do have one more complaint but I don't know if it was Amazon or the Wavlink who is to blame. When I received the unit it was easy to tell by internal packing, the power cable being untied, and ink dust on unit that the unit had been open at one point and used. I purchased unit new but received a used item.

Title: It works with Linux!
ReviewText: Running this on an Dell XPS 15 inch 9570 running Ubuntu 18.04. And yes there are displaylink drivers for it which is one reason why I bought this. It works great when I close the lid and re-open it and when I come from a full power up or just disconnect and re-connect the USB-C cable. I even had some other USB devices attached to it and they all have been detected properly so far. The only thing I wish it had is a way to detach the base so you could mount this under a desk.

Title: Exactly what I was looking for!
ReviewText: I purchased this particular dock as a first step to a dual 4K monitor setup. My laptop is already 4K but my current monitors only support 1080. Installation was a breeze. All I had to do was reconfigured my Windows Display Settings to extend the Desktop instead of mirror. Lots of ports on this dock!

Title: love it
ReviewText: i love this dock. was going to return it because one of my laptops didn't recognize it and i couldn't find the drivers on the product website. email support was friendly and responded quickly with the driver i needed. the only reason i'm giving it 4 stars it's because there is no usb 2.0... as stated, the 3.0 ports don't work well with wireless mouse/keyboard setups so i still have to move the receiver back and forth between my laptops when i switch them. other than that, great product!

Title: Battery/Charge
ReviewText: I have had SOOo many HP's, this one was good I did like it. BUT I can not charge it anymore. The new charging port is crap. Worse it can not be fixed. I put my charger in the port and no light, I have called, gone on youtube, googled no work around and no fix. Went to Best Buy and they said at least $500 for parts and fix and that was a maybe

Title: Low-quality charger
ReviewText: I had this computer for a litter more than a year. The charge has broken 2 times already. Each time cost me over 100 dollars to buy a new one. It just soooo annoying!! Never by a HP again!!

Title: Fantastic Ultrabook w/ 2 in 1 Capabilities 4K display, dedicated graphics and super slim profile.
ReviewText: Absolutely STUNNING device! Super thin and powerful with Yoga capabilities. There are no other ultrabooks in this class with this power that has 2 in 1.

Title: Lots to love with drawbacks
ReviewText: If not for a couple of major issues this Omen would be a real winner. Two stars because of how fast it runs

Title: Strong laptop for price
ReviewText: Was looking for an interim laptop while my primary one (an MSI Raider) was in the shop for repair. After an extensive search, I found this to be the best value for the price. I was not wrong. The computer might only have 16GB of RAM, but it hauls just fine: I routinely have multiple windows, tabs, and programs open/running and the device rarely, if ever, crashes. The touchscreen works well, although I was disappointed that it doesn't function like an actual drawing tablet.

Title: Turns on quickly and looks cool
ReviewText: Loads quickly, great touch screen and looks cool with the gold accents.

Title: Day 1 - Out Of The Box
ReviewText: I'm a photographer, which is why I paid for this "upgraded" model. First SD card I put in, day one of having the laptop, I copy the files to the secondary drive...... SD card gets stuck, had to use an Xacto knife to remove it. Tried 3 other SD cards, 2 of which were brand new, same deal. Called HP earlier in the day, they said if the laptop was modified by a 3rd party, they likely didn't align something properly to allow for the SD card to be removed properly.

Title: Best laptop at this price point, bar none
ReviewText: Great little laptop for the price. I bought this to replace an older, aging Asus ROG laptop and I absolutely love using it! It starts up fast, plays all my games great, and is nearly half the weight of my old gaming laptop! The fingerprint scanner works every time and is a much appreciated addition to the computer. The keyboard deck is a firm aluminum, which makes typing and using the laptop in normal use feel very premium, despite the rest of the chassis being made of plastic, though the plastic certainly does not feel cheap. The computer has a very professional look to it with a hint of that gamer charm in the red accents and keyboard. I personally find it to be a very tasteful and minimalist design, as opposed to the more flashy gaming laptops on the market, though others may disagree.

Title: A great stealth gaming rig for college
ReviewText: We are a gaming family. Every one of us plays video games. When my son needed a laptop for a very conservative college, I started looking for one that had to meed the following criteria.

Title: got me e-grills
ReviewText: Ever since receiving this laptop, i am now the coolest kid in the lecture hall. It's sleek red and black theme lets normies know i got the cool look but no overkill designing like acer helios editions. Those just are a nono if you are a student.

Title: It only has 1 usb3 port
ReviewText: This computer boots up in about 4 seconds. The 4k display is gorgeous. I am a photographer and it just wowed me with some of photos. I also write code. Android studio barley worked on my old laptop. This laptop put fun back into writing code. I did not receive the pen in the box. MichaelElectronics2 is going to have HP send me one. Great services, Fast shipping. I could not be happier.

Title: Best laptop I have ever owned.
ReviewText: Very fast processing. Good connectivity. I have used stylus a little - so far it has functioned well. Great battery life - Worked 10 hours while at a seminar. I do not have a single complaint!

Title: Expensive Mistake
ReviewText: Bought a VERY expensive laptop... Had issues from the very start. Was never able to get any reply from tech support. Now after a few months of use, and STILL UNDER WARRANTY, the screen is failing!

Title: These computers are overpriced LEMONS.  This vendor uses sup-par upgrade parts too
ReviewText: I've has this POS for over a year now, and it's had nothing but issues from the get-go. BSOD errors constantly, RAM has been swapped out 3 times, screen flickers, battery life is horrible. Now one of the speakers has died. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. Looks like I will be looking for another laptop.

Title: Space bar collapsed in 18 months. GREAT computer but can"t use it without external keyboard
ReviewText: How can a simple spacebar ruin a great computer?? I paid a couple thousand dollars for a computer that lasted less then 2 years! With no spacebar I have to carry an external keyboard. Tried replacing the keyboard myself, but it was very complicated, had to remove everything to get down to the keyboard. In the end bought a new laptop :-(

Title: Spectre crashed after two years of minimal use.  Cost more to repair than replace.
ReviewText: My high power HP Spectre crashed in early 2020 after months of 'blue screen' restarts. Was told that motherboard failed, half of RAM failed, etc. Very disappointed. This laptop was minimally used. HP authorized repair shop run by Microsoft looked inside the computer and reported that the parts were not 'top quality' parts. Cost to repair estimated more than $1,000 and no promise of data recovery. If this is HP quality.....

Title: Won't Last
ReviewText: Mine died after 18 months. One day mother board and SSD both fried. Was on battery and just was waking it up. It was not even used alot as I have another laptop and 2 PCs I use.

Title: Excelente rendimiento
ReviewText: Magnifico rendimiento y muy buena relaciÃ³n precio producto, la recomiendo para trabajos intensos que exigen rendimiento de procesador y versatilidad de manejo por su dos en uno.

Title: Love it
ReviewText: Spectacular

Title: Great machine; great company.
ReviewText: I love this little machine. It's footprint belies the power in the box. So far, it has handled everything I have thrown at it.

Title: Lots of power in atiny package
ReviewText: I love it! Went from a laptop to this system when covid caused me to work exclusively from home. Now I don't ever want to carry a laptop again. This thing is super powerful and quiet. I can have 20 windows open running excel, PowerPoint, Chrome, outlook, my database editor, and my programming environment. This thing barely notices. It also fits in a tiny corner of my desk. Highly recommended!

Title: Very powerful and efficient machine in a small form factor.
ReviewText: Amazing switch from a standard desktop size to a mini PC the size of a modem. Very powerful computer with SSD and lot of ram, immediate start up with windows 10 as typical with SSD, lot of high end ports for video in back, multiple USB in front and back.

Title: Solid desktop PC good for tight places
ReviewText: This desktop PC is reliable and works well right out of the box. It fits nicely in a tight place and has served my purposes quite well.

Title: Lenovo Think Station
ReviewText: Awesome compact computer... Put in our RV and used the large smart TV for a video display... Works great!

ReviewText: Space saving and very powerful well worth the money

Title: Fast, Powerful, and Compact
ReviewText: Great Product! I love how fast and powerful this computer is, especially in its tiny frame. I just replaced four computers in my office this weekend with these, and couldn't be happier with the results.

Title: Lenovo thinkstation
ReviewText: This item was returned, it was not what I was looking for.

Title: Great Machine for a Great Price
ReviewText: We purchased this machine to potentially replace our Chromebooks used in out warehouse, and this little machine has worked great for what is needed of it! A few small applications and multiple users is all that is required of it, and it handles it like a champ. Will definitely be buying more to shift out our old Chromebooks.

ReviewText: It is a sweet machine, fast enough but only has 32gb drive. After spending 6 hours upgrading to only 1703, Can't upgrade to 1709. dir

Title: Take down the gamma a little.
ReviewText: Had it for a few months now after getting ripped off from a well known competitor of HP. It is a little bright but it does exactly as advertised. I recommend going into your Nvidia control panel -> adjust desktop color settings and take the gamma down to .67 to address the brightness issue. I'm not sure where to go for that in AMD's control panel. Simply messing with the monitor's settings will not work for the brightness issue without making everything else look horrible.

Title: Good value
ReviewText: I built a machine from new parts and wanted a monitor with compatible specs (refresh rate etc.). I am not a computer genius, just an average guy and think the monitor is excellent. Bright, clear, keeps up with Division2 and other newer games. I might buy a larger version as my desk area would definitely support it, but I have no complaints when focused on the screen and not looking at available desk-top space.

ReviewText: Got this for my boyfriend for a second gaming monitor and he loves it!!

Title: Excellent choice and fair price
ReviewText: My son is a teenager and gamer. He love it for the quality of the images so his vision of the images is better and as result his movements are more fast.

Title: Two identical laptops only lasted 3 weeks - both had failed screens.
ReviewText: The screen started flickering 2.5 weeks after I purchased this computer. My boyfriend and I purchased identical laptops at the same time (from different sellers), and we both had non-functioning screens after having the computers for about a month. The frustrating thing is - had this computer worked like it did in the first two weeks, I would have given it 5 stars (it was fantastic! - fast, responsive, and I loved the rotating screen). - but n = 2 demonstrated that there are some serious design flaws with the screen. Disappointing.

Title: Looks and performance good - screen connectivity broken within 2 weeks
ReviewText: Within 2 weeks the display had black lines running horizontally across it and the display was significantly distorted. The laptop has only been on a desk, not traveled with or had any opportunity for damage so this must be down to bad quality component parts in the screen connection.

Title: Good Machine
ReviewText: Not going into computer specs here, just a daily user doing daily things. Way lighter and more responsive than my old Toshiba Satellite. Fingerprint reader touchy. Battery life is only ok. Not the brightest screen and dims considerably when low battery occurs. Nice keypad feel. Charging is fast with a simple one piece wallwart/cable combo.

Title: Love the screen& colors. Extremely sharp IPS panel
ReviewText: Love the screen. Extremely sharp IPS panel. Colors were a slightly off but quickly corrected with my color munki smile. Had a long windows update but everything works fine. Would buy again

Title: Great for mom
ReviewText: Got this for my mom and sheâ€™s in love! Good weight (or lack of) great size for her. Tablet use is nice when needed. Snappy performance.

Title: Overall it's very good. It has very good battery life
ReviewText: Overall it's very good. It has very good battery life, but the performance was a bit lagging (which is expected).

Title: Flexible and fun to use
ReviewText: I like the flexibility of the device and the keyboard. Not usually a fan of laptop keyboards but this one is not overly sensitive. It does what I wanted it to do.

Title: Highly recommend.....
ReviewText: Wonderful computer. Not one negative I can speak of!

Title: There's great value in Intel SSDs. I speak from experience.
ReviewText: If you like my review, please give it a thumbs-up. I only write reviews to help fellow Amazon shoppers. I am not compensated for any products, (I buy them with my own money, like many of you) and I write what I experience in order to make Amazon Reviews better for us all.

Title: High DOA Rate
ReviewText: I plugged the Intel SSD into a Dell with the intention of cloning the original drive. The computer would not boot. I then made the mistake of trying it on a different Dell computer. It froze at the boot screen. Whatever was wrong with drive also corrupted the computerâ€™s original drive. After removing the Intel SSD, the computer would no longer boot. Fortunately, a Windows repair fixed the problem on the original drive.

Title: Fast, Rugged, Actual 25GB Capacity
ReviewText: I wanted to replace an enterprise class disk drive in unsupported network hardware that would be rendered useless if the drive failed. I wanted to image the internal disk and replace it with an SSD that was guaranteed to be reliable. My choices were limited: I could opt for older technology SSD's that might fail with enough write cycles and weren't designed for the 24/7 warm environment in a network rack, or pay a premium for new technology SSD's that were faster and reliable. The Intel 545s was a great choice. It's a newer technology multilayer 3D nand, comes in a rugged metal package, and is less expensive than other choices in its class. Since I was making a bitwise copy of a physical hard drive, I needed 256GB, not 240GB, not 250GB, like so many others on the market. The Intel 545s series was a perfect fit for my criteria: New technology, reputation for reliability, full 256GB capacity, and reasonable price.

Title: I red the reviews that Crucial and Samsung SSD are better, but I chose this one because of the ...
ReviewText: It works much faster than I expected. I red the reviews that Crucial and Samsung SSD are better, but I chose this one because of the Intel migration software. I manage to migrate my OS in 3-4 hours. There were some issues but finally everything works just fine. I highly recommend it not only because of the Intel's support, but and because it's faster than my brand new Dell laptop equipped with Samsung SSD and using the same OS and processor as my desktop.

Title: Randomly locks my PC, 100% utilization but no Read / Write
ReviewText: Every once in a while this drive will completely lock my PC, utilizaion goes to 100% and throughput goes to zero.

Title: Intel Is the Best
ReviewText: Â I upgraded my Latitude laptop running XP Pro with this SSD using a cloning device. Didn't need any adapter, spacer to install it. It fit perfectly and the LT ran like never before. I used another Intel SSD, 1 TB to upgrade a Dell Inspiron mini tower running Windows 10 also. I will use nothing but Intel SSDs from this vender.

Title: Great little SSD, works great in a Mac
ReviewText: I drop this baby in a MacBook Pro mid 2012 and itâ€™s rocking.

Title: Free Acronis transfer with intel data migration tool.
ReviewText: Love intel ssd's. Free Acronis transfer with download of intel migration tool.

Title: All good. I love the machine BUT - major issue ...
ReviewText: The product was shipped on time, and arrived correctly packaged, shipped to South Africa. All good.

Title: Powerful, but a Bit Quirky
ReviewText: Overall this is a great machine for those of us that need a lot under the hood. I found nothing comparable in the price range. However, like most Lenovo products, it wasn't without its issues. Eventually all the kinks were ironed out and now it hums along nicely and does what I need it to do well.

Title: Worth It
ReviewText: I was thoroughly impressed by the quality of the laptop and I'm really glad that they offer upgrades on these because the 500GB base is not enough for me, so I always have to switch to a 1TB. I bought it from Amazing Prime Items and everything worked perfectly fine for me. They replaced the 500GB HDD with a 1TB SSD and there weren't any compatibility issues and I didn't get any errors. Even though the laptop has been upgraded, Lenovo does still provide their three year warranty on the laptop, so that makes it even more worth it. They were kind of enough to answer all the questions I had prior to purchasing and since they offer the best price on all the upgrades, I know I'll be purchasing from Amazing Prime Items again.

Title: Powerful Laptop
ReviewText: Itâ€™s a very powerful and sturdy laptop. I would recommend it to anyone since it can be used both at home and at work. Itâ€™s very fast and the keyboard is very comfortable to use. I would say itâ€™s worth the money since it lasts a long time and the service that Lenovo provides is great!

Title: Powerful Laptop
ReviewText: Itâ€™s a very powerful and sturdy laptop. I would recommend it to anyone since it can be used both at home and at work. Itâ€™s very fast and the keyboard is very comfortable to use. I would say itâ€™s worth the money since it lasts a long time and the service that Lenovo provides is great!

Title: Fantastic Product, Tons of power in a tiny form factor
ReviewText: This is a review of the "Lenovo ThinkStation P320 Tiny Workstation - Intel Core i7-7700T, 16GB RAM, 512GB PCIe SSD, NVIDIA Quadro P600 2GB, Windows 10 Pro"

Title: ... out to 32 gb and I could not be happier with it
ReviewText: I purchased from Amazon and also added additional 16 gb of memory to max it out to 32 gb and I could not be happier with it.

Title: Solid Business Workstation
ReviewText: Lots of power in a very tiny form factor. Intel Core i7 CPU, DDR4 memory, NVMe SSD, 4 miniDP display outputs, 4xUSB 3.0, 10/100/1000 NIC, and built in 802.11ac WiFi. Easily opened for a memory or hard drive upgrade. Mouse and keyboard included are above average for a OEM included set. Good warranty service from Lenovo as it is part of their business line.

Title: ... for over a month now and I am very satisfied with the performance
ReviewText: I have been using this computer for over a month now and I am very satisfied with the performance. The compact size offers a lot of flexibility for setting up your workstation wherever you might need it.

Title: Workhorse of a laptop
ReviewText: I gave the laptop 4 stars because it is so heavy compared to today's tablets. In addition, I'm not sure why they didn't include a touch screen, though that wasn't a deal breaker for me. There's also no internal optical drives, again, surprising in a machine so large. I needed a workhorse, and I got it. No bloatware. Just Win10 Pro. Now, Nvidia and Intel have tried to install updates in the last two days that failed, and hoping that it was due to travel and they will retry and succeed. I love the ergonomic touch point on Lenovo keyboards. Two months in, problems getting my old hard drives to give up their data (windows won't recognize them as external drives and read the files - delighted if anyone knows how to fix that, I've 3 old hard drives I need to cull. Otherwise, so far, so good...

Title: Def would reccomend
ReviewText: Liking the new laptop. I produce electronic music on it and hasn't crashed or lagged up yet. Lil bulky both the battery charger and thickness of actual laptop. The performance is there. Great score online at a diagnostic site. Very happy. Lenovo is a quality PC only manufacturer i haven't ran into problems with

Title: Best computer I've ever owned.
ReviewText: I love this computer....fast, powerful and easy to use. Really love it.

Title: World's Best Black Slab
ReviewText: Before this laptop, I owned a small 12.3 in. Microsoft Surface clone as my first daily driver. Switching from that to this was night-and-day.

Title: Awsome Notebook
ReviewText: This machine is really very fast. The screen - that was my concern - is very bright, and the keyboard is probably one of the best in the market. Overall is a very well build quality and good looking, even not very slim. Is a little bit heavy, but for what it is, is plenty justified.

Title: Came as described, works out of box!
ReviewText: Product came on time, as described, in brand new condition. Setup with Windows 10 only took a couple of minutes and it runs like a charm! Have had for a few days now and is running SolidWorks 2018 lightning fast with the dedicated Nvidia graphics card.

Title: Budget Gaming System for sub $700 (With NVMe Support!)
ReviewText: By downgrading the BIOS to version 1.0.0, you will not only gain sleep/wake support (that you shouldn't use anyway) but also enable the M.2 port on the motherboard. This will allow you to install an NVMe SSD and really unlock the potential a device at this price point has. I've coupled it with a Samsung 970 EVO 250GB and an EVGA Geforce GTX 1050 ti graphics card (both of which running with the stock PSU) and for the money am really pleased with the performance.

Title: Great server. Use this to run my Plex Media ...
ReviewText: Great server. Use this to run my Plex Media predominantly, and a few various other applications and it works flawlessly. And surprisingly quiet for a Xeon server. Would totally buy this again.

Title: A lot of computer for the money.
ReviewText: I bought this to run a music server. The Xeon is much more powerful than I need, but I found it hard to beat the price by buying separate parts for a server. I installed Ubuntu Server 18.04 on mine, which went smooth as silk. The machine is very quiet.

Title: Excellent product but don't tell anybody.
ReviewText: I really don't want to write these things High because everybody else will find out how good they are. These are absolutely one of the best priced fast machines built on server technology for anything you add an SSD to this and some RAM and I'm telling you it's the fastest machine you'll ever use hands down. The graphics aren't great on it but you can always add a graphics card to it and I guarantee you this is better than most gaming machines built.

Title: Worked as expected
ReviewText: This is being used as a freenas storage system. I run a Plex server and a Ubuntu server off of it as well. I added 16 gb of RAM. The only issue I have is I can't choose which USB device to boot from so if I have a backup drive connected then the system tries to boot from the wrong drive and fails. Have not tried a bios update to see if that will change anything.

Title: Workhorse of a laptop
ReviewText: I gave the laptop 4 stars because it is so heavy compared to today's tablets. In addition, I'm not sure why they didn't include a touch screen, though that wasn't a deal breaker for me. There's also no internal optical drives, again, surprising in a machine so large. I needed a workhorse, and I got it. No bloatware. Just Win10 Pro. Now, Nvidia and Intel have tried to install updates in the last two days that failed, and hoping that it was due to travel and they will retry and succeed. I love the ergonomic touch point on Lenovo keyboards. Two months in, problems getting my old hard drives to give up their data (windows won't recognize them as external drives and read the files - delighted if anyone knows how to fix that, I've 3 old hard drives I need to cull. Otherwise, so far, so good...

Title: T-30 Tower Server with large performance and very few needs but a problem exists using 3-4 internal hard drives
ReviewText: The Dell PowerEdge T-30 Purpose built, I would suggest adding RAM to reach 16-24GB, the Xeon CPU processor rocks, the system is very fast and stable despite what normally would be a heavy load even on a decent i7 CPU. This small business/home office server performed so well, I bought another 30 days later to convert into a workstation. I suggest adding a SSD 256GB Samsung 6 GB/sec drive for the file system/operating system files and I point out the buyers should be aware there is only a HDMI video plug and therefore should have a HDMI -> DVI cable handy if needed. The one knock I have on this Tower Server is its black inset Power Button is nearly invisible on its black case. In shaded areas, the user needs a flashlight to locate and use the Power Button. The manufacturer needs to chrome the exterior of the Power Switch to help make it obvious and discern it from the black case. The worse knock on this server is the top two hard drive cages are too close to the power supply to slide in hard drives much less hot swap them out. Is the only way to add hard drives to the top two of the four hard drive cages by first removing the entire power supply? That seems like a total lapse of design and engineering on this product. Very few servers are going to only use two hard drives in the bottom two hard drive cages.

Title: Excellent & powerful SOHO server.
ReviewText: Worked fine for our remote office. Has plenty of CPU power (quad core Xeon has lots of oomph). Easy to work in, at least in terms of adding additional drives and upgrading RAM.

Title: Great Speed, Versatility
ReviewText: I bought this for a small business, so the owner could use it as a workstation, but also as a data server for three other computers in his office. I put in a 1 Tb SSD as the main drive, install Windows 10 Pro, and installed the programs the business uses. The owner is very impressed with the speed and versatility he gets from the unit.

ReviewText: Liking the new laptop. I produce electronic music on it and hasn't crashed or lagged up yet. Lil bulky both the battery charger and thickness of actual laptop. The performance is there. Title: Best laptop I have ever worked on - great help from vendor
ReviewText: Folks at "MichaelElectronics2 (Fast Shipping)" were super helpful - worked with them before purchase to make sure of the memory and SSD configuration - ended up getting 500 GB SSD, 48 GB RAM, - exactly what I was looking for. Arrived on time as promised. Initial setup caused me concern when out of the box it would not boot up, but I had experienced something similar with another laptop in the past so I removed and reseated the battery and that was all it took. Operation since then has been flawless and super fast - cold boot takes less than 10 seconds to fully running. I use it primarily for programming and database work - it easily handles SQL Server 2016 and Visual Studio 2017 chores as well as monitoring 16 security cameras via Blue Iris software.

Title: Lightning Fast and Reliable Workstation!
ReviewText: This workstation is every bit what I expected from

Title: Daily Blue Screens
ReviewText: The dual graphics hardware that Lenovo put into this laptop, together with the notoriously flaky Nvidia drivers, have given me nothing but headaches over the first year of ownership. I keep the firmware and drivers up to date, but it seems to be getting worse with every new version of Nvidia drivers.

Title: Constant issues with the docking station, multiple displays
ReviewText: I can't believe I own a $3000 "workstation" that has to be rebooted every time I dock or undock it. My ten year old W510 worked with Lenovo docks and displays and this thing can't? Terrible machine.

Title: Top Line Laptop - Seller NOT recommended
ReviewText: Excellent product. Simply the best laptop I ever had until now.

Title: Decent  laptop
ReviewText: I bought this laptop twice. The bad thing about this laptop is finding replacement parts. So far the fan is not working and I can't even find it easily. There are so many fans for HP Spectre x360 and it's just confusing.

Title: Performance Issues
ReviewText: The laptop looks great and very portable. However, I've encountered loss sound from my right speaker and cannot resolve. After countless hours of research the internet for a solution and troubleshooting, I found that this issue is prevalent with this model and the only option is replacement of the unit. I use my laptop daily and cannot afford to send it away for repairs. The desirable alternative is to send a replacement and allow real-time transfer of critical files. Please advise. Thanks.

Title: Great Machine...Realy Fast & Feature Rich
ReviewText: This is one awesome machine. Really like the facial recognition feature which speeds up the process of getting to work. Boots up and signed in under 10 seconds. This 32 GB RAM and 1TB SSD I have also have with my ASUS Laptop but it also has 2 TB HDD. But it weighs over 8 libs which is double this HP Spectre x360. So I moved the ASUS Laptop to take over for old Dell Studio XPS 7 years old because it can drive two more displays in addition to the built-in screen all in extended mode.

Title: Five Stars
ReviewText: Samsung Memory, Hardware qualified for AMD Ryzen.

Title: Order with a Short M.2, 32GB emmc is useless!
ReviewText: Â¡Warrning to the non-tech-savvy! I couldn't boot from the 32GB internal emmc. After booting Linux from an USB I discovered it was reading the storage as an internal SD card reader. Emmc needs to be read as an USB SD card reader to act as a boot device! M.2 slot is avalible but the motherboard manufacturer placed the M.2 slots near the center of the board inline with mounting holes so a full size M.2 drive will not fit! Therefore your only options are to purchase a short M.2 SSD or a normal M.2 with extension and mount it on the inside of the case. Device works great as a router. Tired PFsense, OPNsense and ClearOS.

Title: How do you get it working?
ReviewText: I am hoping this will be an awesome gift for Christmas, however, i have tried 5 different methods to install Win10 and each one comes back that the file on the DVD or ISO ripped from it is invalid. Each of my tries were perform to the letter that the manufacturer recommends (or at least the minimal amount of instruction available on the net)

Title: Awesome for Kodi Box
ReviewText: I was having issues with the Amazon 4K firestick and getting Kodi on it so I bought the much more expensive option and made a Kodi box out of this LIVA Machine.

Title: Pleasantly surprised with build quality & details
ReviewText: This is an unexpectedly well built tiny PC. It has two Ethernet ports, making it perfect for the pfSense firewall. I didn't attempt to install pfSense on the eMMC built-in drive. Like others, I bought a small M.2 SSD to install. Buy a M.2 2242 physical size SSD. It will fit and the mounting screw will work perfectly.

Title: Great firewall but keep it cool and keep an extra few bucks handy
ReviewText: Makes a pretty great network appliance (running PFSense) so long as you keep it well ventilated. It seems to start throttling pretty badly at 60C but only reached those temps when I stacked it on my modem. PFSense, and probably other BSD distros, don't seem to like the built in storage; I purchased a $50 SSD and have had no issues since.

Title: Cheap dual nic mini computer
ReviewText: It does exactly what it was designed to do. I picked this one specific for the dual nic and fanless design and it hasn't disappointed.

Title: Good look and connectivity and it goes great with my ...
ReviewText: Good look and connectivity and it goes great with my Spectre laptop. The only downside is that it feels very poorly made. My laptop is all polished aluminum and the mouse that goes with it is pure plastic. Was expecting a little more on the finish to go with the matching laptop given the price.

Title: Real Disappointment
ReviewText: The mouse does not appear to be in it's original packaging, but packing list says condition "New." The battery is a not a factory battery, it's a an Energizer. The tape on the box says "GENUINE" but the tape has been re-taped.

Title: Looks good but...
ReviewText: This mouse matches my HP Spectre laptop perfectly, and since this laptop has barely any USB ports, I needed to get a bluetooth mouse. I am not really impressed with the performance. I've only had the mouse a few months, and don't use it every day, but lately it loses connectivity on a very regular (and annoyingly frequent) basis. Usually I just have to turn it off and on again and it resumes, but it's really inconvenient. I'm starting to think it might be worth it to use the USB port and go back to my other HP wireless mouse. It is not as sleek and does not coordinate as well, but it never let me down. I wouldn't recommend this mouse.

Title: purfect size for my 13 inch HP laptop
ReviewText: this little mouse is exactly what ive been looking for, with the accent of gold trim around the edges it makes a perfect match for my 13 inch gold color HP x360 laptop. What I love about this mouse is that it compact, and fits comfortably in your palm of your hand, and it also has a built in Bluetooth receiver so you don't need that little annoying USB receiver.

Title: Excellent performance, cheap feel...
ReviewText: Immediate recognition and usability with the HP Spectre laptop, long lasting battery life, and responsive button actuation (nice "click-ability"). Very light weight, which makes it feel somewhat cheap, and it's a little too low profile for my hand to be comfortable with all day, but ease of use and reliability out weighs the minor negatives for me. I would recommend it.

Title: Takes some getting used to, but great product!
ReviewText: Love the colors and the Bluetooth aspect of this mouse; only downsides are you have to remember to switch it to â€œOFFâ€ whenever you shut off your computer because it runs on a battery and although the battery life is long, it is still one more thing to remember. It also has a VERY SENSITIVE finger click. I am heavy-handed and it takes some getting used to, otherwise it has been a great addition to my business!

Title: Works Well But is very small for anyone with larger hands.
ReviewText: Mouse looks nice and connects easily. It is very portable and works well for travel. I haven't had any issues with connectivity and the mouse has reliably connected and worked every time. My issue is related to the size of the mouse. I have owned a number of small USB travel size mice but was surprised at how small this mouse is. If you have larger hands this is not the mouse for you.

Title: sleek, efficient, worth the extra $$
ReviewText: Fantastic, works beautifully with my HP 360. Super fast response, the best wireless mouse in our home...by far

Title: Do not buy this for gaming, or anything at all, really
ReviewText: First thing I noticed with this mouse is that it was comfortable and felt good to use. When I played a game, I immediately noticed that it frequently would stop working and the lights would flash. This is because if you hold left and right mouse buttons for a few seconds it completely resets the mouse, meaning if you are playing a fast/competitive game, you are probably dead. There is NO fix or solution other than to train yourself to never hold both buttons for more than a few seconds. Not realistic at all, for a lot of games.

Title: No skipping plus high accuracy and great feel
ReviewText: I am not a gamer, just an old computer user. I've had many problems with USB wireless and blue-tooth mice skipping and hesitating on windows 10 1709. I decided to give this mouse a try. I love it. It is precise and very smooth in motion. It is easy to set dpi and acceleration to get just the right feel for me. The buttons have enough tactical feel so I know I have clicked and it responds instantly. It glides very smoothly on my mouse pad and does not skip. The mouse feels great in my large hands. I made 2 extra weights from 1/2" brass rod turned down to .4695" x .2390 to get a little more heft to the mouse. I don't think I could ask for a better mouse. I do recommend this to anyone looking for a well mannered rodent. The native windows drivers and mouse controls work perfectly with the mouse. To remove the bottom cover for the weights you use a small screwdriver to gently pry up the cover. Don't force it . The 3 supplied weights are already in the mouse when you get it.

Title: Insanely comfortable and intuitive for gaming, and no need to charge!!!
ReviewText: I was super torn between the wireless, and wired version of this mouse. In the end I went with the wired, because we all have enough stuff to charge as it is. I bought this for my friend's son, and I've gotten to toy with it a bit. It is SO comfortable and intuitive for gaming. Has a very natural feel to it. HP definitely had the gamer mindset going on full throttle when they created this mouse. Highly recommend.

Title: You're Getting what you paid for.
ReviewText: If you came here looking for a quality mouse that you can plug into a USB port and go then this is it. I have small hands so upon first inspection I thought the mouse would be too big for me, I was completely wrong. It's comfortable and easy to hold and the back page button is very convenient. More than likely you won't have trouble with the reset feature unless you are jamming all the buttons at once.

Title: Great mouse
ReviewText: It simply works. I like the ability to change the DPI on the fly, and that changing the DPI also changes the color, so you can recognize the current setting at a glance.

Title: Didn't include all 5 removable weights
ReviewText: The only reason that this product didn't get the full 5 star review, was because it didn't include all 5 of the advertised removable weights. It only included 3. Other than that, it is a wonderful mouse. The only feature I feel it is lacking for being a gaming mouse, is a secondary button between the sniper button and back button.

Title: Good Value For The Money!
ReviewText: Great for gaming or not. Changes colors and speeds. Feels good in the hand. Great overall!

ReviewText: Good quality at good price. Easy to install

Title: Worst Customer Service Experience
ReviewText: The docking station (Model Y0K80AA#ABA) looks to be well made but it was dead on delivery. When attached to my HP Envy X360 through laptop's USB-C port the docking station was not recognized. When attached to my laptop's USB port utilizing the supplied USB-C to USB adapter Windows 10 File Explorer stated that the docking station needs to be formatted. The several times I called HP support I was disconnected, transferred to the wrong department/group, and when they found out that this was purchased for personal use I was sent to phone call limbo where the automated voice told me to go to the online HP support and ignored me from that point on. I started there, have a open case number, and felt like I was a non-entity since they already have my money. I personally have a HP desktop, two HP laptops, two HP monitors, and a HP AIO printer. After this experience I will have to think long and hard before ever buying another HP product again since this experience with HP's customer support leads me to believe that they do not care about us. I highly recommend against buying this docking station.

Title: Works at first but disconnects every 15 minutes. Customer support is awful.
ReviewText: This dock works perfectly for a few minutes. Then everything disconnects. Sometimes it reconnects, sometimes I have to unplug and plug it back in. When I first got the dock, this only happened once or twice a day, which was annoying, but tolerable. After a few months, it started happening every 15 minutes--more than annoying and definitely not tolerable.

Title: Gets the job done in a complex 2 laptop, 2 monitor configuration
ReviewText: I am very spoiled with having EliteBooks in the past and their proper docking stations. This one was needed to go with an awesome new HP ProBook I just bought. It works well except the power is not sufficient to charge the laptop via the USB-C connector plug. I have to go through the effort of hooking up power to my laptop even when it is docked. I come and go a ton as a consultant and therefore this adds a step and the risk of me forgetting that laptop power cord which otherwise would never leave my backpack. It does support 2 monitors well and to make things more complex, I have 2 laptops which means 2 docks. I run all cords into a StarTech 2 port switch that allows me to only have one keyboard, one mouse, one camera, etc. This portable dock handles the switching back and forth between docks for my 2 laptops. It does the job....just missed the mark slightly.

Title: Most comfortable headset - UNTIL IT BREAKS
ReviewText: UPDATE: Well I DID like this headset, until the volume control starting distorting my audio. No big deal, one year warranty, right? Absolutely wrong. HP's website to try and make a warranty claim is a nightmare, and their customer service is even worse. This product does not have a serial number ANYWHERE on it, but both online and through the phone the customer service representatives will not help you without one. I'm told that the serial number comes ON A STICKER. A damned sticker, supposedly on the bars on top of the headset. Besides the borderline criminal irresponsibility of putting a unique product identifier required for a legally-entitled warranty on a weak sticker, I am certain my product never came with such a sticker. Their customer service people have been unbelievably useless, it's an Indian call center that throws you around from person to person repeating the same "I'm sorry sir but without your serial number we cannot help you". Amazon Order information is useless to them, they don't care about your invoice, only the sticker that supposedly comes on a headset. To even get the phone number to call HP support I had to enter a dummy serial number just so it would let me click the "get phone number" button. It honestly feels like a scam to keep people from redeeming their warranty when their product inevitably breaks, serial number on a sticker. . . No way in hell am I ever buying something from HP again. Not a headset, not a computer, not a printer, not even ink and I'm going to do my damn best to make sure no one else does either; a warranty shouldn't be this difficult when a product breaks due to a manufacturer defect. I'm in awe of the way HP is handling this.

Title: Was reluctant...
ReviewText: When I originally saw this product for a cheaper price, I was a bit reluctant. It was described as used, which at first was a bit "eehh" for me, but upon further inspection it just said box has been opened. I do not know why these are priced lower than the others, but it all came with original packaging and it was the real product. Smelled new. Box was in good condition, but I didn't really care about the packaging as long as the product was in good condition. The product works great. It picks up my voice well, and this is my first higher end headset that I have gotten and I heard sounds that I never before heard in games. It was so surprising to me, that I was distracted a lot in my game just listening to these additional sounds that I didn't know were there. Not only does it sound amazing for games, where it just really gets you into the whole atmosphere, it also sounds incredible if you use it to listen to music. The headset itself can get very loud, even if your TV volume is down and your mic sensitivity is low, you will have to adjust the sound settings in various games to stop from echoing. You can just continue to change it on your TV and your primary menu, but you will be adjusting it every time you switch games, so I just recommend just setting it up in individual games so that you don't have to keep messing around. One thing that is odd, is even when you are muted, you occasionally echo other people you are grouped up with, or sometimes your mic will echo a single sound that is in the game. This is a bit odd, but it is only occasionally. This may not be the case for every person who has this, it may just be an odd fluke with mine.

Title: Great fitting fully over the entire ear design
ReviewText: Great fitting fully over the entire ear design. My personal preference, as I hate having things on my ears for any extended period of time. Sound quality is top notch, great lows mids and highs. The mic feels a little cheap the way it pulls out, but after using it for the past few months, I have decided it's actually just really cool. It slides up into the left ear bonnet easily and works great when in use... You won't be disappointed with this headphone/mic setup.

Title: Nice PC for the price, first one came DOA and had to return

The first one I bought was dead on arrival and would not boot up. I sent it back and ordered a new one without any issues through Amazon. The price even dropped $10 bucks. The second PC booted up without any issues and my kids had no issues loading and playing their favorite games (mostly Fortnite).

Title: Great general usage computer
ReviewText: This is my 2nd NUC, the first one I bought over a year ago was the NUC5i7RYH and I set it up for my mother as her main computer and it's still working great for her. She always shows it off to friends that come over, she can't believe how fast it is for the size. Your average budget desktop computer you buy at Costco/Walmart/Best Buy are loaded with crap and don't even have a SSD. If you buy a computer nowadays you need to have a SSD, everything is so much more responsive with one. It's a night and day difference compared to the old hard drives with platters and moving parts. The NUC5i7RYH works great but the fan can be annoying, it will just start blowing full blast out of nowhere and I hate fan noise. My mother doesn't seem to care at all but that was one downside to that model I didn't like.

Testing DragonFlyBSD on it and everything works, which means that it will also work well with Linux and FreeBSD (though I don't know about video accel in FreeBSD). Title: Performs better formatted to exfat over ntfs
ReviewText: I purchased this Micron 1100 2TB SATA drive to replace my Crucial MX100 512GB SSD. I needed a larger drive to store my games on. Out of the box, I formatted the drive to exFAT indicates about 1.86tb (1908GB) of usable space. I used the crystal disk mark to test performance and the numbers were comparable or better than my crucial drive. I proceeded to clone the crucial over to the micron. Once everything was cloned over I ran another test and the write performance started to underperform. I checked the drive format and it was now formatted as NTFS which was the format my crucial had. I ran tests on the crucial 512SSD and it had no issues, the read/write speeds were fine. I decided to format the micron as NTFS with nothing on the drive and ran the tests again, the write performance underperformed again. Formatted the micron a 3rd time to exFat and ran the test once more and the write performance was much better as exFAT format. Decided to copy over the data instead of attempting to clone. Tested the micron again and the numbers excelled once more. It seems like that this SSD doesn't perform well when formatted to NTFS. For the price per GB and overall it does perform well when formatted as exFat I am overall happy with the purchase and is a good bang for the buck.

Title: Outstanding value - exactly as described - new, 2TB SSD, with perfect performance.  Tested 3 different ways before posting.
ReviewText: Outstanding value - exactly as described - new, 2TB SSD, with perfect performance.

Title: By far the lowest price 2TB SSD on the market, and it's quite good!
ReviewText: Excellent SSD overall. You really can't beat the price, and the quality seems top notch. Write speeds are fast compared to many other budget SSDs. However, I wanted to point out that I tried exfat per a review here. However, it caused the drive to use far more space for my games. (Size on disk was about 25% larger than actual size). I ended up just cloning my 480GB SSD I was replacing, which was NTFS. I ran several tests with both file formats, and found them to be comparable. 4k 1QD reads test between 20-25MB/s, which while not mind blowing, is more than acceptable. Sustained writes, sequential read/rights, latency, and general usage have all been great for a drive at this price point.

Title: Who makes a loud clicky mouse in 2019?
ReviewText: I got this mouse to match my new HP Spectre 360 laptop 2-in-1 believing it would match the high quality of the laptop. My mistake that I didnt even look at the reviews due to my confidence. This is a terribly cheap, flimsy piece of plastic with the outstandingly irritating feature being the LOUD clicks when pressing the right and left click areas., driving coworkers or partners at home crazy ... like waiting for the other shoe to drop. Next, it uses a AA battery... rechargeable battery at this price point would have been expected. This is going back to Amazon and hopefully to HP. The company is not doing itself any favors with cheap hardware, least of all to its many customers. I can't believe I even wrote more than 10 words over this waste of time and money.

Title: A cheap piece of plastic
ReviewText: This mouse LOOKS good, and it feels good in your hand. But in reality, it is a cheap piece of plastic. It is LOUD (the right click in particular can be very annoying to you, or anyone else in the room), it frequently freezes up, and the roll button is agonizingly slow. Aside from its look, there is NOTHING to recommend it. Waste of money.

The photos of this mouse make it look like it would match exactly and so did the photos on the product packaging, but when I opened it the mouse itself did not match! The gold on the mouse is more of a traditional yellow gold, not like the slightly-pink hued gold in the photos or on the HP spectre. This mouse might function well, but I bought it for its appearance AND function. I could have gone with other models if I wasn't concerned with matching the colors.

Title: Not what I expected for Spectre brand
ReviewText: I got an HP Spectre computer, which I really like and it's made well. My previous computer was an HP Envy, and I was told Spectre is a step up, so I assumed I would like Spectre accessories. It's much thinner than it appears in the photo - i have large hands, so it's not as comfortable. The worst part is the scroll wheel... it's more turning the wheel on a padlock where it snaps into place and clicks so loudly, it'll wake up the neighbors. Oh, it's responsiveness fades in and out, too. Sometimes the cursor disappears and takes a bit to reappear, especially when moving around two screens.
