Title: Long Overdue Upgrade
ReviewText: Bought this to replace an aging GTX760 and the only regret is that I didn't do it sooner. Compared several versions of this card on a handful of sites and read forums as well. Ultimately I chose the Gigabyte because I run a Gigabyte Mobo and have been well pleased with it's performance and reliability, and it has the extra cooling capacity which is important for where my computer sits and what I run on it.

Title: This was suppose to be a new card?? I got a used card.
ReviewText: Did not like that it was used. I supposedly ordered a new one. Box was opened. No packaging. It had postal stickers on card box. I opened the box and card looked clean. Had instructions and software disk. Installed the card and turned on PC. It came on normally, but as soon as I opened window screen. I got the black screen. So installed my old card. Turned on PC and got the blue Window recovery screen. I did not want to recover Windows. Installed new drivers for the card. This time it lasted 4 minutes before the black screen. Took out new card and put in the old. Got the recovery screen again. Did a restore of the system. Got my system up with no loses of any programs. I am very disappointed. I have a EVGA G850 PS. AMD 8350 Processor. 16 memory. Sending it back as soon as possible.

Title: Runs it all
ReviewText: I spent a month deciding what I wanted.... was reading way to much on everything. Finally purchased this card, and it's perfect. It is the best option for the money hands down. I will say the fan noise is the loudest out of any card I have owned and others have noted the same... that being said, the fans keep everything cool no problem. Stop researching and buy it. This is a great cheep option to hold you over till Nvidia's new stuff drops in price.

Title: Great card, except for the COMPLETE design change.
ReviewText: This card is definitely a great buy for the money, considering itâ€™s big brother, the GTX 1080 G1 gaming card is almost $500 more, and is only 38 MHZ faster, with just a few more CUDA cores. It overclocks at the touch of a button in Gigabyteâ€™s software, runs great, quiet, and keeps itself at a stable temp. The only reason I docked it a star is because my previous card, the Gigabyte GTX 1060 G1 Gaming card, was supposed to be the same reference design, so presumably the EKWB waterblock should fit it, but when Gigabyte designed the V2 1070, they changed the basic design from a reference model to a custom board, so no EKWB block will fit it, like it would for the V1 1070. Now Iâ€™m stuck with a $160 waterblock I canâ€™t use, and had to buy ANOTHER $130 block from Bykski, who is currently the only maker of blocks for the version 2 1060â€™s and 1070â€™s. If you have no plans for watercooling this card, I would give it 5 stars.

Title: Bought Used don't recommend
ReviewText: I ordered this for my son USED. He says it appears to be defective. My son concluded that it had framerate and temperature issues. I would not recommend buying this used.

Title: GTX 1070  Gigabite.....in 2019 ?
ReviewText: Wow Imlressed so far with this card.gtx 1070 8 gb .Everything is working perfecto. I Updated the drivers after installing the card. Simple and easy...only complaint I have was no warranty was included in the package. When registering the card on gigabites website. Kept getting Error reports even tho I filled everything out like suggested. But that is my only gripe. Everything else including the RGB program works perfectly....Might buy from Gigabite again......

Title: Stable, manageable temps, no installation/driver issues.
ReviewText: The card has 3 small fans, which I though at first were not going to cut it. Turns out, in terms of temps, the card maintains a comfortable temp of around 60-65 Celsius under full load. In terms of acoustics, I have not noticed any abnormal fan noice at any point during use, and the case is right next to me on the desk. I use a mid tower ATX case, with 5 fans ( 3 front intakes, 1 back exhaust, 1 top exhaust ) which might be helping it a bit to maintain temps. In terms of gaming performance it is a beast. 1080p gaming is a joke for this card, nothing I throw at it has proven too much for now. Checking out some benchmarks online, I can see that it is pretty competent for 1440p as well, most titles will play above 60fps on ultra. Overall, in my use scenario: 1080p high refresh rate/fps - it is an excellent purchase.

Title: The scroll roller is not well manufactured for sure!
ReviewText: I would most definitely give this product more than 5 stars till only a few days ago - Bought it in October 2017 and its Feb 2018 and the tracking roller is completely loose! So essentially you scroll down say 5 lines and it does scroll down that much but when you let the roller go (like you would), it scrolls back up about 2 lines! It has gotten so difficult that I actually use the mouse to click and the touch pad to scroll. This mouse was definitely an envy of many because it looks simply amazing with a similar colored HP laptop and is so sleek! and untill last week - worked beautifully too.

Title: Not responsive, really hampers usability
ReviewText: I bought this to match a gold Acer Chromebook (I work from home on some days), and cosmetically I love it.

Title: Simple Effective Mouse
ReviewText: So I've historically only used Logitech mouses as they've lasted many years, were reliable and I love the unifying feature. However lately I've noticed they've become much more expensive and have this annoying tendency to have the scroll overly sensitive. I was in the market to shop for an inexpensive, basic wireless mouse and everything I saw of logitech were bulky and beyond a reasonable price. All I needed was a mouse for my work desktop that did the basic functions, didn't need back and forth buttons, or pulling up the start menu. Here is where I found the HP Z3700 mouse. I've been using it for a day now and I love it. Its light weight, basic, and does everything I need. Its also very slim and can fit in my pocket if I need to take my laptop around the office. Best part, if it breaks or gets misplaced, its only $12, compared to my other logitech mice of $40+. Win for simplicity. Can't speak about battery life or overall reliability. However I do like the fact that it uses AA batteries. One less thing to have to worry about charging.

Title: Just plug in USB stick. Turn on mouse and it's ready.
ReviewText: No other installation of software was required on either my Lenovo Ideapad or Yoga. Both run Windows 10, the latest version. I got this because of the sleek flat design, which makes it easy to carry and works just fine with my even large hands. It's not totally flat and has enough of a bump to mild into my palm and indeed my wife's hand which is somewhat smaller. If you like a bulging mouse...why the heck would you buy this and then complain about it as another reviewer did? Clearly states the shape in the pictures. I also love how this mouse works on any surface so far: bedspread , jeans, couch, carpet... anything so far. The scroll wheel is very responsive and can be used to open new browser tones and scroll down pages. All for under 20 bucks. Best mouse ever- and beats all the Microsoft type Arc ones that cost 3 or 4 times as much.

Title: Okay travel mouse, but fails if subject to daily use
ReviewText: This is an okay travel mouse, but not built for daily use. if subject to daily use, the scroll wheel stops functioning correctly after about three months. You slowly have to apply more and more pressure to the scroll wheel to achieve any effect - otherwise the wheel loses purchase with its point of contact and just freely spins, to no effect. Eventually the problem is pronounced enough so as to make the product unusable.

Title: This replacement actually worked but like I said it works but after two seconds it ...
ReviewText: It worked alright but every 2 seconds it would freeze the mouse but move somewhere else invisibly. Did not appreciate that. I also got a first product where it was defected so I ordered a replacement. This replacement actually worked but like I said it works but after two seconds it freezes and only works after I click again and it is somewhere else. Horrible and expected better from HP. Please make it better.

Title: Great looking, great quality, great price!
ReviewText: Once you get used to the slim, low profile feel of this mouse, it is amazing! I have used wireless mouses that were double and triple the cost of this, and this is either equal or better in quality and design.

Title: which in retrospect I liked. But it's comfortable and I expect the same ...
ReviewText: I had a HP VoodooDna mouse before this, which is for all intents and purposes the exact same mouse; given that I used it vigorously (essentially every day for varying lengths of time) for 7 years before it finally started to die (left click started double clicking) and had no problems with it, I thought I'd buy HP again. This mouse is shaped essentially the same, with the 5 buttons and the sensitivity button in the same place. It has a few more sensitivity settings than my old mouse, which doesn't matter to me since I stick with one anyways. I agree with other reviews, and i give it 4 stars because it feels very light - I will get used to it, but my old mouse is significantly heavier, which in retrospect I liked. But it's comfortable and I expect the same performance as my old mouse - which was very pleasing.

Title: Performance is great, and the ergonomics are top notch
ReviewText: This mouse was about what I was looking for, which is a high end gaming mouse that matches well with my HP Omen laptop. Performance is great, and the ergonomics are top notch, especially considering I have a fairly large hand. It's not a giant, but I would say it can comfortably hold hands up to ~9 inches in length

Title: Great mouse, 1 flaw for me.
ReviewText: This mouse was pretty solid for a long time. I loved its shape and how responsive it was. However for some reason after gaming for awhile the rubber part where your thumb rests would start to feel like it was melting. There was a sticky residue that was coming from it, I'm assuming this was a glue of some kind but it would only secrete when I was using the mouse for extended periods. If it wasn't for that I would still be enyjoing this mouse, but after several months I just couldn't enjoy it anymore.

Title: Great mouse.
ReviewText: Great mouse. I owned the previous version that I bought over 5 years ago. Replaced because the buttons started to basically gum up. This is one of the most precise and comfortable mice I've used. I play mostly Blizzard games.

Title: A little better than the cheaper gaming mice...
ReviewText: Side buttons are kind of loose. The light-up red strip on mine has an inner scuff that makes it look a little chintzy. The size is large and comfortable and the handling and mouse wheel are nice. I like the wrapped cord. Could use some custom weights. Got this because I have an Omen15, but every HP mouse I've had eventually died of clicking problems.

Title: Solved my problem.
ReviewText: Big thing I like about this mouse... It's configured well with the buttons. I haven't accidentally hit any button I didn't want pushed. I hate being in the middle of a game and accidentally hitting the button that effect mouse speed across the screen. Hate it. HP X9000. Solved. Thank you.

Title: Five Stars
ReviewText: It works great

Title: Five Stars
ReviewText: Love it

Title: Great buy
ReviewText: It arrived two days after I placed the order. Fresh and new out the box without damages. there was the stand, three cords and the monitor. The stand was very easy to assemble. Connecting the power cord, speaker cord and the blue cord with the screws on it( forgive me for not knowing the name of it) was easy also. There is a piece of paper taped to the front of the monitor that has the assemble instructions on it. You can't mess this up. It took less than 15 minutes from box to turning on my computer.

Title: Not compatible with most Macs
ReviewText: This is NOT compatible with Mac's that are older than 2018 or 2017... I had to buy, install, troubleshoot and then call tech support to find that out. Lots of trouble and lots of wasted time that could have been avoided by them telling us in the product information before buying.

Title: Perfect, Just What We Needed
ReviewText: I was building another computer site within our house and I did not want to spend tons of money. Currently using three other HP monitors, I knew the quality was great. I did not mind this older model, since it was actually newer than all the other three HP monitors we have in our house. They all were working fine, so why wouldn't this one work. It does. Perfectly. If you don't care to have the newest, and you are on a budget, please consider buying older, quality products. You can save TONS of money......like I did.

Title: Good simple basic screen
ReviewText: The most important parts are fine: the case is rigid enough, the swivel tilts enough, all the pixels light up. no flicker that I can notice. I tried the built-in speakers for giggles; they are pretty dire as expected, but they should be serviceable enough if you just need to hear the system beeps and so on.

Title: Excellent monitor for the low price
ReviewText: Excellent monitor for the low price. The just got this today and the manufacturing date is May 2017, this does come with the vga you need, but it has ports in the back for vga or dvi but the dvi wire does not come with it, and the stand does come completely off and has the vesa 100mm holes in the back if you wanted to use a bracket for it and hang it.This is a huge upgrade compared to the one I bought last year which came with nothing and had no vesa holes. The speakers are just okay but if you listen to volume a lot on your comp then I would get some better external speakers for it , and the colors and bright and crisp.

Title: HP 20" LED Monitor
ReviewText: This is a decent monitor at a very modest price. The picture quality is good, and the set up is quite easy. No dead pixels or other damage with the monitor I received. You will probably want to add a pair of speakers as the speakers are pretty poor though. Yes, you can spend a lot more money for HD and a larger screen size, but if you don't have the budget for a really high end monitor, I think you'll find this monitor a very sound investment.

Title: Cheap monitor...
ReviewText: I thought the name HP would mean this was a decent monitor. I wanted a HP monitor with sound and purchased this due to its low price and mostly good reviews. After setting this up as a second monitor, I found that compared to my ancient Gateway monitor, this had poor color quality and basically looked super cheap. I knew at this point that I had made a mistake and should have just spent more money. Then I was unable to get the speakers to come on, but after several hours of trouble-shooting, I finally got sound...terrible quality sound. But, the sound seemed to come and go, and I only got the speakers working twice, before I just gave up on that.

Title: It does the job
ReviewText: This monitor doesn't have a terribly crisp display but if you're using this for work and most of your work involves office apps, adobe docs, and other similar things then this works perfectly fine. Comes with a VGA cable and only has VGA and DVI ports on it, so if you're laptop or dock has neither of those you will have to buy a corresponding cable that will work with it. Also does not adjust for height. It does come with a decently long power cord. If you just need a low-cost no frills extra display for basic tasks then this should fit the bill just fine.

Title: bad laptop and bad service
ReviewText: I was very satisfied with it the first month, looks and works good. After a month, the screen went black, it took me a month to get in touch with services at Lenovo, I sent it for repair, they returned it with a new screen but a damaged keyboard. Now I'm waiting for the repair again to answer me.This is my first experience with Lenovo, I do not know if it is a model issue or a brand issue. I'm a Toshiba and Asus client usually and I have never had to send any of those for repair.

Title: Seems these are all faulty products (battery ptblm.. ...
ReviewText: Seems these are all faulty products (battery prblm...or..physical damage...etc)..bcz i hav purchased the same laptop from Lenova for 599 in February which is working awesome.but this one has battery problem not even coming for 90mins fr 100%charge and full of heat. Hence..returned the product immediately.

Title: Dont buy this machine of cheap quality
ReviewText: Very bad keyboard and quality overall is not good to go with this. Will I buy it again, ofcourse not. Performance is bad it stuck always with just normal browsing, then what's the point in having i7 etc.. Do u still think u can do big computing.. We'll this pc is not for that..

Title: Don`t buy - Battery life sucks
ReviewText: I got it month ago. Battery life sucks!!!!! less than one hour.

Title: Worst laptop I have ever owned
ReviewText: Worst laptop I have ever owned. Cheap plastic. It was a replacement for a similar computer (stolen) and Lenovo could never tell me the serial number of that computer, even though I had registered it with them. The customer service wasn't horrendous, but it certainly wasn't that great.

Title: The glare on the screen is so terrible you can hardly see
ReviewText: Lemon! My husband purchased this computer a year ago and seems to always have problems with it. The battery life is awful- it is either dead or if you leave it plugged in you get a notice that this will destroy the life of the battery. He spends a lot of time restarting it. The glare on the screen is so terrible you can hardly see; we are considering buying an anti-glare screen but I hate to put any money into this piece of junk.

ReviewText: I little bigger than I expected but a great mouse mat.

Title: I feel like I'm ready for competition with this thing!
ReviewText: The nicest mouse pad I've ever used!

Title: Cheaper material than expected from Asus
ReviewText: Does not lay flat after rolled up.

Title: Works great, looks good.
ReviewText: Nice pad that compliments the ASUS laptop and mouse. If you have OCD you need this to ensure everything you are using is the same brand.

Title: Very robust, will only need minor cleaning overtime
ReviewText: Very robust, will only need minor cleaning overtime

Title: So nice the material they use.
ReviewText: Big enough for your mouse but yeah it feel great when you use it.

Title: Great laptop
ReviewText: Love it. This Laptop is meeting all of my demands, super fast log in, it moves. I can edit pictures without the wait, and I have a lot of pictures. It's been good for everything so far.

Title: Fast, reasonably priced laptop - exactly what I wanted
ReviewText: Works great, arrived in one piece, on time, exactly as described. Trackpad can be a little difficult, and the screen quality isn't quite as great as I hoped, but 1) I got the HD version and not the 4k version and 2) I've been spoiled by the Retina Macbook Pros for both trackpads and screens. Screen also looks amazing when playing games, it's only on the desktop where you can notice the lower resolution. Can't beat this for the price - I would recommend it to anybody.

Title: Slow Connection for IntelÂ® Dual Band Wireless-AC 3160
ReviewText: IntelÂ® Dual Band Wireless-AC 3160 has compatibility issues with many wireless routes resulting in slow connections.

Title: In Lenovo's seller promotion this computer look a good product with a hard structure
ReviewText: I bought this laptop.

Title: Five Stars
ReviewText: Excellent computer; fast, solid, handles multiple software packages easily; good for multi-tasking.

Title: very happy
ReviewText: Very happy with the purchase.

Title: Great SFP NIC. Use 24AWG DAC cables!
ReviewText: For those who plan on using SFP DAC cables, it doesn't appear to be terribly picky (requiring $$ intel certified cables). Just make sure you use 24AWG cables, or it won't link.

Title: It has been a very good purchase. I paid $799 for it off our ...
ReviewText: Got this computer about a month ago. It has been a very good purchase. I paid $799 for it off our company website that was offering a corporate promotion. This is not a gaming computer. I bought this computer for personal / business uses. I use financial software, office products, photo editing and video editing software. I have had no problem with any of these. The computer is light (<4.0 lbs). It is sharp looking. The keys on the keyboard feel a bit small. Maybe, they are smaller to fit the number pad to the right. The touchpad is very responsive although I use a wireless mouse for the most part. The WiFi connects fast. It dropped a few times when on battery power. I have had this happen before and changed the power settings so it doesn't happen anymore. The battery is reported to last 10 hours. I have only gotten about 6 hours, but I don't let the screen go dim. I like it brighter. Either way, 6 hours is significantly better than my previous laptop. I really like the touchscreen. The motion sensor and hand gesturing is a neat novelty but not very practical. I like having a solid state drive so that the computer boots up from 'sleep' instantly. That is probably my favorite feature. The screen is very attractive, although I have read reviews that it is not as good as it could have been. It does not have a DVD drive which for me is not a big deal but for some people it might be. The computer does not get warm at all. It stays very cool. There is a lot of useless bloatware that was easy to remove. I would have preferred a TB harddrive, but with the TB cloud storage from Microsoft, who needs a harddrive.

Title: BUY ANOTHER BRAND
ReviewText: DO NOT BUY! Idea Pad U530 touch 2 stars. The reason I give it a 2 is because it is a decent machine. But the hinges are CRAP. It is all over the internet. I am 17 days out of warranty and as so many other people my left hinge broke. I am lucky. I was able to catch it and my screen did not split. CUSTOMER NO SERVICE will let me pay a non refundable DIAGNOSIS fee. I have owned several lap tops, They have all lasted many years and the hard drive always broke. Never he case. So for a $1000. dollar year old computer. I am supposed to spend around 25% of original price. I will never buy another Lenovo and you should not either. BUY ANOTHER BRAND

Title: READ BEFORE CONNECTING YOUR MACBOOK
ReviewText: This monitor is a value for the money. I bought it for aesthetics (I love how sleek it is) and itâ€™s exactly what I wanted. Its picture quality is so inferior to that of my MacBook Pro that I had a hard time adjusting at first. In fact, it was almost shocking. However, Iâ€™m used to it now and donâ€™t mind it as much. For the money this monitor is hard to beat but if youâ€™re accustomed to MacBook screens, you will notice that this monitor is several steps down.

Title: 27" NOT GOOD FOR READING - websites, PDF, Word docs - resolution not adequate for this purpose - probably fine for gaming
ReviewText: 27" monitor review - OK monitor for the price - Terrible for reading but probably fine for gaming and even photo editing. I am impressed by the design and overall it is visually appealing. Also has 2nd HDMI input which I appreciate for adding Roku, etc. Text has a slight grainy appearance that is driving me nuts reading word documents and PDFs so I am returning this. If I sit back 4-5 feet from the monitor it is much better but I bought this for my desk and I just simply can't stand it.

Title: The best monitor in this price range. Better than ones 2x or 3x the price. Good Job HP!
ReviewText: I cannot express how happy I am with this monitor. Its the perfect size for my application, and the speakers aren't "horrible".

Title: Stunning
ReviewText: Clear crisp image, extremely thin monitor. looks space age. I checked it out at Best Buy first (frankly I would've bought it there, but the employees were so busy they ignored me and I was like "this is why Amazon is winning," and I walked out of the store and bought it here). I am using two monitors now, so I needed to buy an extra cable, but if you are just using one you just need an HDMI cable. Really a stunning monitor.

Title: Fast computer.
ReviewText: Very good and beautiful. Fast computer.

Title: NOT genuine Intel card!
ReviewText: If you are looking for a genuine Intel i350T4V2 card, DO NOT buy this one as I received a counterfeit version and it was not even V2! This card did not have "Intel" logos anywhere on the PCB, the printed UPC is for a i350T4, NOT i350T4V2 as advertised. The driver CD is NOT Intel branded, the generic brown cardboard box has no Intel branding whatsoever. The heatsink is smaller compared to the genuine Intel card. PCB components are not genuine Intel either.

Title: Not as advertised
ReviewText: This card is pictured with a full-height adapter plate (riser) and it says "Retail Unit". Showed up in bubble wrap and a little plastic card with only the short adapter attached. Definitely not a "Retail Unit".

Title: Five Stars
ReviewText: Perfect with Pfsense works flawlessly A++

Title: Great nic, too bad Windows 10 still doesent support ...
ReviewText: Great nic, too bad Windows 10 still doesent support teaming or Vlans (Feb 2017 i hear is the magic date)

Title: VMware host
ReviewText: This is a great adapter for a VMware 5.5 ESXI host. Great throughput and easily configurable..

Title: Five Stars
ReviewText: plug and play.

Title: Honestly, One of the best pair of headphones out there!
ReviewText: Best pair of headphones I've ever owned. I haven't owned any expensive pair headphones, but these sound really great. The lower frequency response is subtle. I like it that way as I can clearly hear the vocal ranges. I know other cheap headphones that try to fool customers by reducing the highs, and mid-range, to make the bass standout. On a car speaker, I would like the bass to standout. But not on headphones. Not saying there isn't any bass on these headphones, just saying that its volume is proportionate to the highs and mid-range.

Title: Good pair of headphones for the price
ReviewText: Well just received mine today and test them against my numark redwave carbon must say they both sound good but these JBLs is a better sounding headphone , I needed both and donâ€™t regret it..

Title: Sound good.  Hurt ears if worn too long.
ReviewText: These sound good. There's a tad too much bass, but that can be overcome with EQ on your source. The ear pads hurt after an hour or 2 of wear. With glasses it's even worse. I would love if they were large enough for ears to fit inside so the pads didn't crush my ears. They're great for short sessions though.

Title: Feel cheap
ReviewText: I'm a DJ/producer. Tried them on and instantly didn't like them. I didn't even listen to music through them, because they were just so cheap and ill fitting.

Title: It is a great Headphone set
ReviewText: It is a great Headphone set, on this kind of price. I would recommend to my friends. Nice to have it could be buying another one.

Title: overrated bass but very clear
ReviewText: Very good sound like all JBl's the bass is overrated not as strong as the other people made it sound The wire is a regular aux wire/ 1/8 . I think the look compremises on what you get for sound for 50 dollars

Title: Five Stars

Title: If you want good quality + cheap, get this.
